Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: GoingGlobal79
Reviews.Content: HI Hong Kong Golden Mile is anything but Golden and the property is certainly showing it's age. It is long over due to be shutdown and have a major refurbishment. As PC Platinum benefits are minimal and they need to put some money in the property especially given the prices they are asking now a days. Location is good but for a similar price I would stay elsewhere until they do a complete renovation to bring it up to modern HI standards.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Johnpsau
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on almost 70 occasions over the past 20 years, so not unexpectedly we can refer to it as a home away from home. Many of the staff know us by name, and even if it is some months since a previous visit we are always greeted by name. Lower numbered rooms are away from Nathan Road and quieter. There are a number of eating establishments and the buffet breakfast enough to last well past lunch time. Its location is unbeatable, right on Nathan Road with a multitude of buses, barely 5 minutes walk to the MTR station, maybe 10 minutes walk to the Star Ferry, and also the Tsim Sha Tsui East station and trains into China. There are many shops in close proximity, however be aware that there are tourist prices and there are other prices, so know your price before you start shopping, and bargaining. Make sure the item you get is what you actually expect, and not some "local" model. Adjacent to the hotel is Chungking Mansion with many legitimate, no coimmission foreign exchange outlets; don't go to others in the street who all charge commission and have much worse exchange rates. You'll also find many small shops and restaurants in this building, but take care of your belongings, as you would anywhere you might travel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RezC_12
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a pleasant stay here. Best thing is the location, very convenient for sightseeing/shopping. We just walked to/from the malls, to/from the night market at Temple Street, as well as to the China Ferry Terminal (where we took the ferry to Macau after checkout). Also near Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. Efficient check-in and check-out, perhaps because my husband is a Priority Club member. We only had one issue during our stay. We found a cut toenail on the carpet! I was walking barefoot and stepped on it. it's quite big & sharp, a cut big toe toenail. It seemed the carpet wasn't vacuumed well. We informed management, and hopefully housekeeping staff would take more care and effort in cleaning the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: stokeswest
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel every time I come to Hong Kong on business -about every six weeks. Great central location but the rooms are so confortable. Being a Platinum member I get free breakfast and free wifi, Hotel is very well maintained and the staff are first class. Probably the best Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Romo6
Reviews.Content: I spent two weekends at the Golden Mile and found it to be very convenient for visiting Kowloon. Tsim Sha Sui Station on the MTR - which has got to be one of the best transportation systems in the world! Get an Octpus card from MTR and start traveling. The K11 Shopping Center is across Mody Road and has several restaurants, a grocery store and convenient shopping. A few blocks down and Hart Avenue has several good European pubs with a nice selection of draft beers. The hotel is very good, nothing really outstanding about the rooms - they were clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and very prompt to help when I needed it. I skipped the breakfast as there are so many great restaurants near by - Agnes at K 11 has excellent western food at very reasonable prices - great coffee too! Had one beer at Hari's - was okay but much better options elsewhere and the food at Hari's is very average... Overall I would recomend the hotel if you are looking for a central location in Kowloon - the streets are busy at all hours of the day - but your in the middle of everything... Also it seemed as if every Friday and Saturday night the hotel had a wedding party - gets pretty crowded on the elevators at times.

Reviews.Title: “I wish there was a 3 1/2 star rating...”
Reviews.Author: 3GDude
Reviews.Content: What makes this place great is location. What makes it terrible is location. You're in the middle of everything in Kowloon but after all these years traveling to Hong Kong I think I'd rather be in Central (my opinion only). The hotel itself seems updated, the rooms are clean and quite a bit upscale for a Holiday Inn. It is about a 10-15 minute taxi ride from the airport express station (depending on traffic). Pool was ok, gym above average. Didn't sample the restaurants since there are so many in the area. Not a lot to say on this place but the bar did have a lot of nightlife if you are there for that kind of thing. Saw a lot of families here, might not be bad for that. Overall it's a good value in Hong Kong, but next time I'm staying on the island ....

Reviews.Title: “Great (again !!)”
Reviews.Author: gs-aussie
Reviews.Content: I luv this place. Friendly, easy access, great location. 5 star quality food. ONly one point... if you have a young child, or for any other reason you require a BATH, check the room configuration first. Most newly renovated room now have NO bath.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoied it!”
Reviews.Author: kaka73
Reviews.Content: I and my family stayed at Holiday Inn on 19/20 Aug 2012 and everything was really good! At the first moment when we arrived at the lobby, everything seemed crawded but the staff was very helpfull and did our checking very quicly and asked us to wait at the beakfast up to our room be ready @ 40min after (we arrived much earlier than the check in time). Breakfast delicious! The staff offerd us, for a resonable price, an upgrade of our room. Tha was terrific, because I have small baby. When Inarrive at my room, the baby cot was there!! That's was very good! All the hotel ammenities and service were very nice and special. The location is terrific, easy access to MRT or taxi. Many "things to do" near by walking distance. So, amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in hong kong”
Reviews.Author: manilabiker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in Hongkong but this hotel is tops for me. they have big and cozy rooms, their breakfast was good and their location is also very nice. there is a convenience store accross the hotell and shopping areound the area is awesome

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient location !”
Reviews.Author: sunnyvk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel more than 3 times. The USP of this hotel is its Location with easy access to MRT, Various shops, Harbour, Ferry etc. The hotel looks old from outside and to some extent inside but well maintained and kept clean always. The Room is quite huge and bed very comfortable. Only once did i have to wait for more than 40minutes for Checking it other wise usually its very quick with Attentive staff and excellent Room service. I have never taken the Breakfast package due to very good Restaurants and other food options available. But plan to give it a shot next trip this comming Dec., Overall its good Value for money and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: The_TravellerSg
Reviews.Content: Having been to Hong Kong for many times (3 trips this year), I have never expected myself to be staying right in the middle of the action...right along Nathan Road!! Having passed by the hotel several times in my past trips, I have never took notice of this hotel as it is kind of housed in surrounding buildings. First of all, the hotel is old but decently kept. By any standard, the room of the hotel is one of the biggest I have seen in Hong Kong and it is spacious. Check in was a breeze considering they have several counters for that. On the whole, the hotel gave me a feeling done it has been around for some time but this is not an issue because in Hong Kong, one hardly stays in the room!! The location is superb as you are practically in the midst of action with less than 2 minutes to the MTR station and also short walking distance to Habour City. Due to the size of the room, somehow I have a very comforting feeling which is mainly because most rooms in hotel is extremely compact, and this hotel room is huge. Another first for me is to have breakfast in hotels in Hong Kong Due to the choices of food in Hong Kong, I have never chose a package inclusive of breakfast but this time round, the room came with breakfast so I must say the experience is new as well. However perhaps again as possibly I am not interested in the food at the hotel, it does not entice me. However, from a perspective of a frequent business traveller, the choice is good :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CliffDC
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a business trip to Hong Kong and have stayed at this hotel a number of times. The location is excellent with an underground train station directly outside the front door and the Star ferry within easy walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful and the bedroom and clean and everything worked. I would be happy to stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great little pool, very tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: I had doubts about booking here as it had not been possible to get 2 adults and 2 kids booked into a 2x double bedded room on room only basis. The maximum occupancy being stated as 3. In the end I risked it and the hotel did not say anything on arrival and even provided 4 drinks vouchers. The lobby is large and welcoming but the room we had on the 15th floor was tired and very very small. It did however suit us for the 2 nights. Status was recognised but there was no upgrade, no breakfast and no Internet until we asked, at which point Internet access was given. I remain  firmly of the view that wi if Internet access today  should be included in all hotel rates. It is now an essential requirements rather than some luxury add on. The following morning we went to have breakfast however the buffet would have set us back over $110 USD for 4 and the was not going to happen. My kids eat little and there is no kids eat free policy here. The room was basic but provided all the usual needs. The was some complimentary water however any subsequent water had to be paid for. The staff I met were efficient but not friendly, very Hong Kong in my view. The is a small pool on the roof which was great but could be open longer. Overall nothing outstanding and nothing to make you want to return. Given the influx from the mainland i suspect tha occupancy rates will remain high resulting in falling service standards and ever increasing room rates. The location  is great being a short walk to the star ferry And in the heart of a retail heaven. I think however that it is a very average hotel and the are better in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Hong kong Holiday inn - great value!”
Reviews.Author: kim c
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 2 kids 13 and 9) stayed in the Holiday Inn in Aug 2012, the hotel is manned by staff with impeccable manners they are helpful and polite and a credit to the hotel. The hotel itself was spotless clean everywhere, the children enjoyed the use of the roof top pool which provided huge towels and had a poolside bar. The buffet breakfast had everything you could think of it was beautifully presented and tasted great. Even though the hotel is in the middle of the golden mile there was no noise to disturb you and it was incredibly handy for travel, shops, subway etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: schapeli
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient check in, took the room upgrade again which they offered me last visit also. The upgrade room is large, clean and well serviced by friendly and efficient cleaning staff. Breakfast was included in the upgrade either in the Executive Club or restaurant; I used both and had no complaints with either. The upgrade also gives access to the Executive Club throughout the day for coffee and cakes and drinks and good selection of food from 6pm each evening. The only problem I noticed with that this year was the number of children now in the club. Their handling of the food without supervision of adults left a lot to be desired and sometimes meant you wouldn't eat the food after the children had handled it inappropriately with their fingers or coughed and sneezed all over it. I would suggest the club is adults only. Haris bar was good but sometimes the overstressed waitress got a little bossy with customers and you could wait a very long time for service. It was good to see the Hotel also managed to hang on to some of their most valuable employees who I remembered from last year, bravo to Sandy, an asset to the Hotel. I would recommend the Hotel and its location and I will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: phalak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights considering it would be easy for us to shop around as it is in the market area but seriously it was really a bad experience staying here. The rooms are ok but the mattress on the bed was hard and uncomfortable ,the pillows were also very uncomfortable ,apart from that we could not sleep the whole night as the noise was coming from outside, you could even here the noise from then next room,I cannot believe this that such a hotel could be like this . Really I will never suggest anybody to stay in this hotel. Though from its appearance one could not make out that it would be so uncomfortable from inside.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Mile, Golden Stay”
Reviews.Author: PolarJDT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The lobby was dark and gloomy, the building old and tired. But don't let that fool you. The rooms are nice and breakfast was incredible! The hotel is across the street from the MTR (local train), and very near the huge Ocean Terminal Harborview Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this place”
Reviews.Author: ColonelG
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a good location in a great city. The hotel staff checked us in and things ran smoothly, there is a lovely smell in the whole reception area, lovely! They offered me an upgrade to a refurbished room for an extra HK$200 per night which I declined, I guess eventually the whole place will end up refurbished anyway! The room was spacious and although in need of a refurb (which is clearly on its way) it was clean and nice. The location is fabulous and you couldn't really ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and good service”
Reviews.Author: serum121
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel for work and pleasure in Hong Kong, located on Nathan road a few hundred yards from the MTR and close to all the shopping and eating you want it is ideal in any kind of weather. The executive lounge is another big plus offering breakfast , snacks and drinks in the evenings, makes it really convenient to have brief meetings or just enjoy a cup of tea or a glass of wine in the evening. The Italian restaurant is also excellent. Opt for an executive floor and room to get the maximum benefits

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in middle of shopping district”
Reviews.Author: Docvini
Reviews.Content: Location - Excellent, Tsimshasui is the shopping hub of HK, 100mtrs from Bay view, 10mtrs from Underground MTR, all major markets and malls with in 2km (walking distance). Room - We were couple with 2 kids, room had 2 beds of queen size, comfortable and clean beds, view outside was a shopping street with building in front, bathrooms were good size, very clean with enough amenities. Swimming Pool - Rooftop with great view, kids and we enjoyed the swim a lot. Food - Only had breakfast, good variety in Buffet, had various kinds of dishes with all standard things, egg station, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: Due33
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is located on Nathan Road, famous shopping area in Hong Kong. It's really convenient for us as we went there for whole Island sale on July which found many shops nearby are on sale. I Square and K11 are just stoned throw from the hotel, I really love The Art Mall "K11" which contained numerous of creative stuffs also my favourite brand : Onitsuka Tiger! :) Closed to Tsim Sha Tsui Station is a plus for the hotel, easy access to majority tourism places. The service is up to the standard of Holiday Inn, staffs are very friendly! Will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: beemail
Reviews.Content: Nothing to cry home about but the location is excellent. I was able to walk late at night to enjoy my dining experience it was so centrally located. The hotel seems soooo busy all the time. Unlike other holiday inns I stayed in before, the front desk staff didnt seem so friendly. And for Americans that never stayed at a Holiday Inn outside of the country, this is compared to your four diamond hotels in the States...its way nicer than the ones in the US. I've stayed at two other HI in the past including Australia an enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: arlomcc
Reviews.Content: The reception is crazy at times, far too many people checking in. However, after you get to your room very all very quiet. Rooms small, but high level of cleaning. Executive club staff very good, food and drink generous. Buffet Breakfast also very generous Easy location. Health club equipment new. I'd stay here again for a few days. .

Reviews.Title: “Fine accomodation in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Harshawardhan
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is situated in the best locales of Hong Kong. This is situated on the Nathan Road very near the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station and the famous Victoria Harbour in Kowloon and the Star Ferry is just 5 minutes away. This hotel is situated at a place in Tsim Sha Tsui district which is the centre of all activities of Kowloon. As a privilege member of the ICHotels group I got a room upgrade, free internet, welcome drink and a fruit basket. The rooms are great and the service of the staff is quite responsive but not to the mark as I will explain below. As I was on a business trip, the conference was held at the hotel itself. The hotel is managed very meticulously and the conference went out without a glitch. They have a huge halls to accommodate almost a 700 to 1000 people. The wonderful banquet was managed very well. I have a small complaint against the staff of the hotel as I found they were misinformed about the local events and the transportation. Fortunately or unfortunately it was the 15th anniversary of the Chinese takeover when I was there and I was very excited at the anticipation to see Hu Zintao who was attending the celebrations in HK. Just beside the hotel at the Victoria harbour were all the fireworks took place. I was allowed a late check - out from the hotel that evening but because of the rush of the 15th year celebrations at the Victoria Harbour every road to Tsim sha tsui and the MTR Station was blocked. I had an International flight to catch and had to rush to the airport, the hotel staff was not at all helpful they feigned ignorance abiut the transport available and did not even direct me anywhere or helped me get any taxi or to the underground train. I had to walk to the Sheraton Hotel (which is about 500 mts away) tagging all my luggage where the helpful staff directed me to take the Airport Express and helped me buy a ticket. One of their staff helped me to find my way to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station in the mad rush and after changing 4 lines (mistaking I took one wrong train) I was at the airport in time for my flight. Just staying in a good hotel with an uninformed and unhelpful staff is of no use, but the hotel is located at a great place close to the Victoria harbour which has overshadowed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD & EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: suken2011
Reviews.Content: Its good and convenient loction its in good price also and near to shopping areas staff of holiday inn is also helpful buffewt breakfast is also good room is to clean i spend almost 6 to 7 night and i refer to all my friend s once u stay in holiday inn golden mile

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Geoff J
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July with 2 x kids , the standard or run of the mill room as they call it is pretty small as you would expect in Hong Kong , we only had 5 nights and didn't spend much time in the room so not an issue. Rooms clean and staff friendly. Buffet Breakfast is great and plenty of choice for fussy kids. Rooftop pool was small but never crowded , a perfect way to cool off early afternoon and enjoy a cold beer after a hard day sight seeing. My only tip is don't go to HK in July , way too hot , kids found it hard to cope with hustle and bustle as well as high 30º temps

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Karjanmed
Reviews.Content: Checked in after long flight and an immigration weight of 45 mins. Took the airport express( buy the group ticket which is cheaper- group of 2 is 140 as against two separate ones at Hkd 180 and get down at kowloon which would be the 2nd stop. There is free shutlle bus which takes you from there on. Holiday inn is the first stop and takes 20-25 mins in all). If you plan to travel by MTR... Which you will unless you want to blow it on cab, buy the octupus card and you will get the refund for the kids when you leave HKG. I had used my reward miles to book the rooms and being a platinum member requested for upgrade. The staff was nice but firmly denied. They did give me free Internet access through out my stay. I wouldn't recommend the breakfast at the hotel unless you are staying at club lounge where breakfast is free. The breakfast is hkd$240 which is a little too much by any standards. Once you walk out on Nathan rd there is plenty of options including Mccdonalds. Room and lobby sizes are decent given Hong Kong standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graham G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in excess of 20 nights in the last few years. I keep returning for the location and friendly staff, not for the rooms which are tired and in need of refurbishment. The location is amazing! You step out of the hotel into the booming heart (and humidity) of Kowloon and Nathan Road! Bright signs, overpowering smells and bustling people all around! Avoid the street sales men, you can spot them a mile off but they will always spot you sooner, expect copy Rolex, shirts, suits, leather goods the lot, don't bother saying no thanks they don't listen. AVOID going into Chungking Mansions which is next to the hotel and I can't stress this enough, it’s a flea pit with overpowering, slightly aggressive sales people and restaurant owners, its intimidating and nothing any good is in there. The food in and around the hotel is great and its cheap if you wander 1-2 streets away. In the bars also be aware of friendly local women paying you great interest, they are "ladies of the night", and they also work the hotel bars including the holiday inn. The breakfast in the hotel is never boring, they rotate the selection every morning, between three menus so there's a selection if you stay there a long period. The staff is friendly beyond belief, they show you to your room, look after you, present you with business cards and will check up on your stay. They cannot do enough for you and do their best to make your stay the best they can. Finally as I said, the rooms are tired and in need of a refurbishment, no matter where you stay in the hotel they are all similar, so an "upgrade" doesn't mean a great deal. That said they are comfortable, the air-conditioning is good in the hot weather and they are quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location,”
Reviews.Author: Ggwestcoastfin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a safe area. It is excellent for business and private meetings. It was practical for shopping and commercial activities. The food was great. The rooms were super clean and excellent. The service was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Libor11
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel for short bussines trip. Hotel servis was excellent, personal is very friendly and open to help you for every open questions. Highly recommended for your trip. This is a good place to stay for the first timers to Hong Kong. Libor

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: TimoR313
Reviews.Content: As a first-timer to Hong Kong I wanted a well located hotel with good access to attractions and activities. This hotel certainly provides that, located on Nathan Rd with the MTR adjacent, walking distance to Star Ferry and most of Kowloon shopping. Due to height and location there are no views aside from adjacent buildings or the street. The room was a good size and very well maintained as expected in a Holiday Inn property. Note that there is no free WiFi in the room. Hari's bar is a nice place for a drink early evening, with a reasonable live music, however becomes a hangout for hookers later in the evening. The rooftop pool looks good. Exchange rate in the hotel was surprisingly competitive - better than the rate in the nearby streets. Recommended for anyone wanting reasonable value in in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location Shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: Vinniesyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the thick of Kowloon. Transport is at the doorstep, friendly staff and possibly the Best Breaskast Buffet I have ever had. Unfortunately the beds need replacing as they sagged into the middle otherwise I would have rated this hotel as excellent. The hotel is an easy walk to the Star ferry and the Harbour. Be sure not to miss the light show on the harbour every night commencing at 8pm. Great money exchange a few doors down. Would I stay there again sure would. Close to restaurants and good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonably priced hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: Stevetinton
Reviews.Content: A impressive hotel for what you pay. Good location, near to MTR and Kowloon sights and shops. Good size rooms for HK. Rooms quiet and very clean. Bar with music and other entertainment. Cramped public areas but this is not a problem. If you do not want to stay in one of the expensive 5 star hotels in HK then give this hotel a try. I have returned and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet Dinner at Holiday Inn,Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Siraj S
Reviews.Content: Quite good experienced.Jammed pack restaurant have to wait for your turn.Started with chilled beer and wine with the family to dine.Atmosphere quite good.Staff excellent.Food quality quite good.Specially I had my grandson baby who they offered Konji...Superb....

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: s_de_gurgaon
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Golden Mile is situated in an excellent location and every thing seems to be in a hands reach . Hotel rooms are good and comfortable . Buffet breakfast has excellent variety and range. Kids loved the bottled fresh juice . It was good to see some indian menu in daily breakfast spread and it was good. Only thing which is missing is view . You can not see anything from your hotel rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong, up close and busy”
Reviews.Author: coldweatherman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at least 20 times at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile in Hong Kong...it has now become my "go to" place every time I visit the city. It sits at the very heart of the shopping district in Kowloon...from the flash of world renown designer shops to small mom-and-pop cultural displays...all are there. Just step out the door of the Golden Mile and you are at what ever you want! Smells and aromas engulf you at every turn. No matter which way you walk, it will seem as if you are going against the flow! My wife says, "Hong Kong is New York on steroids!" The regular rooms are just that, regular. The executive rooms are a real step up. Very nice with free business amenities. Front desk staff very friendly and efficient. Be prepared to tip the door staff that take your bags out of the taxi into the hotel. Then you will tip another staff member that then takes your bags to your room. Getting dollars exchanged at the airport makes it all go a bit smoother. The morning buffet is exceptional...but very pricey! American or Asian...but at $36US per person, be sure you are hungry enough to enjoy it. If you have children, McDonald's is only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and so well located”
Reviews.Author: CactusRose
Reviews.Content: We returned for our third stay last week - again taking adjoining rooms as we had our two daughters with us. Rooms have everything you could want and are clean and well serviced. I don't recall this from previous stays - but the only bedding was a covered duvet - which wasn't really suitable for the climate. Bedding had no top sheets - so the only option was to crank the air conditioning up high enough to sleep with the duvet on, which seems odd. Excellent pillows though - which isn't the case in many hotels. Room staff are friendly, but the front counter staff are cool and not in the least welcoming. The biggest plus for this hotel though is its location - slap bang in the middle of the madness of Nathan Road and with an MTR station right outside. Didn't try any of the restaurants, but did use our complimentary drinks vouchers in the hotel bar - which was very pleasant. We would definitely return to this hotel - with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Mikael D
Reviews.Content: Rooms are bigger than your average HK hotel room. There's also a very good Italian restaurant at the 2F. Theres an MTR station just outside the hotel. You'll also find the best money changer there is. There's restaurants all over and lots of shopping. A couple of blocks away, you'll also find the Harbor City Mall. And the best thing for me about this hotel is that it's not that you get the most value from your penny.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here. Good location. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nonnino
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here on my trips to Hong Kong for the last year or so. I have never been disappointed with the rooms or service. Most rooms have been updated to the latest comfy bed, and amenities. the Air conditioning, a must for me in warm climates, is cold and powerful. the restaurants, bar, and breakfast are excellent. good quality of food and service. the Club Lounge is a good option for frequent travelers. Full breakfast bar and eggs cooked to order by the attending chef. Also a nice area to have a meeting, or just relax during the day. the hotel is right on Nathan Rd, almost across the street from the Pennisula, in the middle of the TST district with loads of shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing. Right on a subway stop if you are in to using that transportation method. About a 260 HK$ ride from the airport , or much cheaper options using the train and bus mode. Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: memeEye
Reviews.Content: I have been there for business and with the family. For business it is well priced and delivers value. Great service; great food, including the cantonese restaurant in the sub-basement. The breakfast buffet is unbelievable for the price you pay; the rooms are spacious but pretty much standard. The location is unique, right in the middle of TST; on top of both the rail and metro; very easy to navigate to or from and good access to the airport including the airport express shuttle in TST. Rooftop pool is a great bonus in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Mine at tsim sha tsui”
Reviews.Author: G0ds_own_country
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel, great food, absolutely commendable hospitality, walking distance to avenue of the stars and the ferry terminal. Close to subway stations. Shopping district. Being a business class hotel, the bar had some really good live music. Absolutely enjoyed every day of my 1 week stay. I am returning back to gold mine ( golden mile )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at a prime location”
Reviews.Author: prateeksethi
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel at the best location. Situated in TST, all the necessary places are just at walking distance. TST metro station and 7-eleven are the nearest. In the evening, we walked down to Avenue of Stars. We just needed to cross the main street and we were there. We booked a 2-twin bed room as we were 4 pax. which included 2 children of 9 years each. The hotel management agreed to accomodate 4 pax in one room, which was really helpful. The room size was decent enough. Breakfast menu had Indian dishes also. That really helped. Will surely stay in this hotel whenever we plan to visit next time.

Reviews.Title: “Old but well located”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-Raja
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel with not very nice rooms. But location wise it is excellent as it is in centre of the market area. Food was very good. The looby is very unattractive & check in is lengthy. Not great service either. Rooms are of good size but very old with not great carpet. View is nothing at all. We could get Indian vegeterian food for my colleague & they have an Indian chef to help you. Room service was quite good too with timely response & good food.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and a good experience”
Reviews.Author: navin n
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for first time visitors, ideally located and excellent service. Rooms are really large and spacious. Most of the places for shopping, business and transport are at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Well Used but Fantastic Location with Warm Service”
Reviews.Author: Speckypilot
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 - 2 adults with 2 kids aged 6 and 3. We booked a room with 2 double beds. The bedding configuration was the main reason why we chose this hotel. The room was clean and quiet although well-used. Carpet was old. Furniture was dated. The air quality especially along the corridor was not the best we hoped for. The room overlooked the rooftop of another building which was partially filled with rubbish. Not a beautiful sight. However, the staff that we met from checking-in to house-keeping to the waiters/waitresses at the restaurant for buffet breakfast were warm, friendly and helpful. The breafast buffet spread was good. The kids loved the eggs and potatoes. The hotel is right in the middle of the city. Tsim Sha Tsui MTR is right next door that connects to every part of Hong Kong. We made 2 day trips to Hong Kong Disneyland using the MTR. It is also within walking distance to Harbourcity where good shopping and restaurants are located. iSquare is right across the main street where there is Jason's marketplace, Starbucks Coffee and free wifi. Overall, it was a pleasant experience staying in this hotel. We had good sleep, satisfying breakfasts and convenient connectivity to where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT HOTEL IN THE HEART OF KOWLOON”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAlam
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed a countless number of times at this property. My most recent visit was a few days ago. The location is the best in Honk Kong: In the heart of Kowloon, right by the Tsim Sha Tsui MRT Station, on Nathan Road and Mody Road. There is lots of great restaurant and shopping nearby. The rooms are excellent, the restaurants are excellent. The staff are very polite, helpful and friendly. I will keep on coming back here as this is my choicest place to stay in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SonnyAng
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is our home in Hong Kong. Location, Location, Location. You are in the middle of everything. In front/beside the MTR/subway entrances, the MTR is the fastest way to navigate Hong Kong. One stop away is Island side. So if you have appointments for both the Island side & the Kowloon side, this is a great hotel to consider. It might not be new but the level of service is so high that it can compete with luxury 5 star hotels. If you have some budget, try the Executive Floor where the level of service is impeccable. If your budget is tight, get the Premier rooms which are newly renovated. I will highly recommend this hotel & will stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worse, but the 2nd worst holiday inn I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: Tysin30
Reviews.Content: As always I just like to provide honest reviews of the hotels that I visit, this hotel is certainly not up to scratch in many areas, especially for the 1700 HK price per night/room! I just checked out of the lovely Crowne Plaza Hong Kong at Causeway Bay, which is around 2200 HK per night, as I am conducting a conference at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile Kowloon. Experience in the first 24 hours - * Check In was acceptable, nothing special but acceptable, they did not offer me any upgrade to the club floor which I would typically receive at Intercontinental properties, but that is fine I can only assume that the hotel was full of Royal Ambassador members. * Visited the Hotel Bar, Hari's it is Ok, actually nothing special, more like a room with chairs in it and full of people as it is not very big, could not get a seat on the second visit so walked up the road to the bar area at the steps, it is very nice, the hotel bar did have a philippine band playing, but honestly they were perhaps the worse philippine band i have ever heard, they were average and did give me a headache before i had my first drink * Breakfast is pretty good, some good options, the buffet items looked a little tried out, not fresh, but the lady that was training and doing the coffee was very nice and helpful * Hotel rooms (1118) is pretty average, i checked some of the rooms out that are more basic, they are terrible, i was upgraded to a slightly better room but had two small double (lets call them single) beds, the rooms are old, average, have no view, terrible bathrooms, etc in terms of room quality only the holiday inn in sheffield england is worse. * Just returned to the room where it sounds like major rennovations are taking place in the room next door, banging, drilling, etc it is 11am, was planning to make a business call and join a meeting, but since the noise is so bad could not join the call, rang the manager at the front desk to ask if they could hold off the banging until my call finished, she suggested i change rooms haha * Hotel location is pretty good, nathan rd, but honestly i do not like kowloon, it is much better on the island for me personally I would certainly suggest if you are after a nice affordable hotel in Kowloon then do not stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile, it is not cheap, it is not nice and the service is nothing special, just average really. Hope this information helps :>)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAJU L
Reviews.Content: We had planned a three day break in Hongkong and were looking for a triple room. The room was exactly as we had wanted in. Layout of a triple allows a family a six to share two triple rooms, a common door allows privacy to both triple room simultaneosly. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Take the room with breakfast- property rolls out a decent breakfast. The hotel is extremely well located- close to all shopping destinations, MTR, Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: Melissa F
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Golden Mile last night on our way to London. Awesome experience. Everyone friendly. Check in and out a breeze. Would definitely stay again. So central to everything. Clean comfy and generally great.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: flitting_bird
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a solid location smack right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui area and very near the MTR and the train to Shenzhen. It is an old hotel though. The moment I stepped out of the lift on the 15th floor, there was a kind of musty, damp smell in the air - I call it the 'old hotel smell' Booked a deluxe room using points. Got exactly that. No upgrade or free breakfast for PC Platinum members though they gave me free internet. Wasn't bothered by no breakfast, plenty of options and local food all around. Room was pretty spacious, bathroom was decent, bed was comfortable, stuff was all in working order, toiletries were typical Holiday Inn/Crowne Plaza stuff. Despite the age of the hotel, it is still in pretty good nick. Drawbacks - no view whatsoever, unless u consider looking at the roof or windows of opposite apartments/buildings any sort of decent view. Not bothered as didn't spend much time in the room anyway. There was again the typical 'old hotel smell' to the rooms but got used to it pretty quickly and didn't notice it after a while. Check in and check out took a while - seemed a bit undermanned at reception or maybe it was when I arrived there was a huge group of people checking in at that time. I stayed here this time as I wanted to make use of the points building up in my account before they get devalued again and it cost only half of what the 2 intercontinentals would have cost though the Intercontinental is in different class altogether. I wouldn't mind staying here again though there are really better choices in the area which are significantly more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the complaining is about.....”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the HI Golden Mile twice. In March 2011 and again in April 2012. I will admit it was in the Executive Club grade but my experience was far removed from some of the other reviews here. The check in for exec club is separate from the rest. This makes for super efficient and super friendly and polite check in. I always feel really special when having any contact with the staff on this level. Food is excellent and the general feel of the place is great. Room are huge for Hong Kong and beds, pillows are comfortable. Obviously you won't get a panoramic view from many hotels in this area and this one is no different. I come here on business so don't general sit and look out of the window. Shopping is excellent in this area. Very busy sidewalks most time of the day and requests of "tailor sir" are common. Coming from South Africa, dodgy looking characters are common place so this is not a problem. I wouldn't let my guard down but I really don't think any of them are truly dangerous in any way. A simple "no thanks" is enough to get rid of any fake Rolex salesman or pimp. As others have said, the turn down service is a nice extra. Haris bar is quite entertaining even if it is too just sit and watch the "goings on" Will probably stay here again as it is in a really great area. I wouldn't say its cheap but most other hotels which have Club level charge similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if you would like to be in very busy Nathan road.”
Reviews.Author: paula c
Reviews.Content: Very nice comfortable room with small bathroom, surprisingly quiet. But on the street we struggled to cope with the retailers bothering us at every opportunity, very exhausting spoilt the shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: 2Ushers
Reviews.Content: Checkin super easy staff very efficient, took offered upgrade which gave us a superior room, unlimited access to the Executive club,free wifi and full american breakfast highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, popular with tour groups”
Reviews.Author: DSMtravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and found the check in quick and the clerk helpful. Other times during the day the lobby was very crowded. This hotel was a bit pricy, but I guess Hong Kong is expensive and this hotel is less costly than most. It is clean and the staff are helpful. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with many different cuisines including Japanese, Indian, American, English and Chinese. But it is not included and rather expensive. Because of the price, next time we will try the YMCA which is very nearby and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: preegift
Reviews.Content: The most positive thing about this hotel is probably the location! Everything is at your doorstep. The staffs are friendly and helpful except for Ben (reception on training). He's the worst staff Ive ever encountered! Not welcoming at all and he even had tantrums when we wanted to change room. The girls at reception (esp Flora) are very welcoming and always willing to help. The rooms are good size and the amenities are great. Would definitely come back next time Im in HK. Cant say enough about the location here! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “There are better Places to stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: Very over priced and very noisey...Lobby is an ant hill and reception is to busy and you will never see a smile.. I have tried this hotel a few times due to collecting priority points but have always left wih the impression of why did I stay there..Very over priced for what you get and no benefits extended to members.There it is charge you for everything and than watch you bill and make sure you were not double charged. Nothing extra in the rooms on the cub floor except they need to be remodled and cleaned..Great location...

Reviews.Title: “Great position but shows it age”
Reviews.Author: BNE101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and was upgraded to a corner room with larger space. The service was good and restaurant was very good. The rooms are dated and need major renovation not just beds!!! Great position.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out were quick and easy. The hotel is a great place to stay in an excellent location on Nathan Road. The room was large - and that is a huge bonus in Hong Kong where hotel rooms are notoriously small and expensive. I loved the spacious room. Tea & coffee making facilities were provided. Bathroom was modern with walk-in shower. Breakfast was excellent with a huge variety of food. After having stayed at this hotel I wouldn't consider staying at any other hotel in Hong Kong. One general tip for staying at a hotel in Hong Kong: don't stay on the island. Everything is at Kowloon and the traffic jams can be horrendous getting from the island to Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: steveck
Reviews.Content: From the outset, this was probably the wrong hotel for a business stay. This Holiday Inn is right in the middle of the Nathan Road tourist traps, and the noise in the hotel reflected this. Had I been on vacation, I may feel differently towards the hotel. Unlike other Holiday Inns, there was no benefit extended to platinum priority club members. At the desk, I was offered free Internet, but this was included in my room rate anyway. No lounge access was available, and had this been clear earlier, I likely would not have booked here, as I did require space to hold meetings. The check in process was long, and initial room I was given was sub-standard. On going back to reception and complaining, a refurbished room had suddenly become available. Refurbished rooms are a definite improvement, and you should insist on one when booking here. Though partly over a weekend, hotel smelled of beer and smoke on floors and in lifts. Did not use gym and other facilities, but have heard from others that they are good quality. So consider this for a shopping trip to HK, otherwise, I'd personally skip it in future.

Reviews.Title: “Hongkong hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHAYNE T
Reviews.Content: Close to all amenities including transport and restaurants Nice pool area that actually gets sun Great Breakfast Rooms are finished well and clean Staff are friendly and helpful ....bizness center staff are excellent ...meeting rooms and service are good another pleasant easy place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Place”
Reviews.Author: KruthiBangalore
Reviews.Content: Great place to be in. Good spacious rooms. Good Food. Very well located. Good Service. For the price we pay this is great luxory. It is very conviniently located for traveling within the city. The Hotel staff is very courteous and check in and check out was done very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction, service, rates and room”
Reviews.Author: kewlmeister
Reviews.Content: My Stay Checked into the Holiday Inn Golden Mile (HIGM) with my wife on 28/4/12 after returning from Macau (where we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in City of Dreams casino/resort – read my Trip Advisor review). The HIGM is located right on the very busy & vibrant Nathan Road (Tsim Tsa Tsui shopping belt) of Kowloon. We disembarked the Macau-HK ferry at the China-HK City ferry terminal and unwisely decided to walk from there along Canton Road then Peking Road to the HIGM instead of catching a taxi. It turned out to be quite an unpleasant walk. Lugging our luggage and weaving through crowded streets in the late spring HK hot and humid weather. It took us about 20-25 minutes. Tip: If you have luggage with you in HK always take a taxi which is very affordable. Even if you think it’s only a short distance. Check-In We arrived at the HIGM feeling hot and sweaty around 2:00pm, its designated check-in time. Hence the reception desk is very busy with other guests also checking in. It was about ten minutes wait before we were attended to by a smiling reception person (Ms Denis). By then I was unreasonably agitated and unjustifiably complained about the “long” wait. To her great credit she continued her pleasant disposition with us and had me calmed down very quickly. Her skill in pacifying a difficult guest (ie myself) is indeed excellent. The HIGM is most fortunate to have person like her on their staff. She is certainly well suited to be in hospitality work. I take this opportunity to apologise to her for my unwarranted rudeness. The Room There is no view to speak of from our Deluxe King room on the 5th floor. Look out the window and we were “voyeuring” into the apartments of the building across the narrow street. But that was more than compensated by the space afforded in room and its bathroom. It’s a rarity for a standard hotel room by HK/Kowloon standard. There is even space for a workspace and desk. We felt it was very comfortable. We slept well on the bed and pillows. Haris Bar Located on the 1st or 2nd floor, it’s a pleasant place to have a drink or two in. Average price for a drink is HK$80-100. Happy hour is round about 6:00pm to 8:30pm. It has a “L” shape layout with the bar counter and live music performance stage at the “short side”. When we were there (abt 9:00pm on a weekday night) it was quiet with not many guests. There was live music performance on. We were served by a female staff. She was quite unwelcoming in her manner. Her response to my order for a lime juice margarita was a curt “we only have lemon juice”. Either she is having a bad night or she is one of those person unsuited to hospitality work but do so at the guests expense. We only stayed for 10mins without finishing my lemon juice margarita.  Dining There are 3 (or 4?) restaurants which we did not dine at with the abundance of dining places just within walking distance of the HIGM. So can’t really comment on them. Housekeeping Fine work done by the HIGM housekeeping team. Coming back from shopping after a couple of hours and the bed was already made and the room cleaned/tidied. Pool Not even sure they have one, but think there is. No comment. Shopping The HIGM is located toward the south end of Kowloon’s Nathan Road smack in the midst of Tsim Tsa Tsui shopping belt. So there are no shortage shops and malls nearby and withi walking. The Harbour City mall (one of if not the largest in HK/Kowloon) is only abou 10-15 mins walk and two streets away. The K101 and iSquare and malls are both just 5mins walk away. So if the sole intent for your holiday in HK is to shop till drop, then the HIGM is certainly a very convenient hotel to be staying it. When your arms are already filled with shopping bags you can simply go drop them off in the room, rest the feet a bit and be out shopping again. HK famous Temple Street (for the street shopping addicts) is only about 20-30mins walk away (north along busy Nathan Road then turn right into Jordan Road). And of course there are more shops along the way. So the 20-30mins walk could well turn into 2-3hours. So be warned. Overall Experience It’s a great 4star hotel with very affordable and good value rate Spaciously comfortable room. Friendly, very competent and engaging staffs (except for the one I was served by at its Haris Bar). Note: the staffs whom I had contact with during my stay: reception, bellhop, concierge, security/guest relation, housekeeping, bar waiting. Good location for the serious shopper and the hungry dining enthusiast (for both signature/street restaurant foods) The Holiday Inn Golden Mile, Kowloon shall be on my 4star hotel choice list whenever I next visit HK (I’ve already booked my flight there for mid Nov 2012 ). And I would recommend the HIGM to any visitor to HK without hesitation. Eng Soh Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Karthic M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for MTR users . Airport express has an complimentary shuttle from Kowloon station . The check in staff were a bit harsh . The hotel is old . The rooms were spacious for the hong kong standard . Breakfast had 2 Indian food varieties daily . The breakfast staff were amazing and good service . The concierge in the hotel was also very good . They give you umbrellas for your use since we don't know when it will rain here . THe hotel is sorrounded by shopping malls and restaurants . There are an couple of Indian food restaurants in Chung king mansions , ebenezers kabob is also good .

Reviews.Title: “Great swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the swimming pool on the roof was really great on sunny days ;D

Reviews.Title: “Lively hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RAJIV1969
Reviews.Content: After staying at Hollywood hotel Disney in Hongkong, came to stay at this hotel for 3 nights. It was a welcome change. Location: The hotel is ideally located in Kowloon area and near to everything you are looking for - shopping malls, restaurants, shops, convenience stores, train station, etc etc Front Desk: Very efficient. Smooth checkin. Lobby: Pretty big. Good ambience. Entry from front side as well as from the market side. The doorman and the staff at the lobby are very courteous and polite. They can guide you for anything you are looking for and call taxis for you. Room: Good rooms, though a bit small. Coffee maker, complimentary mineral water available in the room. Soft as well as hard pillows available - 4 per bed. Breakfast: wow...wonderful spread...a welcome change from the monotonous breakfast of Hotel hollywood in Disney HK. The breakfast is simply superb!! Very courteous and polite staff. Lunch: Had buffet lunch at the restaurant on 1st floor and it was wonderful . Lots of choice and a relaxed atmosphere. They have a separate section for Japanese food..with sushi and other stuff. Just check it out. Though the food is good in the restaurants inside the hotel, there are so many dining options at walking distance from the hotel. just explore them!! Bar: there is bar on the M floor. I went there during the afternoon for a cup of coffee and found the staff there to be un-attentive and slightly rude in their behavior. It was a surprise to me as all the other staff of the hotel had a very different attitude. Room Service: very efficient and fast. Laundry: is pretty expensive if you get it done in the hotel. There is a laundry shop just 2 block away from the hotel - GENERAL LAUNDRY. Come to the main road from the front side of the lobby and take a right turn on MODY road. Walk straight, leave the first right turn. turn right on the second turn. walk for 50 - 70 mtrs and turn left on the first turn. you will find this laundry shop there. Convenience store: 7Eleven is just across the street. Travel desk: there is a travel desk in the lobby but it belongs to some travel agency and not the hotel. Though the tours offered by them are expensive but they are safe and reliable. The staff at the lobby, door man, bell boy, front desk staff - all are very cooperative and willing to provide guidance on traveling and other things. Talk to them and explore. Guided tours are a waste of money and you do not get to see what actually you want to. Shopping: Oh, lots and lots of shops in and atoned Holiday Inn. Low end to really high end shops available. Roam around and check out. One thing that might not suit people traveling with family - lots of freelancers women moving around the streets near the hotel and also inside the hotel. I saw many of them in the lobby and the bar on M floor. Security guys do not seem to be bother about them. All in all, a wonderful hotel at a wonderful location!!! My next stay in KH is going to be in this same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sambarts
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay at this hotel again, the rooms are nice, it's in an excellent location, the roof top pool is a real bonus and the pool staff are very helpful. We upgraded our room which turned out to be a good idea as it includes breakfast, etc and the choice of things to have exceded my expectations. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mascalzone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights for our first visit to Hong Kong and were very satisfied. The location is the biggest advantage: right in the middle of everything in Kowloon, within walking distance to everything. The room was very comfortable, the service impeccable and the breakfast was perfect. I remember as a kid traveling with my parents and staying at Holiday Inn. This is not at all the same, instead it's more like staying at a Sheraton. And it's just a 10 minute walk for the spectacular view across to Hong Kong (be sure to use the underground walkways!) The only downside is that once you leave the hotel you can't help but notice there are some really shifty characters milling about. It was somewhat intimidating but it seems to be like this everywhere in Kowloon. I think if we should ever visit HK again I'd prefer to stay on the Hong Kong side.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but dated now”
Reviews.Author: Wideeyedandlegless
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on numerous occasions. Super location for Kowloon + Harbour Ferries, MTR etc but there are a lot of dodgy touts and individuals hanging around outside the hotel now, especially at night which could be a little intimidating for visitors. Rooms are now a little tired and as this hotel is always busy, there don't seem to be many decent deals available, it’s always top dollar. I think that the Holiday Inn Brand in China is really strong but this hotel is now a little weak compared to other Mainland H Inns.

Reviews.Title: “If you have the money, a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graham T
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot here. We opted for the executive option as we have two girls, therefore needed a bigger room than the one we reserved. It was worth it. Access to the Lounge, with free booze in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Great pool, great service, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good room good location”
Reviews.Author: Diorr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently, the room took at least 2 hours being readied for us. It was kind of a drag especially if you had a transpolar flight....We had an executive room which was fine and had the right amenities with breakfast included it was actually a nice spread better than a continental. Good location right around the corner from a metro station. I'd stay here again

Reviews.Title: “An oldie but a goodie”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: It might be showing its age a bit but this remains one of the best affordable hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui. Superb location right next to the MTR station, a short walk to Star Ferry and shopping galore right outside the door. Check in was reasonably easy with a very enthusiastic young lady although hampered by the promotional pitches obviously demanded by management. The room itself was very nice although again showing its age a little. Excellent king size bed, well appointed room and quite a cosy atmosphere. The turn down service was unexpected! The only real downside is the same as any central hotel in Hong Kong - traffic noise. Breakfast I felt could have been a little more inspiring and the hot food a little bit more hot than warm but it was still very decent. Hari's Bar is quite a pleasant place and when Happy Hour is on features terrific service: every second drink kept appearing without being asked as Happy Hour is basically buy 1 get 1 free.

Reviews.Title: “so-so overall experience”
Reviews.Author: mild84
Reviews.Content: We waited for couple of hours to check-in and out.. Rooms are just ok and wont see anything special about it.. great location for shoppers and food trippers because the hotel lies on a street with lots of boutique and food stalls.. what i dont like is when you step out of the hotel, lots of indians/africans will try to block your way and attempt to talk to you about something.. i dont know what it is since i didn't even entertain them.. but they were scary.. i asked a friend whose been working in hongkong for years and she told me that these people are looking for fun specially with foreigners.. so take care if you're stepping out of the hotel to shop or roam around specially at night.. overall, my experience at Holiday Inn Golden mile is just ok.. im not sure if i would go back.. i might try the other Holiday Inn in Causeway bay..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but below average check-in service”
Reviews.Author: zeacie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, close to MTR, Victoria Harbour, plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby, however the check-in staff were the worst I had come across. We had booked a double room online and were greeted with the option to upgrade for $200HKD per night - which seems to be a standard when reading other reviews - to a family room (1 king & 1 queen) agreed to this as it suited us better travelling with children. When we were asked to sign for the extra charge it was $100HKD more per night than quoted so we questioned it and the receptionist explained that the cheaper price she quoted was only to get a refurbished double room. We disputed this and asked to speak to management but they were 'unavailable'. We asked if she had made a mistake but she didn't seem to understand our English at this stage, she then showed us to the room which she led us to believe was the family room and showed us the refurbished double room, We asked to go back to reception and speak to the Manager as we would like the family room - her reply was that "in the time we had been arguing the family room was booked and there were none left". Returning to reception we asked when the next family room would be available but never got an answer to our question, and decided to give up as we just wanted to get to our room. One of the Loyalty Managers then came over to see what our fuss was about and proceeded to try and charge us the extra charge for the '3rd person' in our room, we disputed this as it was on the original booking form that there were 2ad/2ch. After nearly half an hour of grief, he gave up and said that we could have the family room (that must have miraculously appeared on the booking screen)! This left us with a bitter taste in our mouth although the rooms were well appointed, bathrooms on the small side, housekeeping were efficient and friendly. We never ate in any of the restaurants as there was hundreds within walking distance to experience. There were a noticeable amount of prostitutes in Hari's Bar, they never bothered us, but it did lower the standard of the place. Overall a great location but would think twice about staying here just because of the check-in debacle.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: DoodleArt
Reviews.Content: And not much else! Staff is friendly location is great hotel is over priced rooms are less than desireable

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki2102
Reviews.Content: This hotel satisfies the needs of the business traveller well. It is in a very convenient location - close to the MTR, Star Ferry or China rail service. It is convenient for all shopping and everyday needs. The staff are helpful and pleasant, the Bistro for breakfast is excellent. Some of the rooms are due for an upgrade but they are acceptable. I bought the accommodation on Expedia as it was cheaper than the hotel website. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: icylemon18
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 3-4 weeks prior to my travelling date. However, I was very shocked that the hotel price dropped tremedously when I checked it out 2 weeks later after my booking. I sent an email to holiday inn and was happy that they 'compensated' me with daily breakfast for 2 pax. The hotel is nice and clean. I booked deluxe double bed room. It is very big! Staff service is also good. They are polite and helpful with my enquires. Overall, my family and I have enjoyed our stay with this hotel. Would choose Holiday Inn if I'm ever back in HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Location okay, rooms and service poor!!”
Reviews.Author: samjonk
Reviews.Content: My colleague picked this hotel for our 2 day business trip to China. By checking in we found out the my colleague paid less for the exact same room by booking with Expedia than my booking directly with the hotel. The hotel website mentions a best price guarantee, which means that you get a one day free of charge. After mentioning this to the receptionist, he told me that this would only count if you compare it to a booking made within the same "hotel group". We didn't understand this, since logically you would say that a comparison with any other online booking website should be okay. This is not the case and after having a discussion with different reception clerk I became annoyed and decided to leave it as it was. So NO free night!! My advice: don't take anything serious on their website. It is a big scam! Also, be aware of all the prostitutes throughout the hotel. They are everywhere and the staff doesn't seemed to be bothered by them. The rooms are okay, bed is a bit hard and the bathroom is smaller than a regular closet! We paid about 210 euro per night per room (1 person in room). This is overpriced to my opinion. Please avoid staying in this hotel or reconsider staying in some of the many other nearby hotels, such as Hyatt (opposites the Holiday Inn), or the Langham or even the ICON, where I am staying as we speak. DON'T STAY IN THE HOLIDAY INN GOLDEN MILE.

Reviews.Title: “They serve SHARK FIN SOUP!!!”
Reviews.Author: b1uem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nicely located, clean all in all I was happy until I discovered a disservice they doing to our enviroment by serving shark fin soup. I also think there is a prostitution ring going on in the bar area., but if your ok with those 2 things I would reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Holiday Inn Golden Mile as we have done on several previous occasions. The location in Nathan Road is very convenient to the main features in Kowloon, shopping, restaurants, waterfront and ferry terminals both to Kong Kong and Macao. The rooms are comfortable, housekeeping is very good, the club floor offers tasty snacks and drinks in a pleasant atmosphere. The desk staff are friendly and helpful when checking in and out and concierge services are efficient. Arrangement of transfers to and from the airport are made quickly and reliably upon request. There are three restaurants offering asian, italian and alpine menus each of which are of good quality at reasonable prices. A mezzanine lounge and bar overlooking the lobby is very popular both with the hotel guests and locals with a reasonable snack menu and lively, good quality entertainment until late nightly. The breakfast buffet is not cheap but is excellent with a wide variety of very good choices available, american, continental, chinese, indian and pastries. The roof top pool is well maintained in good condition by pleasant and attentive staff. Room rates, although higher than most Holiday Inns, are reasonable for Hong Kong and the very convenient location. A great place to stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Great Hong Kong Base”
Reviews.Author: KarynB
Reviews.Content: As I travel to Hong Kong 5-6 times a year this hotel is one of the better hotels I have stayed at. It is centrally located, super helpful and friendly staff, which when you are often in a hurry certainly makes the difference. Do go for the room upgrade if offered, some of the rooms are very small but a lot of hotel rooms in Asia area. The upgraded rooms are spacious. All rooms have the same amenities and everything a leisure or business traveller needs. The only thing to make this hotel perfect would be free wifi, but that is just a business traveller wish. Being so close to the heart of the shopping district and the MTR is a huge bonus. Lots of great restaurants nearby as well,

Reviews.Title: “People who make the difference”
Reviews.Author: FootlooseSolihull
Reviews.Content: Arrived into HK rather tired with a bag, a camera case and a laptop bag. Took the hotel shuttle from Kowloon Station. Getting off the shuttle, left behind my laptop bag! Contained my passport, laptop and tickets. Noticed that the bag was not with me at check-in when the receptionist asked for my passport. Panic stations! Rushed out but the shuttle had long gone. Meanwhile, the doorman had noticed my panic and came up to me. When he learned about my plight, he took me to the concierge. The concierge calmed me down, asked me to continue checking in and immediately called the Airport Express office at Kowloon Station. In 10 minutes, he came over and told me that the driver had been contacted, he had recovered my bag and I could collect it from Kowloon station. You bet that made my day. So a big thank you to the doorman and concierge who so spontaneously helped me out that afternoon on 16th April 2012. You are a credit to the hotel, and to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “The bad outweighs the good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell with so many good hotels in Hong Kong just don't risk staying here. The bad includes one of the worst reception experiences ever, we arrived early and were given a temporary room, great, dump our stuff wait for luggage that doesn't appear so decide to leave the key with reception who will move all our luggage into the temporary room then into the new room when ready. We left for the day and returned at 6pm to find that only one room was ready, if fact they only gave us one room we had to remind them that we had two booked. So we are told to all go to the new room and wait for the other room to become ready. Ok, so we get to the room to find no luggage, so we ask for our luggage to be sent to the room that is ready, but they don't really know where the luggage is, we explain that the luggage should be in the temporary room (but suspect that it is still in the carpark) and wait 30mins to get our luggage delivered to our new room. Other room is still not ready so we let them know that we will be back after dinner to collect the key, eventually our room is ready. When we check out we ask if we can get late check out on one of the rooms, this is not possible...I explain that we had to wait an extended time to check in and would appreciate a late check out, but no. We can leave our bags in their secure baggage area, but they don't have a locked luggage room, in fact their luggage area is in the car park and is anything but secure (I know this because when waiting for my luggage I went to my bag in the car park to change shoes and no one questioned me opening my bag...). The clincher was when I went to check out they charged me for the first night on each room which I had already paid as a deposit, perhaps this is standard practice assuming people don't check their credit card bills or invoices. So in a nutshell I was one very unhappy customer. The good (I am the eternal optimist) great location really close to the MTR, the Italian restaurant is excellent, with great service but quite expensive. The buffet breakfast is acceptable. Okay so my advice if you have the patience of a saint and don't mind paying twice for your room then this is the hotel for you, otherwise stay away, there are hundreds of hotels in HK that will offer more for less (not less for more like the holiday inn).

Reviews.Title: “Great location above MTR station in heart of Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: blowenz
Reviews.Content: You stay here for the location. Right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui and above the MTR station, it is so easy to get around. We bought a day pass that enabled us to traverse quite a bit of Hong Kong and complete our shopping list. This hotel was also easy for people to come to meet us. Rooms are large and clean, through bathrooms are small and tight. Bed and linen good. No views but this was not a priority. We had the breakfast buffet each morning, which was a very good standard and had a very extensive range of food on offer. Hotel has a surprisingly good gym and sauna/steam room area. Pool a bit cramped so did not use.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Lee084
Reviews.Content: Efficient staff; very convenient location. one of my regular places to stay in HKG

Reviews.Title: “Great for family holiday”
Reviews.Author: cordeaux
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to Executive Club on arrival. Perfect for family. Pool, gym, executive lounge and big healthy breakfast choices. Helpful, cheerful staff who like children! Would stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and great buffet breakfast, but suite was in desperate need of new carpet & a good airing!”
Reviews.Author: CarKri02
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel with our two children for a brief HK stopover after a great experience the year prior. We love the location of this hotel (situated in the busy Nathan Road shopping district in Tsimshatsui - close to the Ocean Ferry Terminal & shopping, markets and MTR stations). Last year we had stayed in a triple room with our 2 young children, which was comfortable and represented excellent value for money. And their buffet breakfast was one of the best we had experienced. Unfortunately, at check-in we were advised that all the triple family rooms were occupied, and hence we chose to pay the upgrade to a suite, with the hotel kindly offering to provide a rollaway bed and additional linen for the sofa free of charge. As far as space was concerned, this turned out to be a good option (we were travelling with a huge amount of luggage having just returned from a family ski trip) - we had a large living area, separate bedroom, ensuite bathroom and additional powder room. The layout worked very well, the bathrooms were lovely and spacious and we had a great view of busy Nathan Road from our living room. However, in comparison to the recently refurbished triple rooms, unfortunately the suite was in desperate need of updating, and a good airing! Unfortunately, the air conditioning had to be turned off when we were in the room due to the overwhelming smell of mould (I later realised it was the cause of my 3 day headache). I would have loved to have aired the room myself, but the windows were fixed closed. Despite new carpets being laid in the hallway and other guest rooms on the floor, our suite still had the old worn and musty carpet, the replacement of which would have made such a difference to the aesthetic & comfort appeal of this room. Such a shame - for the significant extra paid per night, I really did expect a better quality room - if it weren't for the fact we had just made a 14 hour flight, had 10 pieces of luggage and 2 sleepy kids on the rollaway and couch, I would have requested a room change at check-in. However, there is no doubt that this hotel is in a fabulous location, does a great buffet breakfast, has a lovely pool area, great masseuse, and offers excellent value for money particularly for its standard rooms (my parents have stayed in two very comfortable refurbished rooms in the last couple of years which did not smell of mould!). I would highly recommend staying here, but perhaps request an immediate room change if you find yourself stepping onto old carpet when you step inside your room.......

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: John_Brisvagas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 12 nights Dec11/Jan12, 2 adults and 2 teen daughters in one room. rooms are only suitable for 2 people, get 2 rooms if you have teens. Rooms were okay, clear but showing signs of wear. The hotel itself was well maintained and the staff very helpful. The location is excellent with the MTR across the road and close to everything. Got laundry done in a nearby street at a cost of about $30HK for a large bag. There are a few dodgy looking people that hang around the 711 at night, but we not harrassed or bothered by them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: acrami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile in Kowloon, Hong Kong for four nights. The hotel is in the heart of Kowloon and stepping outside, one is surrounded by the bustling city with the typical Hong Kong shopping and street experience. For a respite from the hustle and bustle, one can walk to beautiful Kowloon Park, less than half a mile away. The hotel is very conveniently located at the N5 exit of the Tsim Sha Tsui subway station, just two stops from the Financial District and three stops from Central/SoHo area. The hotel service was excellent with every staff member we encountered doing their best to take care of our needs. We opted for the Executive Floor which more than paid for itself with free breakfast, cocktail hour, and free internet. The buffet breakfast had a wide range of offerings and was excellent. The internet in our room tended to be slow at times. The gym and pool are great for a hotel. Room furnishings including the mattress, and TV were fine. While we did not encounter it, I can see where morning check-out can be a bottle-neck. It may be advisable to do an express checkout.

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD DEAL”
Reviews.Author: elena a
Reviews.Content: We didnt enjoy our stay at this hotel .
