Rooms dirty blood on the bathroom door and stains on wall Room smells of mould they have no fans in bathroom and no top sheets on beds yes no top sheet rang to advice told me they just dont use them ?????had to wait 15 minute at Tour desk before got notice then told wait another 15 minutesas tour person on break paid$400audnot worth it, B/fast ok after 4 mornings better try ouside coffee shops. As i said Bad bad bad floors above the 6 floor executive rooms i believe new 2nd floor to 6 old deluxe rooms nothing deluxe other them . Not recommend love Hong Kong but never again at Holiday inn golden Mile . Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LSY9
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Great location, no lack of food options. The hotel offered me a newly renovated room. Bathroom was small but very new and clean. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. There was also complimentary transfer service from Kowloon terminal to the hotel if one choose to take the airport express. Saves time and money! Will definitely stay here again if at Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Errr...not a good sleep for my baby Lia”
Reviews.Author: Liasfave
Reviews.Content: Since we were spending most our time outside this hotel, forget about the accommodation as we booked 2 nights at this hotel for convenience in shopping and eating. Being outdated and needs refurbishment, the rooms are not par with the other equally rated 4 star hotels in HK. The granite finishes shows wear and tear signs while the door hinges big tube TVs reminds of the circa 80s technology. Again, we are here for shopping so after hours of walking with an infant take note, we didnt even mind the cracking sound of the elevator as we were given a room just behind the elevator pit, we had requested for a room change but to no avail.... Again, we had fun shopping along the TST streets so we even dont mind that our room was not serviced despite the hanged "clean room tag" outside the door...but then again we had fun shopping....so if you guys want to stay in a pretty descent hotel for like 4 hours of sleep then this hotel is for you but if you want complete pampering...then check out other hotels that are within the TST area....By the way, did I forget to say that we had fun shopping?..Need I say more, still have some comment on the reception and the waiting area at the ground floor but since I am still occupied by the marked down prices along Parklane stores...might as well reserve the comment to other guests...

Reviews.Title: “I say it again....... Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LynneK4
Reviews.Content: If in hong kong you must stay here. This is the greatest hotel for friendly staff there is, there all great . Room is comfortable and the exec club is great for relaxing beer after a hard days work in china, although the kids running around do put a little damper on it! The Osteria restaurant is divine with Paulo the chef creating gorgeous masterpieces from special requests, nothing is too much trouble in this hotel for any member of staff. The bar is a little lacking in atmosphere now, something which has disappeared over the last year or so, but the bar staff work very hard. If you want looking after well away from home, this certainly is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: nayal b
Reviews.Content: I went to the holiday inn with my family they gave us 1 room like a motel it was terrible to even a suite it was so in breathable I did no enjoy myself there

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TRoschelleT
Reviews.Content: Each time I have been to Hong Kong on business, I stay at the Holiday Inn Golden MIle in Kwaloon. The hotel is by no means average and it is reasonable in terms of price. The rooms are updated and "contrad" ( a mixture of contemporary and traditional) and the service is very good. The best thing about this hotel is its location. You can walk to all the shopping, the street markets and to see the light show at Victoria Harbor in the evening. The street markets in Kwaloon are one of the best things about Kwaloon. There are not restaurants right around the corner from the hotel and you will need to walk a few blocks in all directions to find restaurants. One of the best places to eat is 3 blocks away (turn right out of the hotel) and it is a local noodle and rice place. It is a hole in the wall and the food is very inexpensive and very very good. I have stayed at hotels that are much more luxiurious than this hotel, yet this hotel is very comfortable, safe, provides great service and has a location that is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Asian Holiday Inns”
Reviews.Author: beardflares
Reviews.Content: We squeezed a family of 4 (kids aged 8 and 6) into a standard room with 2 queen beds. No extra cost. No max 3 ppl. Breakfast included. Great Value. Busy hotel but standards maintained. Not the most modern decor but that didn't detract from the vibe. Brilliant location to explore from. Right amongst it. Let's face it most are in HK to get out and about. My kids especially enjoyed playing football with the locals on the Kowloon Park pitch which is just up the road. Food was good enough for breakfast. There's a number of restaurants in the hotel. The one in-house restaurant we tried was the Italian 'Osteria'. It was pricey but food very tasty. Service a bit too snooty in that particular F&B outlet for a scruffy family of four so felt a bit out of place. When we checked in they gave us a 20% off voucher for all restaurants (as long as you pay through your room). Gym looked good with v moderm machines and the roof-top pool was nice especially before breakfast when I had it all to myself. Having stayed in Sukhumvit and Orchard Rd Holiday Inns in Bangkok and Singapore with the family we weren't surprised that this one was equally as good.

Reviews.Title: “Amongst it on Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: Aussie4741
Reviews.Content: Walk out the side door and you are right amongst it all.....tailored suit sir?? ..... Good watch sir?? ... How about a handbag for madam???? The hustle and bustle of Hong Kong is right at your doorstep. The hotel is located across the road from the MTR (subway), a 10 minute walk to Star Ferry terminal and Harbour Side, the Space and Art museums.... It's all right there. We stayed on the executive level (floors 16 to 18), our room rate included breakfast either in the exec club or the restaurant, and drinks and snack between 18:00 and 20:00 at no additional charge. The rooms were of an adequate size with a king size bed, mid size bathroom (shower in bath) and good amenities. The restaurant had an extensive menu and buffet (watch the charges on Saturday night... doubled from the Friday before). Staff were very attentive and always ready to help. The exec club located on the 18th floor is quiet and has breakfast available from06;00 to 10:00, snacks and drinks (good range of wine and spirits) 18:00 to 20:00, with all day coffee and tea available till late at night. I would stay at this hotel when ever I return to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: White55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights recently on an urgent business trip. This hotel has been around for a long time and indeed I stayed here over 30 years ago. I booked a room on the Executive floor as this was the only way to confirm a non smoking room. Although there is a premium it is highly recommended to book these rooms as you also gain access to the Executive lounge where breakfast is served. The hotel is primarily known as a tourist hotel being located on Nathan Road in Kowloon, but I used it easily as a business location as their is a metro station right outside the front door and it is a short walk to the Star ferry terminal. The Executive lounge is quiet and you can also get a cooked breakfast if you require.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: serap
Reviews.Content: We were only here for a couple of nights at the end of our holiday, and didn't see much of the hotel (didn't use restaurants etc), but our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was very small and there was some rust stains on the floor, which didn't look great, but wasn't really an issue for us. The service was great - the staff very friendly and helpful, and we ordered room service once which was nice but expensive (which is to be expected). This hotel is in a very busy location, and you can hear the noise from the streets, but it didn't affect my sleep. On exiting the hotel we were approached by men offering fake watches/ tailoring every single time, which was annoying, but the MTR station is very close, which is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: kelleequinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, Golden Mile for one night and we thoroughly enjoyed it as a base to explore Kowloon. It's location gave us great access to explore not only Kowloon but easy access to Tsim Sha Tsui station, the Star Ferry and Hong Kong Island. The hotel staff are friendly and it is clean with all the amenities you could need and a few extra's which you tend to not get these days like bath robes, slippers and travel plugs. Negatives - We were on the 2nd floor and there was absolutely no view and there is building works going on outside but hey it's Hong Kong so you're not exactly going to be spending your time in the hotel. Would definitely recommend,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and best location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: Johan W
Reviews.Content: I had finally a comfortable place to stay for the rest of my holiday during my visit in Hongkong after trying a terrible stay at guest house. I checked-in on December 28, 2011 and checked-out on January 4, 2012. This was not my first stay at this hotel but always found warm and comfortable stay in this hotel. Very good location for shopping, culinary and also good place to spend for the New Year celebration. I will come back to this hotel for my next visit to Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “The most unique Asian buffet ....”
Reviews.Author: oldbutcool
Reviews.Content: Bistro on the Mile on the first floor of Holiday Inn in TST offers a very unique dinner buffet that i must say the best and innovative that i have ever had in my life. it is an Asian buffet though the dessert is entirely western, with quality better than any French and Austrian pastries shops in America. The variety of dishes include Indian, Japanese, Korean, Cantonese and Western dessert. The restaurant was introduced to me by local Hong Kong residnets. It was said that it was known amongst the populace that this restaurant offered the best buffet--i suspect that the Asian element has a lot to do with it. Mind you, the quality is top notch. Just the Japanese section with many types of soba noodles, the different dishes of all you can eat Sashimi, is enough to put any average Californian Japanese restaurant to shame, And this is just one section of the restaurant, there is the authentic Korean food section; the availability of lobsters, clamps, oysters in the seafood section. Of course, there is the also the Jamaican Jerk food which is kind of Caribbean but if one includes what the Jamaican Chinese eat, then the exquisite food truly reinforces the Asian theme. Thai food includes the not too spicy exotic fares with good tamarind based Pad Thai and very creamy coconut green curry. I must say that i could only try out about 30% of the food with very little helping of each for the sake of ensuring that i could sample the desserts. Desserts was the highlight of my dinner in this restaurant. You must dine here to sample it. One needs to make reservation for this restaurant. If you like Asian food, and wanting to sample different types of Asian food in one single spot, this is it. Make sure you reserve the window tables that overlook the bustling Nathan Road in Tsim Sha Tsui. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Location for Shopping !”
Reviews.Author: osborne_pimenta
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a prime Location close to the MRT and what a hotel to be in , you could be out till 2am and you will still see it buzzing about with people a shopping paradise for watches , so many shop's i was blown over , we stayed at the Club Room since was with Kids , so i could also get my Business done well at the Club Longue , you will Never Get Board if you love shopping ,n its amazing to see all kind of stuff available at 1 location , MRT is next door so you can travel anywhere from here Burger King/ Mc Donalds is around the corner so you are never Lost for Safe Food . Hotel is warm to all kings of people here and its a Friendly Hotel. Good Clean and Rooms are Not Great but Good. Higher Floors are a Good Choice!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable holiday in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Vu V
Reviews.Content: We were five days in Hong Kong over the Lunar New Year's holiday in Vietnam. We have chosen a program of Free & Easy airlines Cathay Pacific and we have selected on the recommendation of friends Holiday Inn Golden Mile. We had a large superior room at 12 floor facilities are relatively new. Service was excellent, staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is in the middle of a busy street, where it is very easy and convenient to get everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: lalitdhiman
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location to stay in Hong Kong as it is in the middle of Shopping and Hustle and Bustle of Hong Kong. Lovely rooms and great food! Much better then lot of other Downtown Five star Hotels of Hong Kong. Staff is great too. Honestly one of my best stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Explore Hong Kong From”
Reviews.Author: bigscreen
Reviews.Content: We spent four very memorable nights in the Holiday Inn on Nathan Road - comfortable, convenient and competitively priced. We found it easy to walk to the Star Ferry and the Macau Ferry terminals. It is across the street from a shopping mall complete with restaurants, a grocery and a subway station. We enjoyed the hotel restaurant's buffet breakfast and we frequented Harri's Bar. The Hotel was a good place from which to explore Kowloon but it was a short trip bu subway or ferry to Hong Kong Island. I had read reviews but was surprised to find the hotel exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: DMC1958
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stopped here for a week. The staff were great and very helpful. The buffet breakfast was good value, as I like a good breakfast. The room was clean and tidy the hotel is in a great location. Star Ferry only five minutes’ walk away, MTR station entrances less than one minute walk away from either entrance. We booked a Deluxe Room which was great, but the bathroom was too small. Bathroom size being my only criticism. My tip for travellers would be to use the Octopus card, which can be credited at the 7 11 shop over the road from the main entrance on Mody Road.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katja427
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very centrally. Which means quick access to shopping or bars or anything. Hotel also provided airport transportation (slow when circulating all the hotels around). I upgraded my room with 50 euroes to higher class, thus including breakfast, free "coctail" meaning small dinner and drinks between 18-20, and newspapers. Hotel is very centrally located, and therefore was good for my shopping intentions to buy tablet computer. Hotel staff was friendly advicing where to go for shopping, and therefore ended up in right places nearby in very short time. Next time I go to Hong Kong, will go for the same hotel. Not sure, if will take the upgrade again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mel51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights following a cruise, we have previously stayed at the Salisbury (four times) and the Park. This hotel was a real discovery, the location is perfect for the central location and easy access to the MTR and Star ferry. Our room had two double beds and was a generous size with everything anyone would wish for, including an ironing board to refresh unpacked clothing after a long journey. We were being collected at 1930 to go to the airport for our flight home, and the hotel let us keep our room until 1800, that was a blessing, as we all know the pain of hanging around for flights etc. The food in the first floor dining room was excellent and every member of staff that we encountered was professional,helpful and courteous. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, and I certainly plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure you check out the smell before settling in.”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelVT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile the first week of March so that my husband could attend a conference. We were on the 9th floor. Our room overlooked the ChungKing Mansion and the view was nothing great. In fact the hotel put a sheer curtain that cannot be opened to help you avoid the view (of course it also dims the amount of light). The facility was very nice and close to the subway and Star Ferry. We used both a lot as we liked Hong Kong Island better than Kowloon. The staff in the lobby spoke English quite well and were very helpful in making reservations or giving us directions. There is a nice shuttle to the Kowloon express where you can check in at many airlines before taking the Kowloon Express to the airport. There is a pricy breakfast buffet, which is helpful if you are an early riser as there are not a lot of restaurants open early. There is also 24 hour McDonald's nearby (down Peking Rd) as a cheaper breakfast option. Beware, however, of the smells coming from the Chungking Mansions. Several of our friends--also there for the same conference---had to have their rooms changed. The smells coming from across the alley were very offensive. This seems to have effected the floors higher than ours.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to good places”
Reviews.Author: annsherry
Reviews.Content: Great location. Crossing the road leads to the MTR that can bring you to all touristy places. Also, it is walking distance to many locations like the Avenue of the Stars, Hong Kong Space Museum and others. Room and services, are OK. I actually feel it such a waste that I did not spend more time in my room and to think i have upgraded myself to executive room. I like the idea of unlimited drinks / cocktail tastings at executive lounge from 7-8pm (I think). The late check out of 3pm is kinda helpful as well. I was there only for the weekend and I spent more time outside. But convenient as it is, it wasnt hard for me to locate it since its beside the MTR - Tsim Sha Tsui Station.

Reviews.Title: “Quck trip to HK”
Reviews.Author: 930turbo
Reviews.Content: My parents had stayed in this Hotel over 30 years ago and have always said it was very good. I arrived after 7pm for a quick stay as I was flying out early next morning. Had booked an Executive level room and it was perfect. Evryone was very helpful as I was very tired and they made the check in process very easy. The location for a stay in HK is excellent and very easy to get to and from the airport by the airport express train and free shuttle bus. a very comfortable room and just wish I could have stayed a bit longer. Excellent bar too! Will be back for sure....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Snugglepups
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times on business trips to Hong Kong and just love the central location. Just walk out of the door and you are in the heart of Nathan Road in Tsim Sha Tsui which is really buzzing. A short walk to the Star Ferry if you want to go to Hong Kong island or alternatively the MTR station is just around the corner. Get yourself an Octopus card if you plan to use the MTR a lot. The hotel itself is well run with courteous staff. The Bistro on the Mile restaurant has excellent buffets. If you don't want to 'pig out' you can go down to the Deli Corner for something lighter. Hari's bar is always lively in the evenings, especially during happy hour up to 9pm when you get 2 for 1 drinks. Just order one drink and as soon as you have finished it another one magically appears. As you would expect for Hong Kong, especially in such a central location, it is not cheap. Also, as is usual in Hong Kong, the rooms are a bit small unless you are able to get one of the corner rooms which are a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great.”
Reviews.Author: viajant
Reviews.Content: That was our second stay at the Golden Mile. We were there for only 3 nights. One day after breakfast I discovered that my trousers had several lines where the cloth was completely discoloured. I immediately went back to the restaurant where they promptly offered to find a solution. Due to the short stay and the fact that many things were closed because of Chinese New Year they ended up getting trousers specifically tailored. Great service and very impressed with the way the problem was dealt with. Would definately return to this well located hotel where by the way the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “completely brazen, insolent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex_JaneRu
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is satisfactory, while the building is already a bit old and now surrounded by newer and taller ones, which makes it impossible to have a good view. Room rates are high and the hotel does not deserve these rates in any way. Hotel likes additional charges very much - breakfast costs additional fee plus service charge. Internet in room is also additional charge. But what makes this hotel really terrible is reception team and management. We were the priority club member of Holiday Inn. Checkin - quite loooooong, veeeery slooow, receptioninsts on duty are not very professional, most of them are trainees and do not yet know how to treat guests properly. The brightest example of this was the check-out. Guess how long it took? Oh, very quick for their standards ...just one hour!!! We did not yet take any things out of the room and came to reception to close the bills in advence. So we asked receptionist to return the 3200 USD cash deposit left as deposit during chek-in in order that we exchange it for HKD right next building from the hotel (5 minutes required) and could pay with exchanged HKD for the room(we refused to pay in USD and hotel's exchange rate is quite predatory). Remember - we did NOT take out ANY of the things out of the rooms. Receptionist returns the cash BUT requires right then the equal deposit from our credit card to be blocked!! Damn! what for, we ask??We are going for the next building and without any of our suitcaces!!!! Receptionist scratches his empty head and goes to seek advice from manager. The advice is pretty damn nice - "we can not let you out on your own(i.e. we do not trust you) - we would send the security guy with you". Not for our security!!! Just in order that we do not dissappear from the Hotel! And no, they do not care about Priority Club status of the Guests. And oh, yes, they had the credit card numbers by that time already, and additionally the bookings were guaranteed by the Hong Kong Company, which invited us. Silly, damn, idiotic service! I wish Holiday Inn to be replaced as soon as possible by more nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: stephbb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally suited in the heart of Kowloon, just yards from the MRT station. The check-in was quite slow, and a number of guests were complaining that their rooms weren't ready even though it was 16:00 hrs. I was greeted as a Platinum Priority Club member and received an upgrade to an Executive Room, but I was disappointed that this didn't extend to access to the Club Lounge. The room was however excellent with the only drawbacks being a small bathroom and the fact that it overlooked the back alley, although I understand that all front facing rooms are being refurbished. Breakfast consisted of a wide choice, and this was the only meal I ate in the hotel. The tailors outside the hotel were very aggressive, and wouldn't take no for an answer! I would certainly recommend this hotel for any trip to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Riyanapot
Reviews.Content: Last Feb 9-11 we stayed at Holiday Inn Golden Mile in Nathan Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, HK . Perfect location! Just a few steps to TST MTR Station. Walking distance to most Hongkong tourist attraction like Avenue of Stars, Ferry terminal that will take you to either Central (to visit the Peak) or to Macau. Also an MTR away to HK Disneyland. The room was perfect for the 3 of us (me, my husband and our 3 year old son). The check-in was fast and our room was already available and allowed us to checkin as early as 10am, they also offer us for a later check-out on our last day, unfortunately our flight back to Manila was in the morning, so we have to be out by 7AM. We're assigned at Room 908 with a perfect view of Mody Road. Truly a relaxing experience as a first timer in HK.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: raindrops2226
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights during xmas and boxing day, this was the second time we stayed at holiday inn in tsim sha tsui . we only stayed here because the location is great, right next to the mrt tsim sha tsui station, a 7/11 right in front of the hotel and of course the hotel is surrounded by shopping centre. love the location. the room was clean but it had a strange smell to it. maybe cuz its a smoking allowed hotel?? we always needed to turn the air con on and sprayed perfume in the room just to make it bearable. the bathroom was tiny, the price was reasonable. not sure abt coming back but if i m on a budget holiday then holiday inn will be the place =)

Reviews.Title: “First timers in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Jude12-12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good staff. Rooms not huge but you only sleep there so who needs a ballroom. Bathrooms a bit dated and small but clean and plenty of decent sized towels which is an issue we have had in other hotels. Would recommend as it is close to evrything.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Upgraded Rooms”
Reviews.Author: monoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the executive floor, rooms are spacious enough, the bathroom is quite tight. I requested a corner room, for a bit more peace, but had a rowdy mainland group across from us. Room has a work desk and a small two seater sofa and table. For Priority Club Platinum member I received free internet, which was handy. The Club Lounge has some nice snacks, average wine selection, normal range of beer and spirits. Breakfast was the normal adequate. The staff are all very friendly. They actually do go out of there way to ensure everything is ok. Nice hotel if you require to stay in Kowloon side. The hotel has a small pool on the roof, for summer, closed in winter. Overall not too bad, but would choose the Crowne Plaza in Causeway Bay over this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: si_opel
Reviews.Content: The room is quite big if you travelling with kids The location is great because it is right in down town tsimshatsui where all the retail stores and boutiques are within short walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Nick L
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel in a good location. Off Nathan road with close access to the harbor and some serious shopping. As all Holiday Inn hotels this is somewhere I'd book a room if/when travelling with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Hong Kong, great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBowman
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with a sensational location. I stayed there over Chinese New Years for 6 days with my wife and two children. Arrived at the Airport - direct train to Kowloon station and then No T3 bus direct to the from door of the hotel. Staff where friendly and very helpful. We upgraded our room to an Executive with two queen beds including free Wifi and breakfast in the Exec Club. The rooms where great, gym was good, staff very helpful and friendly. MTR station right by the hotel outside. Short walk to all shopping and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my Family!”
Reviews.Author: mai_a216
Reviews.Content: First time to try this hotel after hearing of it for years. Reason I didn't want to risk even if reviews say it has a good location is because I had heard it was a "tired" hotel. But upon learning it had undergone room renovations, I was excited to finally give it a try! It did not disappoint. My family (3 kids and us parents) stayed in the family room with 1 king and 1 double bed. It was generously spacious fir HK standards! We fit in it along with our 4 luggages (and lots of shopping bags later on during our stay) very comfortably! One small sacrifice is that the bathroom is a bit small but still very manageable. I must make a shout out to the housekeeping of this hotel --- EXCELLENT!!! I never like having our hotel rooms cleaned during our trips because I feel that cleaning would just mess how we "feel at home" in a place. But this time, although our "do not disturb" sign on the door was ignored, I could not get hyped about it because we went back to a room that was spotless and arranged as we had left it!!! Thus for the first time in so many trips, we had our room cleaned everyday. I made sure to let housekeeping know I was very happy with their cleaning :) On our last night, the hotel gave us a tea gift set of teapot and cups which was a nice touch. The hotel is in a great location, near mtr exit and harbour city. Very easy to go out and have a last late night shopping stroll Safe to say, this will now be my hotel choice when in HK :)

Reviews.Title: “Styed there because of the price, but it's superb!”
Reviews.Author: gunnerHiltonHead_SC
Reviews.Content: I've used the Marco polo group, Sheraton and peninsula, but their prices are outrageous. The executive club upgrade with wifi, breakfast, and cocktails is a peaceful oasis with great rooms, and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: FamTraveler38
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family in a slightly larger executive room over Chinese New Year in January 2012, after being offered an upgrade from standard double room at check-in for another HK $200 per night, which seemed good value to me. A good feature of the room was the many electrical outlets for charging the usual devices. Big screen plasma TV on the wall. This hotel offers bedding with 2 double beds in the room, which can be difficult to find in HK. So should be considered by families looking for accommodation. We were only on 5th floor, and the only view is of the sidestreet. Mody Road. Location is the best feature of this hotel. A multitude of eating and shopping in TST right outside your hotel door. I recommend you also look into the many floors of the iSquare shopping mall right across the road. As others have mentioned, several entrances to the TST MTR station are steps away. The basement of iSquare also links into the MTR station. Many buses run on Nathan Road, right outside. Starbucks is in iSquare and, through floor to ceiling glass wall, has a great view of the hotel and Nathan Road. Those that want their McDonald's will find several 24 hour outlets nearby. Those that want more glamour might look at the Sheraton HK, which is one block away, but it would be at a higher room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SeeUSA
Reviews.Content: Professional staff and well run with excellent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SwissFella
Reviews.Content: Once I got over the price I had to pay for a Holiday Inn (probably around around US$300 a night), I began to appreciate the location of the hotel, and the rather slick way it is run. It's virtually on top of an MTR (underground) station, and has a bus stop outside for relatively cheap transfers to and from the airport. It's in the midst of the commercial heart of Kowloon, within an easy walk of the Star Ferry. The downside to the commercial offer surrounding the hotel is in the instant attacks from (mostly) Indian chaps trying to get you to buy a suit/shirt or other garments: oddly enough though they seem to recognise you as hopeless potential after the first day, so the intensity of the attack wears off. Rooms aren't a bad size, at leaast in the "de luxe" category, which was the lowest one available. Howevert he reservation agent suggested that all is not equal within each category, so you might want to try for larger, or a rnovated, room. Corner rooms seemed to be at a premium, but I have no idea if they are worth the effort, or any additional expense. Forget the (expensive of course) internet. There are free zones all around you if you can lug your laptop out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beside from the view from the room, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: uniflip
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in June, 2011 - Nice clean hotel, nice business lounge - Perfect location on Nathan Road - Pricing OK compared to Hong Kong avarage prices...A little old anyway internet a room in general functionel

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: MCHANDAN
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Central Location in main market Area, Middle of Tsim Sha Tsui area. Close to MTR also. Nice & Clean Rooms and Big enough for Family with children. Nearby to market with best deal on Forex, Shopping, Foods.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: Emeste22
Reviews.Content: The location and reliability of this hotel are its main features. The hotel is always extremely busy and genuine and sincere personalised service and attention is a little stilted at times. My upgraded deluxe suite was comfortable, clean, quiet and functional with all the usual Holiday Inn amenities available. The bars and restaurants offer good service and selection of food and wine. Hari's Bar is an excellent meeting place for a brief meeting with friends or clients.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CraigDownUnder
Reviews.Content: First off, the easiest way to get there from the airport is the A21 bus. The stop is a few steps away from the Nathan Rd entrance. (The return stop is on the other side of Nathan Rd) Might take a few mins longer than the express train+shuttle bus, but it's $33 instead of $90 and just one (wifi-equipped) vehicle door to door. The hotel itself was very disappointing. An hour of wifi there is more than double the price of the hour of wifi you get while on the A21 bus! That's just gouging. Given the room rates and the pretty pictures, I'd never even considered that the rooftop pool might be completely un-heated. They even waste their (i.e. our) money having a staff member on duty all the time at a cold pool that nobody uses this time of year! The sauna and steam room are actually two of each, all tiny and in with the male and female toilets. For anyone who uses a wheelchair, all of these facilities are on the top floor which can only be reached by stairs, so you get nothing. (Worse still, there's nothing to say that all the recreation facilities are inaccessible to the disabled.) As many others have mentioned, the views are of dilapidated buildings all around and you'll get asked about buying watches or other goods every time you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Year stay at Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: NSR297628
Reviews.Content: We had excellent stay in Holiday Inn Golden Mile HK during New Year 2012 for 4 nights . Ours was a corner room on 4th floor facing Nathan Road and had good street view .The room was very spacious and we were provided with 2 Queen beds as requested .The rooms ,corridors ,lifts and recpetion were all very clean and I am assuming they have done renovation within last 2 years . Best part of this hotel is its excellent location with everything within few minutes of walk whether it is MRT-TST(1 min) , Canton Road(5 min) , Ferry terminal (7-8 min),Malls-SOGO ( 3 min) due to its excellent Nathan Road location . Central/HK MRT stations are just 2 stations away and Causeway Bay is just 3 stations away . On dining front we tried one late night buffet and another lunch buffet both at Loong Yuen Cantonese restaturannts and it was incredible experience of variety ,taste and value for money . I will recommend afternoon lunch to anybody from India as it had lot of indian delecacies like Paneer Tikka,Naan,rogan Josh ,Mini Samosa etc . Only negative experience was USD20 per day charge for internet which is very steep also we needed to wait for more than 20 minutes beyond the stipulated check-in time but that in understandable due to rush in the hotel . Overall , I will highly recommend this safe,clean and well located hotel if you can afford it .

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Snapper1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family in the second week of November 2011 for a short holiday. The location of this hotel cannot get better as you're on Nathan Road, one of the busiest streets of Kowloon Area. As a fussy Indian Vegetarian family, we found this place very good as it is a 5 min walk away from Woodlands Restaurant (Wing On Plaza, Tsim Sha Tsui East Station) and also has many smaller Indian Restaurants near by. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable and the staff in general was cooperative and friendly. We checked in at around 17:00 hrs and our room was not ready despite having given our flight details well in advance. We were only given one room as the other one was still being prepared. However, during check-out, they refused to let us keep one room for a few hours extra! Despite delaying in giving us the room, they did not compensate us with a late chck out which was rather disappointing. Over all, I would highly recommend this hotel for people to stay even if it comes with a slightly steep price.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Pricey Lunch Buffet @ Bistro on the Mile”
Reviews.Author: LRutherford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had lunch here during our recent visit to Hong Kong. I should have asked what they charged first! It cost a little over $100 USD for us to have lunch here...and it wasn't that spectacular! Had I known that "regular water" (we seldom drink anything else other than water at restaurants or with meals at home) meant two $45 HKD bottles of Evian, I would have ask for free green tea, or just boiled water. I think the wait staff should have asked if we wanted Evian, marked-up Evian. At least we were given the opportunity to refuse "sparkling water." The buffet does offer a fairly large spread and variety of ethnic flavors. The quality overall was good. Yet it does seem a bit pricey for a regular weekday lunch buffet to cost nearly $45 USD/person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, family sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: rocky100_3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family dec 22 2011 to jan 2 2012 Excellent location right in the heart of TST with MTR railway station practically on doorstep. One of the few HK hotels which can accommodate 4 in one room. (2 large double beds) Fantastic service from all staff. Only negatives were expensive wifi ($140HK per day) and touts outside hotel wanting to sell you copy watches, handbags and tailored suits. Otherwise no complaints and would most definitely stay at this property again and will recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: WBA66
Reviews.Content: Another excellent stay at this lovely hotel. Great location, comfortable rooms,fabulous decor and lovely friendly helpful staff. The restaurants within the hotel are super, especially the Italian Restaurant "Orsini" - definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Follow up report”
Reviews.Author: vicnzsa
Reviews.Content: I have recently had my third visit to this hotel and I will stand by my previous comments that their prices are on the high side although Hong Kong in general is not a cheap place to stay. The location is as others have said is great, out the door and into the MTR subway to go anywhere or walk up Nathan Rd. The street markets are a bit of a hike although but taxi’s are relatively cheap. Easy to get to from the airport, take the Airport express train to Kowloon. Tickets cost about HK$100 return and you can buy them at a few spots in the airport but if you want to use AMEX buy them at the round kiosk at the platform. Then up one level at Kowloon station and catch the free "K3" shuttle bus and you will be the first one dropped at the hotel door. Remember although on the return trip you will be the first one picked up and unless you are happy with a tour of the other hotels (and you are travelling light) take a walk along Mody Road to the Shangri-La and you will catch the same bus before it heads straight to the station. To eat I suggest you turn right outside the hotel and along Mody Rd then right into Chatham Rd, then left on Salisbury Road. On your left are a string of restaurants and pubs with views to Central Island. Back to the hotel. On this trip I used points for a free room which was graciously allowed (my loyalty to IHG is assured) but my room was only on the 2nd floor and my view was .. well there wasn’t one. The room was small but OK and looked like it had been refurbished so full marks for that. I did not have breakfast there but the bar (Hari’s Bar) on the first floor in very good with live music at night plus a quieter area to talk. All in all I like this hotel and their friendly staff, but I still think you can get better value for money in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tonito
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and it is in an excellent location as a base for going around the city. The MTR St. entrance is a just across the hotel which makes it convenient in moving around the various districts in HK. Lots of shopping opportunities around the area. Same with the food choices. The rooms are of good size and comfortable. In-room ammenities are ok but they should start replacing those dated TV's. Same with updating the lobby to make it at par with the new hotels in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, excellent location; but two issues”
Reviews.Author: ianwyj
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3-night stay immediately following a shorter stay at Hong Kong Disneyland. For a family of four persons, we found it faster and more economical to take a cab from Lantau Island rather than lug our luggage on the subway. Traffic was fairly light until we encountered some congestion closer to Tsim Sha Tsui. Hotel reception was very polite and slightly apologetic for not having our rooms ready. However, we did not mind waiting as we had arrived about an hour ahead of the official check-in time. Hotel was very full and much as we preferred rooms on the higher floors, ours was on the second floor. Naturally, there wasn't much of a view from the rooms, but this was more a consequence of the other rather aged buildings around the hotel. Rooms were very clean, the beds were lovely and I liked not only the spaciousness (each had a sofa in it) but also the renovated look. The bathrooms were well lit and had a fantastic shower but no tub. Other reviewers have also highlighted that the hotel is located in a fantastic location and I have to agree. It was no problem finding food (available in most directions away from the hotel) or transport (buses and subway). Shopping (Sogo Mall) and attractions (museums, Avenue of the Stars, and the magnificent harbour) were easily accessible via the underpass. There was even a church 5 mins walk away where we were able to attend Sunday mass. One odd issue we noticed was that both our rooms were freezing. While the outside weather was very chilly and may contributed to this, turning the aircon fan speed to low and the thermostat to 26 deg Celsius didn't help at all. Eventually, we had to turn the aircon off for the entire time. The other issue was that we found the lobby scent rather overpowering - I couldn't help myself wanting to walk away from the area as quickly as I could whenever we had to pass through. Nevertheless, these issues were minor compared to the hotel's good points and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Above normal standard for a Holiday Inn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mephestophiles
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant and surprising experience. I agree with what other reviewers have said about this hotel. It is well placed for various shopping malls selling luxury European goods in fashion, cosmetics and Swiss watches. It is a couple of minutes walk to two stations and about 10 minutes walk to the Star ferries. I skipped eating breakfast and just had a coffee or a tea in my room, with some fruit, or bun bought in a supermarket the day before. The hotel charges for wi-fi, but across the road in the i-square mall you can get it for free, there is also a Starbucks open until midnight. You can also get free internet at the airport and around the ferry terminal and maybe elsewhere, but it is a bit patchy. What makes this hotel stand out from the rest is the quality of the staff who are incredibly helpful and courteous. Whatever the problem, or question that I presented them with, they had an answer and solution. I had a problem with the door lock not opening, a member of the front desk team came up to look at it straight away and immediately called an engineer to fix it, which was done within a few minutes. In between I was invited to go to the bar and have a complimentary drink. Now that is service. There is a discrete security presence on the main entrances and inside the lobby. I am not sure why, but certainly on each corner walking along Nathan St, I was repeatedly asked if I wanted clothes made up by a local tailor, or to buy fake watches and while they are not aggressive, they are a constant pain. One treat I enjoyed was getting the South China Morning Post in a little black bag placed on the external door handle every morning about 7.30. I have been to other Holiday Inns in Europe and they usually quite good, but this one seemed to me as being especially good and if I found myself in the same circumstances, I would certainly go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cprops
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, right in the heart of the Kowloon district in Hong Kong. The rooms are very clean and come equipped with modern amenities. It is located right on Nathan Road, the main shopping street in Hong Kong. It is also with in walking distance to the harbor and the MTR, this makes it easy to get around to the rest of Hong Kong, especially Hong Kong Island. The staff is excellent and attended to any need. The breakfast buffet was good, but very expensive. If it is not included in the price of your room, I would skip it and eat at one of the many restaurants located close by. My only other fault with this hotel, is that my room had no view. It basically looked out onto an alley.

Reviews.Title: “Location wise, yummy food a few steps away”
Reviews.Author: come-fast
Reviews.Content: This ideal hotel, is located in the heart of the City, we fewllow Indians will prefer this hotel, it is located in Nathan Road, the centre of the locality, Of course its a four star hotel, but a first class hotel amongst who have lived there, A few steps away is Chungking Mansions where normally Indian foodstuff is easy to get hands on, whatesle a traveller requires, This is posted by Dilip Singh a regular visitor to earth, Fan-tas-ticaaaa..

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Sorr11
Reviews.Content: This is a great central location to stay. You can walk to the Star Ferry the Big Red Bus and there is a MTR at the door. Breakfast is great lots of choices. Good choices of places to eat at your door. Rooms are big. We had a King and a Queen in our room and still had plenty of room. bathroom is good. Service is good. You really cant complain about this place. it is a perfect place to stay in such a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for shopping addicts!”
Reviews.Author: packedbags2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so very convenient for those who love to shop! Plenty of staff around to help - very friendly too. Rooms were spacious enough and clean. The bed was comfy too!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Audry V
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here. It was good, I loved how it was in the centre of everything. All the staff were lovely and the room was kept in good condition. Though after getting of the plane and arriving in the morning our room was not ready straight away which was tiring and getting your laundry done is WAY to over priced. For about 2 loads of washing it cost around $250 Australian! Over then that i had a good experience, the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Old Lady with sizeable rooms & unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Edster88
Reviews.Content: This is an older style hotel. Rooms are fairly big and in comparison to the nearly KOWLOON HOTEL managed by the Peninsular, it is almost double the size! The staff are very attentive and it is sitting literally on top of the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. So location wise, it is on Nathan Road in Tsim Sha Tsui. You have shopping galore & within 10 minutes walk you are into the Ocean Terminal which is about 4 to 6 malls all linked together in air conditioned comfort. Lots of food around as well as nightlife. I stayed for about 4 nights and just found it so convenient as a base to move around. Price can vary so just make sure you do not visit Hong Kong during the peak season or when there is a "fair" in town.

Reviews.Title: “HOLIDAY INN GOLDEN MILE”
Reviews.Author: HVBKK
Reviews.Content: One of the Most awesome Rooms at Kowloon with excellent Location which is connected to Subway and in the heart of Food Paradise. The location is excellent place for Tourism and night market and walking distance from Avenue of Stars

Reviews.Title: “Only looking for convenience”
Reviews.Author: mctdog
Reviews.Content: This is an old one, not much to brag about eventhough they have just completed some renovation. You are only looking for travel convenience. The hotel is in Tshimshatsui (TST), on top of the main subway line and 5 minutes walking distance to the East Rail Line. Location-wise, it is what people called 'strategic', located in Kowloon peninsula, the busiest main street, and 5 minutes to the heart of Hong Kong Island by subway (MTR). You can't beat that convienence. I haven't tried any outlet of the hotels, but why need to? Shopping and dining are right outside.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: sleng2009
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 double beds premier room which was great for my family with 2 kids below 9 as it was difficult to find a family hotel room in Hong kong for reasonable price. (for comparision the room was bigger than the one at Disneyland Hollywood hotel). Location was very convenient next to the subway and near lots of food and shopping centres. Good for family with young kids as you don't have to bring them out somewhere far for dinner or to buy a snack or walk far to the MTR station. Also good for mommy as the kids can rest in the hotel with daddy while mom goes shopping at night as the shops are just outside the hotel down the street ! I like the little touches like the night light which is good when you have kids and the little pantry counter to make hot drinks and large luggage shelf for you to put 2 suitcases open side by side. Like what the earlier reviewers said the 7 eleven at the Mody road (side road) has some foreigners hanging outside at night till very late hours (can see from my room) but use the exit to the main Nathan road with lots of people and there are no problems. Check out is efficient and fast and they got us on a taxi pretty quickly and even told the cab driver where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Buyers beware”
Reviews.Author: Connie C
Reviews.Content: I don't know how luxury, good, or bad this hotel is because I have never stayed there before. All I know is that they are good at price gouging. We have traveled everywhere before and had stayed at hotels from 3 to 6 stars before but never seen anything like that. When I first checked the price, they had a great internet only promotion that's good if you book 7 days before your trip. I thought I had plenty of time because normally 7 days means 7 days especially to big chain hotels. I emailed the hotel and asked them some questions before I booked. They didn't get back to me until after 24 hours. The trickiest part was that they raised their price before answering my questions. I thought I was confused with the dates so I was going to book with the newer price. Before I booked, I asked some more questions because I don't like confrontation on my trip. I wanted to make sure everything is clear. Once again, they raised their price before they answered my email. I decided to ask them to honor the internet promotion. The third time, they raised their price one more time before they said the internet promotion no good. That's just a pure gimmick. I complained to the cooperate office but they didn't really care about my complains I think because every Holiday Inn is individually owned. If you are really absoutely interested in this hotel and found a good price, make sure you book it before you let them know you are interested and forget about asking any questions. They won't honor internet promotion or whatever you see. They will raise their price once they know someone is interested.

Reviews.Title: “A nice week stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Andylkj
Reviews.Content: The week stay in Hong Kong was good but I will let this commentary stick to the hotel. The location ofthe hotel is good with convenient walking distance (approx 2 mins) to the subway station which connects you to the other parts of Hong Kong. The room is passable in terms of size but that is probably because I got upgraded to a suite class room. The service was fine with attentive staff and room was generally clean with a selection of 2 different kinds of pillows. A mostly no frills sort of hotel with a nice Bar on the 2nd level.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, good hotel but why so much for internet?”
Reviews.Author: GrantNewy78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a quick break. Super close to the subway stations and the shopping so it was a great base. The rooms were also rebfurbushed recently so it was a comfortable stay ... great bed. Big fan of the rooftop pool - nothing fancy but it's a nice escape from the bustle of the city. One major complaint ... why does the intercontinental chain still charge so much for internet ... US$20 per day. I always have to work a bit when I travel and I find this super frustrating when so many other hotels provide this for free.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but excellent location and quality”
Reviews.Author: flora_senses
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very strategic, located in the midst of a shopping district, which means that you can start shopping once you walk out of your hotel! With only 2 mins walk from the mrt station, it is very convenient to travel to anywhere. Hotel room is also very clean and very comfortable, with most of the necessities such as hair dryer, iron, tv, & internet included. The only downside is that the room is very expensive. With enough money, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would stay again - although busy part of town”
Reviews.Author: SAMIR74
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is fantastic - here for business but have stayed over a week now and it is very nice. Very clean rooms - they are cleaned up to twice a day, 2 bottles of complimentary water a day which I use, also free little chocolates every second day. Free wifi or cable internet - only thing you have to connect every 24 hours and then they will cancel it off your bill. Room service is very good - great choice, a little expensive like any other hotel I guess. I found some good food places in the opposite shopping complex and 1/3 of the price of hotel. Cable TV with enough stations to keep you occupied, a variety of restaurants within the complex which are good. Buffet Breakfast is fantastic - one of the best I have seen with many choices. The room on the 2nd floor where i stayed had no view - so dont expect any. Might be different further up. There is a gym and pool which I have yet to get a chance to look at. The staff are courteous and helpful - with the only complaints I can make is that the outside as you step out on all sides is very busy at nights. If you like that sort of thing then you will love it. Also the hotel bar will have a few ladies of the night every night - they are harmless and will keep to themselves if you dont want to interact with them. Overall a great place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: JackBack_76
Reviews.Content: Horrifying experience! Stay away from this hotel. Booked with my college double room with twin beds for 2 nights due to outrageous price in the first place (more than 300$ per night) At check-in they told us they have no “superior room” (according to them superior is their standard room) with twin beds and offered us double-bed room. When we argued that we have reservation and we mentioned twin beds they said its “just upon request” and they normally even don’t have standard room with twin beds. Then we asked to upgrade us to superior room but they claimed they don’t have any available. We went to see the room. Tiny room with small bed, 1.5 max! For two adults that specifically requested two beds! We went back to the lobby and said them there is no way we’ll stay in this room. It took few rounds of arguing with clerks and hotel manager to get eventually upgraded room with two beds at the same price. Even so, this room doesn’t worth that price. And the service is terrible, those people don’t understand that when you pay so much money you expect to get service and answers better than trivial. Bottom line – absolutely no value for huge money!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reaction - some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Werckmeister
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Golden Mile is certainly fancier than the usual Holiday Inns, and some things do stand out: the excellent breakfast (but no personal tea/coffee service), the great location and the room size, which is very reasonable in a city like Hong Kong. But the minuses do weigh in as well: my room faced an apartment complex, and it was awkward to be able to see others in their homes and vice versa. The service was also a mixed bag: the check-out receptionist was rather abrupt and rude, while others were smiley and friendly. The wifi in the room was very spotty and inconsistent, which was annoying when I have to work. Overall the price is higher than the usual Holiday Inns but the service and amenities don't really seem to be much of an upgrade...

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time this year. Very good welcome and efficient check-in. Not upgraded as platinum pc member but given renovated room which was faultless and also free breakfast (for one---we were a couple) instead. A little bizarre but valued nevertheless as my wife didn't want full breakfast. Harry's Bar on the mezzanine was a comfortable place to relax. You need to take advantage of Happy Hour as bar prices during the day are excessive. Live music every night and the group on Sunday night were first rate. Breakfast buffet is excellent and wide-ranging. Service cheerful, polite and welcoming. At check-out, the room rate change for three of our nights was not initially acknowledged. As I had booked direct with the Intercontinental website, this was irritating and took some time to sort out. Eventually we were appropriately credited for the overcharge. Overall, this is a very well-run hotel which would be at least Crowne Plaza status in the UK. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Savvy255100
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel during September 2011. Apparently it is the only, or one of the only hotels in HK, that can house two adults and two children in one room. The rooms were smallish but clean. Staff were attentive. I agree, there was a musty smell in the foyer on the floor we were on, but no big deal. Breakfasts were varied in the restaurant, and our kids enjoyed the use of the automatic pancake machine - you press a button and it does it all for you. One night there was a special fireworks display in the city and we went to the roof to get a better sight. The area closes at 8 or 9 pm (can't remember specifically) and we asked if we could stay on for the special event. No way, completely, utterly inflexible - it closes at the usual time. We were disappointed that they were so lacking in consideration for guests for a one-off event. Anyway... The location is spot-on - right opposite the entrance to the undergrand railway system, which is absolutely magnificent - a total delight to use. So, yes, I'd say it is a well rounded hotel that ticks the boxes for the essentials - and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: I love the location with so much to do within walking distance. The rooms- just ok. Sort of dated, but well maintained. Lobby is often very crowded (too crowded) so I do not often feel relaxed in this hotel. Staff were nice, nothing outstanding but no complaints. I was unhappy wiuth interent being charged about USD $18 per day. I am amazed when I find hotels that are so behind the times. If in the area again I recommend Royal Pacific Hotel. Often lower price and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “My base of Hong Kong traveling.”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Visited again after last time in June. The same perfect location no one can beat. Great lobby and staff. Two points of disappointment. First, I wasn't upgraded this time for being platinum. What I reserved was club room. Maybe they didn't have club suites at the moment, or they don't offer club suite upgrade. But anyway, a little bit disappointed for that this was the first time I stayed with what I paid for after receiving platinum status. Another was that the view out of my window was a chaotic construction site. This was not the hotel's fault, and I believe the construction should be finished by now. Overall, a wonderful hotel this is. I'll definitely stay there again when visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeJab
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel. Staff were excellent. It was a business trip & the room was also good & spacious with internet access. Also great bar on the second level where you can chill out after working all day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location ..!!”
Reviews.Author: Raju S
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with great location & very well trained staff, ... Highly recommended for business travellers & tourists. You will enjoy your stay for sure !! Front staff is always ready to assist you. Everything you need is just one step away from your hotel from taxi to MTR, Market to harbour, shopping malls to restaurants. Perfect choice !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Vaghani
Reviews.Content: I think this is very nice hotel. I like all of service. I like people. Food is fantastic Envirement is also very nice. I would like to stay more on this hotel. I think good to me stay here. Hotel look is fantastic Interior of hotel is nice look very rich

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: The_OReillys
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and 2 teenage children for 4 nights in November. We shared a room with 2 double beds - although it was not roomy, we found it adequate, as we were not in the room that much anyway. Clean and comfortable. We stayed on an Exec floor, & would recommend this. We sometimes used the complimentary drinks and food in the Exec Lounge as our dinner for the evening - there was a good supply of hot and cold food, pastries and fruit. Breakfast was also included in our package, and this was delicious and filling - often didn't need lunch! Complimentary wi-fi in the room was handy. We used the gym and found it adequate, although there were only two other people there when we did - i think it would be a bit tight for room if many people were there. We also used the outdoor, rooftop pool, and it was clean and a comfortable temp. No laundry facilities on site - we prefer to have a hotel laundry room with tokens so we can choose to do our own washing. Location was excellent and the underground train only took about 7 mins to get to the Central station side of the Harbour. It was fairly easy to figure out where to go when catching the train, even though we can only speak English. Staff were very helpful. Make sure you have your inclusions in writing before you go - we checked several times that our two children (18 & 14) would be included in the complimentary Exec Lounge & they told us they were - there was a problem with that when we arrived and they wanted to charge us more, but it was sorted out by helpful staff. Also, we had booked a car via the hotel to pick us up from the airport, but it did not come. A taxi was easy to find and got us there without a hitch. All in all, a central location, clean, comfortable and had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family with kids - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Belinda W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed there in October and it was perfect. Kids swam in pool on rooftop and we had, 2 children with us 8yrs and 6yrs. Beds are lovely and very confortable. We had two Double beds which was plenty of room for us all. Bar Fridge and Coffee Facilities were great. 7 Eleven just around the corner proved to be useful and MTR stations on every corner. not far from laundry facilites out of hotel if you need them. Make sure you check out the Ladies market which is only a few stops on the MTR worth a look too. All up a top spot. Free Airport Shutte was tops too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: lizl0ves2travel
Reviews.Content: Traveled to HK with my bestfriend and her kid. We chose to stay here because of it's very convenient location. Just across is the MTR station that can take you to any part of the city. It is also right smack in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui which means walking distance to several tourist attractions and shopping malls! Very nice! The area is also safe. I was walking around alone to shop until midnight. The room is very clean and spacious. Beds and pillows very comfy. I can say this is a good family hotel. I will stay here again when I go back to Hongkong :)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sangeeta V
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights. execellent location, close to avenue of stars, one can go and see the laser show at night at 8, walking distance, close to tsim tsha tsui station, markets just walking distance,all major shopping malls close by,centrally located , execellent breakfast, one of the few hotel serving indian breakfast

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Tsim Sha Tsui, null, Hong Kong
Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Hong Kong””
Reviews.Author: jayeshsaspra
Reviews.Content: “great location and view of hong kong skyline” Hotel Holiday is The service was great and we had access to the executive lounge with overflowing food, drinks, wifi and ipad topped with a great holidayic view of the Hong Kong side skyline :D Breakfast was overflowing with different selections from Chinese, Indian and typical continental breakfast. The only downside was that our room for the first night was available at 9pm. Our room was also not too spacious (3 persons) but the facilities made up for it. The pillows were nice and therapeutic (you can buy from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean, good location, and great service”
Reviews.Author: Kjlevitt
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile. One big plus for me, western style softer mattresses. The hotel is clean and smells fresh from the moment you walk in. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room is good size with clean comfy sheet, pillows and more western style mattress. The bathroom is nice; very clean. The tub and shower are both nice quality too. You have a large closet with bathrobes and slippers. I was very impressed with this stay because the staff told me Happy Birthday, brought me a free birthday cake (it was my bday during the stay) and a Birthday card signed by all of them! Wow, very thoughtful. Hotel has nice restaurants and workout club. The room service and food is also good. Also if you're going out to China and coming back through you can even check a bag with them. this was nice because I did too much shopping then didn't want to carry my extra bag to China so I picked it up at the end of my stay. This worked well since I flew in and out of HK. Only downside, there's a of street noise. I'm sure this is common for the area and for a non city dweller it's hard to get used to. But the hotel inside was quiet all night and morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superior room in the heart of golden mile”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBly
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at this Holiday Inn one night in October 2011 on the recommendation of other TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel certainly did not disappoint. This Holiday Inn property presents much like a four star hotel. It is exceptionally clean and well maintained. It is located a short block from the subway entrance and easy walking distance from the Star Ferry. It is quite literally in the middle of high end shopping and close to a very nice mall with restaurants of all price points. The front desk staff was very professional, friendly and handled the check in process expeditiously. They gave me an room upgrade and offered a free breakfast providing my schedule allowed (it did not). The room was spacious and well appointed with auto-lit closet, flat screen television, and an in-room digital safe. I am pretty sure WiFi was also available, however I had no need for it. The ONLY issue I saw was that parking for guests seemed to be at an absolute premium. This hotel and this location will prove an advantageous and affordable option if looking for a place to stay in the heart of Hong Kong. I would recommend it for either holiday or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Battota_AA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights there in September. It was a pleasant stay that I would like to repeat & recommend. The major positives we liked about it are: - Great location...the Hotel exists in a major street & alive area.. a mall in front of it.. walking distance to the pier and walk of stars.. Tsim Sha Tsui metro station is like 2-5 min away. - 2 night before we arrive, we received a welcoming email, and asking about our references in the room and arrival time and how to arrive to hotel... that was definitely a nice gesture. - lobby was nice big one, with multiple check-in/check-out counters - quick check in - big room size - comfortable big beds - big tv screen - shuttle bus from the airport (not free) it was a good solution the negatives were: - no free wifi... - a bit smelly hotel - the view... we could get a better view if we were on Nathan road

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Milanbhise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 11.10.2011 to 13.10.2011. This an excellent property in the most happening place on Nathan Road. Close to Tsim shatsui MTR and harbour. Good hotel with helpful and smiling staff. One of the best locations in HK. Rooms are big with all facilities that a five star offers. They serve excellent food. 7-11 stores across the road. Better use taxi to Airport if you do not mind travelling by Hotel bus which takes longer route thru different hotels to accomodate more passengers. Overall pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: av8trix2
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel about once-twice a month for business. I'm not paying for the room so I can't speak to the rate, but the hotel is in a great location for shopping and getting on the subway. It has a nice pool on the roof and the staff are very nice. You can actually get a king sized bed here! When we stayed at the Renaissance (now torn down) most of the beds were twins. The rooms are fairly large. Half the hotel faces Mody Road and half faces an area we call Al Qaeda alley. If you are facing Al Qaeda alley you will have a permanent curtain that is effectively immobile.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: steph m
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile for 2 nights. We had previously stayed at one of the top hotels in HK and the service and friendliness of staff at the holiday inn was far far better. We had our room upgraded and managed to check in much earlier than allowed, and tour desk staff were very helpful and practical with ideas on what to do in the area and how to get around. Staff also went over and above their duties to assist us with an issue we had when we bought a camera on Nathan Rd that was way overpriced, which we were so impressed by. Location is fantastic, MTR station is literally around the corner and close to major stores, harbour city, avenue of the stars. Easy to get cabs to and from hotel. Overall we were very impressed with the rooms, staff and service at the holiday inn and we would recommend this hotel for anyone looking at accommodation in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally well located hotel with everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: OzfamilyPerthHills
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We stayed on the 15th floor and like previous reviewer had an unusual view. We knew what to expect as this was Hong Kong and part of the attraction is the colourful nature of the area. The trade off for this was the fabulous value, location and the friendly efficient staff who were welcoming and service oriented. The rooms were really comfortable and housekeeping made sure our requests were catered for. We were made to feel that we were valued guests and all staff were extremely friendly. The breakfast was exceptional. The little bottles of grapefruit juice were wonderful for the adults and the doughnuts at breakfast impressed our thirteen year old boy immensely. Haris bar was a good diversion in the evening and we enjoyed sitting watching the world go by in downtown Tsim Sha Sui. I will be recommending this to my fellow Australian travellers as a great place to base yourself in Hong Kong as its minutes away from the MTR and Star Ferry. The mall opposite provides an extensive array of reasonably priced upmarket places to eat, with a lovely bakery to pick up treats to take back to the hotel and a nice gourmet supermarket in the basement with wine and beer at good prices. A 7/11 also provides a place to pickup little bits and pieces for kids to snack on as well as water bottles and beer. There are several good factory outlets within a few minutes walking distance in Granville RD and the Jade Market is worth a look. This hotel had a refined feel without being stuffy and will appeal to Aussie families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Kestral120
Reviews.Content: Good location. Comfortable room. Choose the business rooms - worth the extra expense as it includes, internet and breakfast. Food at the restaurant is no bad but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Spyhotelier
Reviews.Content: I like the location and the staff services. I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want to live in the shopping district.”
Reviews.Author: MikeyRodrigues
Reviews.Content: Good service, friendly staff, centrally located, next to the tube station, clean , lots of near by places to eat and great place to stay if you want to shop in Kooloon. However the rooms are rather small and don't offer great views.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: bonviveur92
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in september 2011. the price is quite affordable (around 1500 HKD / a night) and the location is one of the best on TSim Tsa Tsui , in walking distance of the avenue of stars , MRT is located 10 meters when you go outside the hotel and all other main attractions are also very close. Rooms are a bit dated but still well maintained and very clean, Wireless internet in your room is available for 140 HKD a night and very fast. The staff is also friendly and willing to help. The breakfast is nothing special but ok , also the coffeeshop from the hotel. So , if you are here on business it's a good place to stay but for holiday I would suggest the sheraton one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but average quality and standard”
Reviews.Author: LaurentP_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a base to visit Honk-Kong at affordable price (still 1500 HK$ minimum per night with breakfast), you can stay here. The rooms need renovatiion and the service at breakfast was not at par with hotels of the same category. The food at the bistro Deli is swiss/german centric and does not provide much other choice. However hotel was quite silent, bed and pillows of very good quality. Special award for the shower curtain which is the best one I have ever seen in term of quality and look and feel!!

Reviews.Title: “Got what I expected....good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Policypeddler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Sep, 2011. Excellent location and free bus ride from train station (airport to train station and shuttle bus...quite easy and well marked!). Check in was fine, room clean with poor view but priced well. Location is excellent with subway station a few steps away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, pretty good service”
Reviews.Author: travelfreakk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 6nights and found this hotel to be very well located and real value for money. It is located on Nathan road which is one of the best places to stay if you like a happening place. It has good restaurants, close to tourist attractions and the harbour is just walking distance. MTR station gate is just outside the hotel on the other side of the road if you want to travel in MTR's. Hotel has good rooms, but could be better as per new Holiday Inn's I've seen but never the less it wasn't bad. Only drawback was that the lifts were a little slow and I had to wait almost 5mins every time I had to take them but since its a busy hotel, I can understand this. You can stay here for a good and comfortable stay at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: guampanda
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here when visiting HK in July. Proximity to subway is extremely important to us while traveling - the subway couldn't have been any closer (literally steps away from the hotel). Service was above average; much better than we expected at a Holiday Inn. We stayed on a premier floor and recommend it to others. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was surprisingly delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Rare 2 queen beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: MwahahaYay
