Reviews.Content: I think this is the only hotel I know of in Hong Kong that actually has two queen beds in a double room instead of two double beds. I think the hotel is clean, has all the necessities. The location is very close to the subway station (about 1 min walk), and surrounded by lots of restaurants, malls, etc. I don't have much to complain about because in Hong Kong you just don't expect that much in terms of space.

Reviews.Title: “strategic location”
Reviews.Author: nikhiljain22
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is the location on the nathan road very near to the metro station. the rooms are good but wash rooms are bit small, staff is very helpful. Food at their newly renovated Bistro is good. Pl book this hotel early as its full throught the year. Check in takes a bit time in this always busy place.

Reviews.Title: “stay for one week but not for one day”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: Best laid plans of mice and men! Planned to stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile one night for a late check in and one night for an early check out. As mentioned in other reviews the location is extraordinary; but extraordinary from the perspective the location is central to all things Hong Kong such as the noise, the people, the fumes from the buses, the prostitutes, the hawkers, the musky smell, etc. Late arrival first day in Hong Kong I expressed a desire for a view. The first day, first room included a view of a curtain blocking a building covered with blue tarp and $6 mini bar. The first day, second room included a view of the street and a view of the 7 Eleven open 24 hours! Early departure last day in Hong Kong I expressed a desire for a quiet room. The last day, first room included a view of the street and noise from the street party associated with a national holiday. The last day, second room included a view of the curtain blocking a building covered with blue tarp and quiet. The staff were very accommodating with the room changes but the changes should not have been necessary! The manager on duty was very accommodating and explained to me the hotel is centrally located to Hong Kong and all things characteristic of Hong Kong. Ironically the late arrival and early departure were to accommodate a stay at the InterContinental Hong Kong; and the IC HK would have been the better option for better rest on both nights. So stay one week and enjoy all things Hong Kong but stay elsewhere for a late arrival or early departure! The cheapest room at the IC HK would be a good option for quiet after a 26 hour journey! And yes some rooms are renovated and some rooms are not renovated. And yes some rooms are musky and some rooms are not musky. After all I did stay in four rooms in two nights. And yes I would stay again but for one week.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: chaos1785
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights here in August 2011 for a weekend. Well stocked mini bar, size of room is okay - nothing too fancy but it's clean and that's what matters! Bathroom is clean as well and seems like everything is kept well. There's a 7-11 conveniently across the street and also access to the TST MTR station. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby as well! Would recommend for cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ShaniCat52
Reviews.Content: Room comfortable with good air con (vital!) and very conveniently located. The Bistro-style restaurant was excellent - such an extensive range of absolutely delicious morsels from which to choose, that we ate there several times. This was our first visit to Hong Kong, but we would be happy to stay here again. Concierge staff very helpful upon our discovering that the coach tour of HK that we had pre-booked and paid for months earlier been cancelled. They rang around to find an equivalent tour operating on that same day, and obtained the last 2 seats for us, to our great relief and gratitude!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: sfdgsdf
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a long journey for the UK, I waited at check in for 15 minutes standing, there was no apology for the delay. When I finally got to my room I didn't think it was too bad, until I saw 2 cockroaches. I stayed in this room as I was too tired to swap, I didn't see any more bugs but 2 was enough! The sink was dirty in the bathroom and there was mould on the ceiling. The bed was comfortable but the room just didn't seem clean nor did it smell fresh. I ordered room service, the food came relatively quickly but was not good at all, no chef is required! When I went to check out this also took a long time even though it was 6am! I do have to compliment the bell boys though, they were very helpful and helped me out when my taxi driver wouldn't give me all my change. For the amount paid, this hotel is well below standard, it is the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buninyong
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is a good, comfortable hotel in the Tsim Sha Tsui area of Kowloon. It is close to the MTR and the Star Ferry. We have been staying in this hotel since the early 1980's for both business and holiday visits and have found it good value. The rooms are a good size with the only criticism being that the bathrooms are relatively small. Only one person at a time. The recent renovations have changed the ambience of the main restaurant. The original Cafe Vienna is now the Bistro On the Mile and it is just that - Bistro atmosphere. There is no interaction between the staff and diners. The whole experience is lacking and atmosphere. For those who know in Australia - Coles Cafe was a similar experience. Would I stay here again - YES!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice wrt Room, Location, Value”
Reviews.Author: ArijitMumbai
Reviews.Content: After a lot of deliberation, I had selected Holiday Inn, Golden Mile, Tsim Sha Shui. The reason for the choice was, we were 4 members (2 child of 7 years) and knowing that hotel rooms in Hong Kong is small, we had to make choice of hotel depending upon the size of the room and the bed. However, we were extremely happy with both. Rooms (double deluxe) was quite spacious. Beds were large enough for 2adults. cleanliness was high, service was good too. There were only 2 things which I did not like - the outside view was terrible, however i was aware of the same. I had insisted on higher floor, but still it did not make any difference. However, since it was family trip, we were out of hotel by 10am and was back only by 10pm and did not feel the view issue to be of any disturbance. However, if you are planning a leisure stay, you may not enjoy the hotel as view is not as good. Second thing which i did not like was - the Mody road entrance had a lot of seedy people after 8pm, mostly call girls, pimps were seen outside the 7eleven store on Mody Road, which made things slightly odd especially when you are with your family. Location wise the hotel was fantastic and C1 exit of Tsim Sha Shui MTR was right infront of the hotel's Nathan Road entry and thus made our travel quite comfortable. especially at the end of the day, stepping out of MTR to enter your hotel was the ideal thing to happen. Also, Star Ferry Pier, Symphony of Light, was 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Overall I would rate the hotel, extremely value for money and would definitely recommend for family travel with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “Regularly happy”
Reviews.Author: gs-aussie
Reviews.Content: 1ST time trsvel with 8 month old. I regularly stay here due to great location. Good rates & great staff. They made this first trip with family a pleasure. Highly recommrded ! Am returning soon to hkg and would not stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Older property in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: fireball50
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was excellent. Shopping, restaurants, sightseeing, public transport are all within walking distance. The staff is great. Helpful and informational. The lobby is always busy. The rooms are however are outdated. They need some renovation. I would rate them 3 and a half stars for this however I rounded up since the location just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Eve H
Reviews.Content: The room was on high floor, large and clean, the staff very freindly, the location is excellent for shopping walking distant to the museum and the ferry. The pool at the roof top was relief at the end of each day. I even got some sun tan. The breakfast had many choices except the coffee was not very good. I recommend this hotel good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Charlie8888
Reviews.Content: Location is great. 3 minutes walk to MRT. Room is average only and aged and so is most of the hotels in Hong Kong. Did not try the restaurants as there are plenty of restaurants/coffee shops around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: countyfan2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 night stop-over en-route to Tokyo. This is a nice hotel with a great location on the Golden mile. Took a taxi from the airport (approx HK$280) and was quickly greeted at the door. Checked in pretty quick (& got a free upgrade). The room was very nice (big bed, lots of space, usual bathroom toiletries & complimentary bottles of water). We showered & went for a walk to the Temple St. market (10-15 mins walk if you walked straight there). The waterfront is a 5-10 min stroll in the opposite direction (& the Star Ferry is there). We really enjoyed our stay here & we will always use this hotel if/when we return to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Not First choice in hk but the worst”
Reviews.Author: smyyz
Reviews.Content: Efficient front desk in check in quick and upgraded also which was nice after 13 hr flight .Room is clean and well stocked but also in need of a make over .Price is right location is great in busy kowloon ,stayed a week and would go back to this hotel with no issue

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: psmith60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights with our children aged 10 and 12. We had booked a double double room and had requested a rollaway bed. Unfortunately the rollaway was at considerable extra cost. We also requested a non-smoking room but were allocated a room on a smoking floor. The children enjoyed the pool, and while there was plenty of comfy sunloungers unfortunately there was little shade available. The pool was best-utilised early in the morning or late afternooon. The hotel location made it very easy to get around and we were greatly impressed with the subway. The buffet breakfast was impressive and recommended, as Hong Kong does not open until after 10am. There is a launderette on the next block up (on the same side as the the hotel, on Nathan Road). The staff were always helpful and friendly, however we did find the Information Desk undermaned, only one employee allocated to this role, with lots of eager tourists trying to gain information meant a bit if a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: missy88sydney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for many years and it is a terrific hotel. The rooms are comfortable, it is spotlessly clean, and the staff are just wonderful. There are great restaurants and you cannot fault the food. The Italian restaurant is quite new, and not really the best Italian I have had, but it is not bad. Lunch is a great buffet, reasonably priced and the food is wonderful. The Chinese restaurant is closed for refurbishment but was fantastic, and always the same. I would imagine when it reopens it will be every bit as good. Sometimes hotels can be quite cold, even though they are deemed to be luxurious. This is not a luxury hotel, it is a warm, friendly and comfortable hotel, well positioned and has everything most travelers need. The executive club is great, with good food and drinks nightly. I really recommentpd this hotel, it has stood the test of time, think I've stayed there 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “not so happy”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysSunnyPHL
Reviews.Content: Good location - horrible smells. I had to change rooms twice to find one with less of a moldy odor. Avoid staying on the 10th or 11th floors - both seem to have mold issues in the hallways and in the rooms. If you don't mind the smell, it's not a bad place. I won't stay here again unless I hear they've redone the interiors and HVAC systems.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when in Hong KOng”
Reviews.Author: choobsta
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times when visiting Hong Kong. It is in a great location, close to shopping and surrounded by many great places to eat. It is also very close to the subway and walking distance to the ferry which will take over to Hong Kong island. The rooms are very classic, clean and comfortable. They have air con which is very much needed in summer and heaters which are very much needed in winter. The breakfast buffet is also very nice. I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money for those with a family”
Reviews.Author: JessiOllie
Reviews.Content: We had a double room = two double beds for 1 adult and 2 teenage girls. We found it very difficult to find accommodation in HK where we could all stay in the same room without sharing a bed. We were on the 2nd floor these rooms don't appear to have been refurbished, although, the room was very clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable and so were the pillows. We used the swimming pool morning and evening. It was fabulous to cool off after a hard day of sight seeing. Hari's bar was reasonably priced but the wait between drinks was long. We didn't use any other facilities to purchase food or drinks. There is a 7/11 store across in Mody St, just next door, shop there for water, so much cheaper than the hotel. The entry to the tube/trains is also right in front of the 7/11 store. Use the tube to get around. The hotel is centrally located in Nathan Rd. Watch out for touts trying to sell suites and knock off watches and handbags. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bhargav1992
Reviews.Content: i like this hotel. and very nice and decent hotel...but little expensive.. so my opinion to all the travellers going to hong kong must stay in holiday inn and it is also near market.. Thank you for your services...Holiday inn golden mile rocks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The room is better on higher floors”
Reviews.Author: ms_Dewijakarta
Reviews.Content: Don't ever accept room on the 5th floor and below. This hotel is very old and these parts has not been refurbished! insist on higher floors. If you get the mody side view than thats fine. if you got the other side then better to keep your curtain shut. The front desk girl will always try to persuade you to upgrade which is a bit off in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location with Great service!”
Reviews.Author: seaquest18
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile last July 15-19,2011. Getting to the hotel was far easier than we expected. We took the Airport express and road the K3 bus which took us to our hotel. Lines at the check in counter was beginning to form but we didn't wait long. Sucre immediately attended to us making sure that our requests are met. Rooms weren't huge but are comfortable enough to fit 4 people. Clean rooms, comfy bed and pillows. This made our stay quite enjoyable. Perfect place to relax after a long day of exploring the city. The staff even surprised one of us with a hand written birthday card. We thought that was very thoughtful! Definitely staying here the next time I go back to Hong Kong. Reasonably priced, Great Location. Fantastic service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, on the higher-end of Holiday Inns”
Reviews.Author: bryli
Reviews.Content: The HI Golden Mile is right in Tsim Sha Tsui, walking distance to most sites you'll want to see in the TST area. The subway is only a few steps away. The service at check-in was above and beyond, but that unfortunately made everything after not seem as great. The room was clean, simple, and upgraded. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted-made a great trip fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: TeamLees
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 children and my parents. We made enquiries about best room and selected a triple premier and double king . These rooms were interconnecting and made our trip - as children were able to move between grand parents and our room-a bit like a slumber party!! Breakfast was unbeleivable and enabled us to eat and head off for HUGE days without the need to snack until late afternoon or dinner.. The staff were wonderful and knew our family by the second day. Room was spotless and location amazing. Yes their are some colourful characters on Mody St but we enjoyed watching out our window the few moments we were in the room amd at no time (day or night) had any concerns for safety here or anywhere in H/K..Cant wait to save up and come again.....

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: lanesend332
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an ideal location in TST. The room was great and the bed was extremely comfortable. This place really is excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norwatt
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after looking at its location. It is great for exploring Hong Kong as it is at the bottom of Nathan Road, but still only a couple of minutes walk from the Star Ferry terminal. Really easy to get to by the Airport Express train as there is a free shuttle bus from the Kowloon Station to the hotel would recommend this as the best way to get there and back. We had requested a connecting room which they managed (although one of the rooms wasn't ready when we arrived and didn't get cleaned until 6pm, but not a big issue). Front desk extremely busy but efficent and helpfull. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfy. Pool was nice. Room service was good. General impression of the hotel was that it was extremely busy, but staff tried hard to meet any requests. Would recommened it as a good option when staying in Hong Kong as it is really central to most things.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back - excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: sridhar_srin
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms with barely three days to as we planned our Hong Kong trip quite suddenly. As we entered into the lobby, we realized that it must be owned/run by an Indian as a little figurette of Shiva can be seen atop one of the walls - plus the lobby was overrun by Indian families for a wedding. The suspicion was confirmed at breakfast the next day where the buffet menu had a few Indian items (poori bhaji etc.) and the Chinese cook behind the counter understood "masala omelette". Overall our stay was very comfortable. We ended up taking two rooms across from each other. Rooms were clean and comfortable and quite spacious. The bathroom could have used some extra space but was clean and usable. WiFi was extra but of good quality. Room service menu was decent and prompt. Being Indians and vegetarians we really did appreciate the breakfast options at the hotel :-). In general we noticed that the hotels in Hong Kong are pricier than their counterparts in Malaysia or Thailand. I'd say that the Holiday Inn rates were par for Hong Kong. The key selling point I believe is the location which is quite fantastic. Located at the end of Nathan Road in Tsim Sha Tsui you step out of the hotel right into the hustle and bustle of Kowloon. The MTR station is barely 2 min away. The boat ferry to Hong Kong is less than a 10 minute walk.. There is shopping galore. The vegetarian Indian "Woodlands" restaurant was barely a 5 minute walk. The hotel sold us the Disneyland entry tickets which saved us around one hour of standing in line at the entry to Disney. Service from the hotel staff was friendly and professional. However you definitely do not see the effusive smiles and service attitude which I' m so used to seeing in other South-East Asian countries such as Malaysia and Thailand.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: winter_turtle
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. Close to train station and within walking distance of the ferry and many attractions in kowloon. The hotel is very basic, but clean. No public bathroom access without obtaining a key from front desk.

Reviews.Title: “pretty ok”
Reviews.Author: sag10
Reviews.Content: the hotel out here is good..rooms are clean..bt the problem is the locality...its nt tht good..at nite..its not tht safe......bt hotel is goods.....next to it there are many electronic stores....the staff is also very helpful...service is good and breakfast its pretty nic..our stay was lovely out here..and its affordable..^_^

Reviews.Title: “excellent location - comfy rooms - adjacent to indian restaurants & good shopping”
Reviews.Author: inias
Reviews.Content: we used the airport express to kowloon & the free hotel shuttle service. overall a quite fast, cheap, comfortable & convenient mode for a family with children & luggage for seven days. we arrived in the aftermath of the new year & the hotel lobby was still beautifully decorated for the next few nights with the a christmas tree & gifts & my daughter was thrilled. built my base at this hotel - & it was a good choice. reached on an early morning flight - the hotel couldnt provide our room that early but for a lil teeny weeny extra they provided a club class room upgrade for the first night with lots of add-on frills. the rooms themselves in the club class & normal king family were effectively the same size with only a slight difference in decor. as i understood it we were fortunate that the hotel was renovated only a few months before in mid 2010. we did not need the hotel restaurant at all as we got superb indian breakfasts, lunch & dinner in the next door chungking mansion dhabas & a couple of indian restaurants on the adjacent modi street. the hotel is on the tst station metro line to hongkong central & Admirality in one direction & the jade market & wonderful street markets of mongkok in the other direction. we took the ocotopusscards & used the metro & convenient buses & trams extensively to disney & ocean park & the shopping districts. a leisurely 5 minute walk from the main tst harbor promenade & splendid kowloon park - this hotel gives extensive opportunities to indulge at night too. we got stuck on the electricity adaptors here also as the pins are different from india - but he hotel staff provided the same free of charge immediately. our club room was facing the modi street & more open while the normal room was on the opposite side facing an under construction bldg - thats the negative of being in such a wonderful location - wont complain much because we only came to the hotel to sleep - the day was for enjoying hongkong to the fullest. it was quite thoughtful of the hotel to give free umbrellas to the guests as rain comes on & off in the days - quite unpredictable.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Coming Back To This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctorfoxtrot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4D3N , with my family and a small group of 13 pax, and i would say that i had a pleasant experience ... for one thing - location is central for all the shopping , and dining ... rooms are quite huge , comfortable, has an lcd tv , nice beds.... breakfast buffet has many choices, from chinese to indian and western cuisine ... however... lobby is not impressive.. the luggages in tour groups are placed outside the hotel before check in and after check out.. and i mean they can stay there for hours.. internet is not free... inspite of this , with service, security, convenience and location being my top priority, staying at this hotel for a 3rd and 4th time won't make me think twice...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: BBKowalski
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by our travel agent when we wanted a family friendly place to stop over on our way from Australia to Europe. We were offered an upgrade when we checked in and it was worth every penny. The room was clean and quiet. Room service was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was excellent, although Nathan Road is full of touts for tailor made suits, but that's part of the experience and the atmosphere was always pleasant. With the upgrade we had access to the Executive Club and the Pool which were well maintained, although the Club was often busy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with the best location advantage”
Reviews.Author: rahul2khetan
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was comfortable, the staff was courteous and helpful. The best part about the hotel is the location - A) Situated bang on Nathan road (heaven for shoppers) B) Lot of good restaurants nearby (both expensive and cheap) C) Metro station entrance just 20 meters away from the hotel lobby. D) Lot of amazing coffee shops near the hotel. The hotel rooms are spacious with all the in-room amenities one expects in a 5 star property. They had a decent spread for breakfast. Not too large and not too small. The view from the hotel can be a sucker. But it did not bother us much as everything else is so good that you hardly pay attention to this point.

Reviews.Title: “Golden memories on the Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: minimi46
Reviews.Content: My wife and had our honeymoon in Hong Kong December 1966!. We visit HKG 2 to 3 times per year and have over those past 45 years stayed at most of the hotels in Kowloon. Of these hotels of which there are many..the Holiday Inn Golden Mile shines the brightest situated at the corner of Nathan and Mody roads. This hotel has the absolute best location on the "Golden Mile" i.e. Nathan Road. MTR Stations (HKG's super efficent subway system) are conviently located on either side of the hotel and some of the best shopping and dining can be found both in and around the hotel. The hotel has excellent Chinese, Italian, Western Deli and one of the best if not THE BEST coffee shops in all of Kowloon. The breakfast and lunch buffets are superior in both quality and variety thus you are assured of a very satisfying dining experience every time. The hotel's newly renovated rooms are top class. Beds, pillows sheets so comfortable. Bathrooms spotlessly clean with full flow showers, 1st class toilet amenites and clean towels renewed daily. Your choice of newspapers, hi speed internet (for a small fee). Prompt room service, roof top pool, a fully equipt gym. Friendly and efficient staff from reception to housekeeping to check out. Yes, the Holiday Inn Golden Mile has it all. After 100+ visits to HKG my wife children and I can honestly say we have golden memories on the "Golden Mile" thanks to the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but getting a bit tired now”
Reviews.Author: Ikychar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for experiencing Hong Kong in all its copy watch and tailor made suit glory. A short walk away from the water front and the great shopping if you don't mind running the gauntlet with said hawkers of watches etc. However the Hotel is getting a bit old and tired and could do with a serious revamp. The executive club is small but the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Hong KOng”
Reviews.Author: Sandbites
Reviews.Content: It is located in the tourist area of Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon island. For first time travelers this is an ideal location. Hotel is in the thick of electronic and clothes stores along the street. It is beside the subway which is one of the safest in the world so you can use this as your jump off point to different areas which you can visit using the subway (locally called the MTR). Dont rent a car, like New York take a cab or subway Hotel is relatively old but recently renovated. Lobby is posh and big enough to consider a proper hotel It is full service with a concierge, bell hops and other amenities. There are restaurants in the hotel at regular hotel prices, no worries restaurants of all price ranges are all within walking distance. Get this hotel as it allows you to walk and shop from 9 to 9. Ocean terminal is a good 10 minute walk from this hotel Bad: Recently however hawkers and solicitors of call cards and money changer outfits loiter outside the hotel, i wish the hotel and authorities would do something about this as it puts a cloud on the hotel's safe reputation.

Reviews.Title: “good location decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhonnyhome
Reviews.Content: busy entrance , rooms good and big staff helpful , upgrade for platinum priority was difficult breakfast excellent internet should be free was 5 days in Hk and slept excelent stayed also with my family was good

Reviews.Title: “SCAM at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler12376
Reviews.Content: I have traveled over 12 times a year to Asia and stayed in various hotels ranging from Courtyard Marriott to Inter Continental and have experienced excelled service. This is the ONLY hotel in the world that I have traveled to that CHARGED internet charges on ALL your computer and phone devices. I have asked the receptionist during the check in process and they told me that there is only one rate for multiple devices. This is reasonable as the Inter Continental Hotel down the road also charged a slightly lower rate. Upon checked out, they told me that I have to pay internet charges for every single device that I logged in. I argued and walked out from the hotel as I find this to be very unprofessional and would not return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth being back to this place”
Reviews.Author: Sarandeep S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is strategically located in the busy market place and next to the Tsim Sha Sui MTR station. From the Airport... there ar many options to reach the Hotel. You can take the Airport express from the airport.. which has a complimentary drop from the railway station (Hunghom bay)... If i remember correctly) to the hotel through their bus feeder system. The check in was slow.. considering it was the new year season and the hotel was streaming with visitors. The view from the room was good as it gave a view of the busy road and the skyline. If you are a foodie... try not having food at the hotel... you may find it expensive and not too much value for money... If you get out of the hotel from the golden mile side... and walk down straight.... you will have many options.. from Mcdonalds (24 hours) to many local eating options which you can find from HK$ 15 onwards. There are many fine dining options and the lobster and the duck are highly recommended. Coming back to the hotel... the hotel is very friendly, especially if you have kids. The quality of toiletries is good and the room size is also good which had two double beds that is good for a family. If you are ordering food... expect the room service to be a little slow. It is better to go down to the restaurant rather than order. The hotel is right above the Tsim sha sui MTR station... and it is advisable to take the MTR in the off peak hours as it is very convenient. Taking a cab may take longer to travel.. considering the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: shwetaj
Reviews.Content: 1)It is located in the heart of the shopping and eating distict. 2)Rooms are a little worn out 3)just at the door step of tsim tsha tsui mtr station 4)loads of eating options around 5)room rate a little steep but i guess you pay for the location

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: nbmiami
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Right on Nathan Rd and only 2 blocks from the East Tsim Sha Tsui MYR station with an elevator--as I travel in a wheelchair. Great value considering the cost of other HK hotels, the hotel is starting to show its age and the rooms are quite small, but it's very clean and a great location for sightseeing. We frequented a few of the true 'local' food spots a block or two behind the hotel, really good!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingunderpants
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels to stay in when in HK. I've stayed here for years, have a corporate rate and priority club Gold member, so typically get the upgrade to club level and the service is superb. Your choice of restaurants within hotel and nearby. Breakfast at the club is excellent as is Happy Hour. This hotel is conveniently located with access to MTR, buses, walking distance to pretty much anything you need. Every room that I've stayed in has been immaculate and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Beds are extremely comfortable, bathrooms spacious. My only issue with this hotel is that the rates can be quite high at times, which is a shame as I would stay there EVERY time if I could. Highly recommend for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location except....”
Reviews.Author: stuchisnall
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on Sunday afternoon for a three night stay and were greeted at reception by a very pleasant and helpful young man. We took him up on the offer of an upgrade to the executive floor as, just before leaving Japan, I had again read the Trip Advisor reviews and took on board the advice to have breakfast included in the room rate. Good advice, but one thing to be wary of is that the breakfast included in the room rate for the executive rooms was served in the Executive Floor lounge, which although adequate had a very limited selection. We chose to pay extra for the buffet breakfast in the bistro on the first floor, where the range of breakfast dishes just couldn't be bettered (the best buffet breakfast that I've ever come across). I could not fault the hotel, except that some of the staff in the bistro on the last morning (only) were a little surly and did not react or clear the tables with any sense of urgency. I like Kowloon itself, which has many excellent shops, bars and restaurants, but the touts who continually pester and offer fake watches, tailoring, etc, were a nuisance. Next time I go to Hong Kong, for this reason alone, I'd probably opt to stay on Hong Kong Island (or buy a t-shirt printed, front and back, "NO I DON'T WANT any fake watches, tailored suits or shirts")

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: drighangchu
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for four nights. quick summary : positives: -location, location, location : can't be a better location in Kowloon. Right in the middle of everything - great breakfast buffet - good concierge staff negatives: - all characteristics of a cookie cutter Holiday Inn model present in abundance. - only view from the room was another building under construction. - tired, old rooms tends to be a bit claustrophobic - guests are mere room numbers, no one smiles in this hotel - food is damn expensive compared to the quality of this hotel. in summary, one of those average hotel experiences which I may not remember after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Business exhibitions.”
Reviews.Author: Kirtijain
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay. No complaints. Good to find such a nice hotel in Tsim Tsha Tsui. Rooms are very large. Very clean. Lobby is very good. Hotel should offer free Wi Fi access. As it helps businessman. For me personally I will visit this hotel again on my next visit. Rest all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tejas006
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel location very good, as its near to fair ground and all the shopping malls are also easy to locate. I have a monthly trip to Hongkong and everytime I just prefer to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “TAKE CARE WHEN BOOKING AS LOWEST RATES PAID MEAN WORST ROOMS ALLOCATED”
Reviews.Author: anndenMelbourne
Reviews.Content: A disappointing stay and a question about the benefits of Priority Club Membership. Over 8 weeks before arrival in Hong Kong we booked a club room at a seniors rate at this hotel. On arrival all paperwork was ready for us, and we were given keys to Room 1622, one floor below the club level and adjacent to the lift well, as incidentally is 1620 and probably all rooms ending in 20 or 22. Our room was acceptable in terms of size and facilities, but it was only during the night with the regular noise of the lift/elevator all through it that we realised we had, what is in hotel speak " a non preferred" room. As we had only one more night to go we made no complaint about it, and suffered the same disturbances throughout the second night. On check out in the club I asked who pre-assigned rooms and was told that room allocation was made at the time of reservation by the reservation department. So 8 weeks earlier as a Priority Club Member of 8 years I was allocated a bad room – not a great display of reciprocal loyalty The conclusion is obvious, if you book online with Holiday Inn at a low rate as we did, a seniors rate, then you will be allocated the worst room in the house rather than the best, and that even if your are a club member that loyalty has absolutely no value. The attitude of this hotel has to be questioned too. It suggests many things few of them complimentary. At the same opportunity I emailed both IHG Asia Pacific Customer Relations on the web and the Hotel GM direct. The former responded in 24 hours with apologies with a request I inform them of the problem. They responded to my complaint promptly thereafter with thanks for telling us of the problem and effusive apologies that as a Priority Club Member I was one of our most valued customers and that they hoped I would stay at IHG properties again. Unfortunately they made no attempt to answer my main question about room allocations. They assured me that the matter would be on record etc etc. From the Hotel 3 days passed before a Duty Manager responded to my email originally addressed personally to the Hotel GM Mr Kirk and which asked them if they were interested to know I had a complaint. I sent the MOD an email with details of the complaint namely – why 8 weeks before my visit had I as a Priority Club Member been allocated a non preferredand noisy room – 3 more days passed and I received a standard computer generated email thanking me for my stay which I returned to the same MOD and asked if that was their reply to my complaint. 1 more day passed and I received an email from a Mr Timothy Chua who suggested that I had not been given a quiet room because: a - I had not asked for one on the internet booking form. b – The hotel was full at the time. I replied to Mr Chua that the latter suggestion was untrue as I had checked the room availability to see if the rates had changed downwards the week before arrival and as for his first suggestion, I asked if they had a mix of noisy and non noisy rooms for people to specify. I also suggested again that the reason for the poor room had all to do with revenue. Mr Chua responded to these points by stating that A: all our rooms in our hotel are at its best condition and there is not a single room that is slightly better than the other relative to the same room category That statement is a nonsense, and also contradicts his suggestion that I ought to have asked for a quiet room, Why would anyone waste time doing so – all rooms in each category are now the same according to him. B: our staff allocated the best possible room based on the king size and non smoking room you previously requested. That statement too is incorrect, for had it been the case the hotel would have been full and not have been able to accept a reservation for another room in the same category in another location one week before my arrival. So when all I wanted was an explanation of the allocation and perhaps an apology, all I got from the Hotel was tardiness and obfuscation. From The IHG customer service, they clearly had no influence on the hotel and felt unable to address my question on the Hotel’s behalf, and offered effusive apologies for the event. Just as a comparison of attitude, when I checked in at the Regency Club in Xian a day later, an upgrade to a suite was provided, despite the online booking being at their best available internet rate and even though I had not stayed at a Hyatt Hotel for 8 years. In that period IHG had had the lion’s share of my business. Caveat Emptor with Holiday Inn Golden Mile. Despite an offer for an upgrade on my next visit I would not go back to this hotel in any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Subway Access”
Reviews.Author: MocNJen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times on business. The location is great to catch the subway just outside to get you anywhere in HKG. There is a lot of "action" on Nathan Road...lot's to see (as long as you don't mind the constant person coming up to you to ask if you want a copy watch, DVD, handbag, or a suit made). The hotel is clean with a workout room that is nicely sized with good equipment. Pool is on the roof with nice views...and the breakfast served in the Concierge Lounge is great!

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveleyes2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desperate need of a remodel. Very worn rooms and hallways. Nice lobby though. They are running good promotions for the executive club level. Def worth the small extra charge for free food drinks wifi concierge etc. Service reasonably good. Def a budget hotel though. Book over their Internet website for the best rates

Reviews.Title: “The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is the place to stay in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: DudeMan01
Reviews.Content: Just a few lines to say thank you to the management and staff at the Holiday Inn-Golden Mile. My wife, myself and my two daughters had a wonderful time staying at your hotel especially as a result of the excellent location of the hotel. We took advantage of the shopping, enjoyed a Harbor cruise, and visited several of the nearby museums. We also enjoyed your beautiful swimming pool and excellent restaurants and were also able to access other parts of Hong Kong easily given the close proximity (directly out the front door) to the city's subway. Our trip to HK would not have been as enjoyable had we stayed any where else. Thank you and keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by its services and customer care”
Reviews.Author: davolaki
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost all Intercontinental Hotel Group hotels in Hong Kong, this is my first stay at Holiday Inn Golden Mile. I've been to its restaurants many times and they were good; and I've had excellent experiences at other IHG properties in HK, and they were good. So, I decided to try Holiday Inn Golden Mile, as I have some business on the Kowloon side this time. And I was disappointed. 1. check-in. when I approached the check-in desk. There were 3 people behind the counter "doing things", and NONE of them offered to serve me. I stood there waiting for 5 mins before one guy reluctantly looked up to waive me over. Once I was at the counter, he was very efficient; but that goes for everyone in super-efficient Hong Kong. 2. then, I was told that I had to pay HK$170+ per day to use the Internet. In almost ALL IHG hotels that I have stayed at throughout the world, this is the FIRST time I was told that I had to pay for Internet. I told her that I'm a Platinum member and if I could use it for free (like some other hotels that charges Internet), and she politely said no. This is ridiculous. Internet is an essential part of everyday life; you might as well started metering water and electricity and ask the guests to pay for those! I was extremely disappointed. I could've stayed at Holiday Inn Causeway Bay and Crowne Plaza Causeway Bay, at similar rates, and use Internet for free and save me an equivalent of roughly 10% of the room rate. 3 & 4. The following two points are perhaps minor points, but it shows the consistent [lack of] service attitudes of the staff. 3. In most branded hotels, when a hotel staff is waiting for the elevator/lift with a guest, the hotel staff normally allows the guests to enter first, as courtesy. In Holiday Inn Golden Mile, I was waiting for a lift with a hotel staff. When the lift door opens, he walked in first. Ok, it is not the end of the world, but it really shows the service attitude of the staff in this particular hotel. Even in the worst 3 stars hotels in the middle of USA, staff will allow guests to enter first. It's just courtesy, they are your customers and your guests. 4. Another thing I noticed is that when I walk past the cleaning staff in the corridor to my room, they do NOT greet me. This does not happen in other IHG hotels in Hong Kong. And again, it shows the service attitude of the staff is consistent ... consistently lacking ... from check-in to entering lifts to cleaning staff and to the management who decided to charge for Internet even for Platinum members. 5. The building is old, the rooms are tired. The bathroom is horrible. It is like stepping into a motel built in the 70s. It is clean, but it is very tiny, dated, and hence very uncomfortable. Unless it drops its rates to at least 30% BELOW that charged by Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay, I would NOT choose to stay at this hotel again. Given the services, the Internet, and the dated and tiny bathroom (Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay's bathroom is modern, spacious, and comfortable); the correct and fair price point for this hotel should be 30% below Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: qldkid
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel really suited our needs for visiting Hong Kong Island, Macau, Shenzhen and Kowloon as well. Best advice would be take the upgrade for free WiFi, great buffet breakfast, happy hour daily, laundry discount, use of executive lounge, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday inn almost crowne plaza standard”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Great welcome as platin um pc mber.free upgrade to refurbished quiet room on 5th floor. No view but this is central hkg.spacious well furnished king room. 10mins walk from star ferry.shops all around.ignore the touts which are an irritation but you won't be bothered by them elsewhere in hkg. If you tire of the bustle head for the ferries to the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever.”
Reviews.Author: PamelaChilders
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Golden Mile, Nathan Road, Hong Kong. Right in the middle of all the action and only a cheap taxi ride to Ladies Market and Night Market. Stayed in a refurbished room on the non-smoking Floor 6. Had a glitch with the room safe and phoned reception for a solution. Within 5 minutes the engineer was at my door to repair it. Best and most prompt service I have ever had in a hotel, from Reception to Room Service to the doormen. The bathroom was small but adequate with not only a shower head mounted on the wall but also a hand-held European shower handle, which is a must. Even though Hong Kong is considered a safe destination I would have liked to had room key access only to the elevators. WiFi connection was charged at AUD$20 per 24 hours which I thought was expensive. Overall, a very enjoyable stay in this vibrant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There are better.......”
Reviews.Author: Marais72
Reviews.Content: Travel to hong kong regularly and had to stay here as usual hotel was fully booked due to tv and film convention. Last time I stayed here was about 7 years ago and it's not as I remember. Sorry holiday inn, but I won't stay again, room was so so hot even with a/c on, so restless few nights sleep, bathroom smelt and tiny, needs some updates, v busy hotel so difficult getting any assistance at desk, breakfast good with wide selection. Room service was very quick and staff lovely. Location is very central but I find this negative, as a female lone traveller I don't like being stared t or harassed as soon as I step outside the hotel, also nightclub or similar opposite which can be heard till early hours and streets are littered in the morning. Stayed in 2 different rooms and no view from either, just a block of flats. I say pay a bit more and stay closer to the harbour away from Nathan road.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and would stay here next time we are in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Ken3816
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel as part of a Cruise Package Deal and it made a good impression straight away when we were able to check in about 5 hours earlier than advertised. The hotel is very well located amid many types of restruants and shops and is a short stroll from the surprising Kowloon Gardens and the Star Ferry. Our room was quite spacious and was well fitted out with good quality extra's including a complimentary power adapter that was available for purchase. Mini bar prices were reasonable by hotel standards and the various eating places within the hotel produced good quality food and a huge buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for HK stopover”
Reviews.Author: guidedbythelight
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night whilst transiting to Japan. Easy to get to via airport train and shuttle bus - though our bus stopped across the road from the hotel making for a fraught road crossing with luggage. Room was very good with 3 twin beds accommodating the four of us. Many HK hotels seem to limit rooms to 3 guests so this was a very good feature of the hotel. Location very good to throw yourself into the bustle of Nathan Road and a short walk down to the Star ferry terminal for great harbor views. Close to MTR stations. We caught cab back to airport for early departure which was cheaper and faster at that time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy bedroom”
Reviews.Author: stokeswest
Reviews.Content: Have staye at this hotel many many times. This stay, I was put in a room facing Mody Road, close to the 7-11 store. Unfortunately I could not sleep at night-noise and rowdiness from this location was totally unacceptable. It is not the Hotel's fault, just the lack of policing at this location-from the bedroom window you can just see what is going on-prostitution, drug dealers and drunks. Hong Kong is not what it makes it out to be - IT IS GETTING QUITE DANGEROUS. This is unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room”
Reviews.Author: jerryinKentucky
Reviews.Content: I can hardly believe the good reviews this hotel has here. I was on a Globus Tour of Japan and China, Hong Kong being the last stop. Thankfully, Globus no longer uses this hotel, hopefully, they had many, many complaints about this place. The room I had was described as a singles room and it was deplorable. Very old furniture, old moss green carpet with cigarette burns, old bathroom furnishings and plumbing. When I opened the drapes to let in some light I was treated to a disgusting rear view of a slum apartment building. Had to keep the drapes shut to not feel like I had crossed into the Twilight Zone after the nice hotels in Japan and China. The only possibly good thing I could say about this hotel was the location, the lobby was nice. Otherwise, forget this place, I wish I could have.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money, nicely refurbished rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CarKri02
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 2 night stopover on our way back from a skiing trip in Canada to take the kids to Disneyland and help them recover from jetlag. The hotel is in a great location, close to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR train station (we took the train to Disneyland rather than brave the HK traffic in a taxi) and the shopping district of Nathan Rd. We had a deluxe family room for ourselves and our two children aged 5 and 6, which consisted of 3 double beds in a good sized room. The bathroom was small but nicely refurbished. The decor was tasteful and stylish for a midrange hotel. We were able to check-in early at 9.30am which was a huge relief after a longhaul flight with the kids, and checkout is 12 noon which allowed us to stay in our hotel right up until our airport transfer for our afternoon flight. The buffet breakfast in the bistro is one of the best for variety, presentation and quality of fare, far beyond that expected for a midrange 4 star hotel. My only criticism was that the valet rolled his eyes when he saw how much luggage we had (skiing trip with 2 young kids - it is hard to travel light!) which was an irritating start to an otherwise enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything !!”
Reviews.Author: cjta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel. We upgraded our room which was worth it with 2 kids running around. We were in a renovated non-smoking room which was perfect. Clean, roomy (by HK standards) and a view of Mody Street/Nathan Road. The breakfast was fantastic and the staff during breakfast were always very friendly, chatty and willing to help. The hotel is central to shops, eats, MTR (which was so easy to use) and the Star Ferry. You would not get a safer place to stay, except the only drawback would be the 7-Eleven on Mody St which appears to be a 'hangout' for some suspicious and sometimes loud people. Initially we found them a bit scary, but they didn't bother us when we went into the shop. All up this is a great city hotel with very helpful staff from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping or people watching, pricey room. A little far from the airport.”
Reviews.Author: dlrollo
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a larger room. Was it worth it? Maybe. Free breakfast and evening snack in the executive lounge. Free wi-fi and a great view from the 10th floor. Convenient bus pickup to and from Kowloon Station, but quite a distance from the airport. Impeccable service at the front desk. Good English and a smile made this weary travelers day! Shops "beneath" the hotel very convenient and out of the pressing crowds on the sidewalk. I would stay again, but without the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like you are in ur second home”
Reviews.Author: narindergulati
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Golden Mile is one of the best hotel in Hongkong and its location enhances it even more and make it a preference for visitors. The staff is excelent and so are the rooms. Getting out of the hotel Malls ,Shops, Restaurants, MTR are just few steps away. I would give this hotel a Five STAR Rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in town & great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieW69
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay. Great location near the end of Nathan Rd with only a short walk to the water front and ferry terminal. The bedroom view leaves a lot to be desired if you are in the rear of the hotel however we didnt go there to sit in a bedroom. The breakfast was fab, so much choice! Great service throughout the hotel. Nice clean pool area. You will get asked all the time on Nathan Rd if you want to buy bags and watches but this isn't a reflection in on the hotel, if you say no they leave you alone. Would definately recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It just gets better at Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: ahneo
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I am staying at Holiday Inn Golden Mile. It just gets better with each stay. The location is superb! The nearest station is just next to the hotel and shopping is all within walking distance. We didn't have to spend much on transport because good food and shopping is just around the vacinity. Upon arrival at the hotel, a bellman helped to unload our luggages from the airport express bus. At the check-in desk, we waited at the Priority Club counter while a staff was attending to a Gold member. She looked at me and gestured for us to wait at the reception counter instead. However, she was quick to recognise the Platinum card I was holding and immediately informed her fellow colleague to assist us. Eunice promptly did a fast and efficient check-in and upgraded my room to the newly renovated premium room. She was so detailed in the check-in procedures that I need not ask a single question. Everything was clear and well-informed. Our room on the 6th floor is clean and spacious. Most of the amenities we need are provided. The noise level from the streets and roads can be rather disturbing but I guess it's pretty much the same in the other hotels. Everything went well throughout our 3nights stay. The only complain I have is the rude intrusion we encountered on the last day. The housekeeping lady opened our hotel door at quarter past 12 in the afternoon, without knocking or pressing on the door bell, despite that I have already pre-informed my check-out time at 2pm during the check-in with Eunice. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to my friends for its location and excellent service. Special thanks to Eunice who check-in for us and Timothy who attended to our check-out. Both of you are very warm and courteous, provided excellent service, that made us feel welcomed a hotel guest, and most of all, privileged as a Priority Club member.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Janelle_9
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the recommendation from friends who have stayed there a few times. Arrived 11.30pm,checked in quickly,asked to upgrade to premier room which I did.So glad I chose to upgrade.As I had booked 2 rooms one would not be available until next day so I had to stay in the standard room for one night.Very dated but clean and ok .The view from the window was terrible.The premier room was great,comfortable beds,lovely bathrooms.We had two rooms on the 5th floor one king & one with 2 double beds.I had one that faced Nathan Rd & my daughter & niece had one that faced the back street. The breakfast was fabulous one of the best I have ever had.Lisa the woman who greeted us evey morning is an asset to Holiday Inn.She is so friendly and professional.The location is close to everything and very close to the harbour and Tsim Sha Sui train station. This hotel is one of the best I have stayed in,staff wonderful & overall experience great.I would also recommend the Big Bus Tour,Lantau Island Ngong Pong Cable Car ride to the Giant Budda. We used the train system.Best transport I have ever seen & used.Very easy to understand and used their octopus card which is a swipe card that you put credit onto. Went to Shenzen shopping.We had no trouble getting a passport at the border.The people can be a bit intimiditating but you slowly get used to that.It is a huge day out shopping but very cheap.Dont forget to take your small wheelie suitcase,we only took one but we could of filled another two.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room,slow check-in/out.”
Reviews.Author: Tony-Xu
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 2 nights over the chinese new year period. Hotel is old but well located in the heart of the Tsim Sha Tsui & easy to shopping,MTR,eating,sightseeing. Staff very helpful & friendly. Breakfast is ok though no too much choices for we chinese. My complaints : 1、c/i & o too slow: we wait 30 mins+ c/i & 15 mins+ c/o. Maybe they should update their system for easy searching; 2、We fully ppd 1 king delux 1.5 months before but n/a when c/i or I have to wait, then was upgraded to 1 double executive. We acceped for my wife tired & need a rest. But,the "executive" room size is poor & need a renovation at once I think. Maybe we try a executive club next time for it maybe always ready. Still,it's my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: jenzbiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. My only complaint would be that we are non smokers and were put on a smoking floor but our travel agent didn't request non smoking. Stayed here also in 1994. Great location, nice rooms and comfortable beds. DEFINITELY TAKE THE BREAKFAST OPTION! It is fantastic! So many different foods on offer including Chinese, Japanese, Indian and English. A real delight to your senses and well worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: flametrees
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed here for a week and we were more than happy with the hotel. Tracey on the front desk was lovely to deal with and we found the house-keeping and staff in the bar very friendly. The room was clean and spacious (for HK) with two very comfortable double beds, pleasant decor and modern bathroom facilities. The Osteria restaurant in the hotel is well worth visiting - top quality food, excellent, friendly service and great ambiance. There is a cheap and efficient laundry round the corner in Hart St - be warned that you will need to put your "whites" in for dry-cleaning as they will come back gray if you put them in for general laundering! Also check out the Tack Long Pharmacy around the corner for the best priced perfume and skincare products going! The staff are so much nicer than those in Bonjour! The only downside to this hotel is that the door on Nathan Road is closed late at night and it can be a bit intimidating getting round to the main entrance past the groups of men just hanging around the 7/11 - they never say anything or approach you but it is still a little uncomfortable if you are female. The only other negative - and this has nothing to do with the hotel - is the plethora of touts outside on Nathan Road trying to flog fake watches, handbags, etc. but if you totally ignore them, they will peel away and hound someone else! This hotel is the best Holiday Inn that we have stayed in & we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good enough rooms”
Reviews.Author: 5hreek
Reviews.Content: The location is superb and the rooms are OK. It's not the best 4 star hotel i've ever stayed in, but it's good enough. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were OK both times i stayed - not WOW, but OK. Clean, good internet connection, good breakfast, good choice of TV channels - all good stuff for a business traveller. Annoyed that the swimming pool was closed for annual maintenance, but that's not a major complaint.

Reviews.Title: “The Renovated Rooms are Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: jjb415
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile in Kowloon started on Christmas Eve 2010 and arrival was tricky due to the streets around the hotel being closed for the evening to celebrate the holiday. Our bus from the airport was able to drop us off at a nearby hotel where bellmen from the Holiday Inn escorted us and carried our luggage 2 blocks to the hotel. My room, one of the newly renovated ones, was the most effeciently organized hotel rooms that I've ever seen. Not one inch of space is wasted. Lighting is good, the desk setup is well-organized, and the bathroom, while small, is pleasantly decorated. While I enjoyed the room, quite a lot of noise comes into the rooms from the outside. While I was not above Nathan Road, which would be very noisy, the alley outside my room had people yelling and making noise both nights well into the morning hours. Desk staff are friendly and effecient. All other staff seemed happy and greated me with "Merry Christmas" at every encounter. The rooftop pool is very nice and the gym is well-equipped and clean. This trip was a return to Kowloon after many years and I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the neighborhood & availability of good food. However, being constantly pestered on the streets by salesmen selling suits is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Vett08
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel located right along the golden mile. Close to all forms of transport. Room service was reasonable prices. Staff were very helpful and friendly at all times

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: selavon
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my wife and two kids between Christmas and New Years. This was the only hotel we found that accepted up to four guests in a room. Room was spacious. Room service was prompt. Included awesome breakfast buffet with international menu (kids under 11 were free). Location was perfect, smack dab in the middle of shopping district. Front desk was helpful and had money change better than airport. The only negative was that Wifi was $20 for 24-hours. We were so busy anyway that I only used it one time.

Reviews.Title: “Our home-away-from-home in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Joan L
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile when we visit Hong Kong. It is close to the MTR station and close to tons of shopping and restaurants, with new malls opening all the time. We like to go to the noodle-and-congee shops of Tsim Sha Tsui for quick, tasty, authentic and inexpensive meals, though this trip we did dine in the hotel a few times and found it to be quite good. We had a room on a non-smoking floor which was quite clean and welcoming, no funny smells as mentioned in other reviews. This is our favorite Holiday Inn in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Canboy
Reviews.Content: Room is big by Hong Kong standard but need some updating. Location is great. Few meters from MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: searay34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my brother and wife stayed here for three nights in late November. The check in process was fast (used iPad's), efficient, painless, courteous and all done with a smile. So far so good. The thing was it just kept getting better. Whether it was front desk staff, concierge to arrange transport to the airport, house keeping staff or staff in the club level lounge they were all pleasant and always acknowledged you with a smile. The club lounge breakfast and happy hours were terrific and I think a bit beyond what I had expected of an H Inn. We did make use of the roof top pool and had it mostly to ourselves for most of the day. Excellent. I am am a critical sort but really could find fault with the staff, the hotel and certainly not the location. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel with convenient access to transport, shopping and restaurants, this is a great place to experience what Hong Kong has to offer. I cannot recommend it highly enough. As Holiday Inn's go, it was exceptionally good and so plan to stay here again in April.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at TST area”
Reviews.Author: CHAM2
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Holiday Inn Golden Mile located at Mody/Nathan Road Last Dec. 1, 2010. The location is on the center of TST, with all shopping areas around, near the harbor and Hk Museum, avenue of stars, K11 mall, Miramar shopping center, MTR stations on all corners,etc. Great for tourists with elderly and young children because everything is within your reach, No uphill or downhill road . Their buffet breakfast is expensive, but you can find cheap restaurants outside the hotel along carnarvon road. The hotel service is of 5-star rate. The elevators on the ground floor are quite old already, but the ones on the premier room floors are OK. Their premier room which we stayed at is spacious enough for 3 adults and 1 infant. The staff on the front desk are accommodating, no problem with check-in and out. Their bell boys were helpful too as well as of those form housekeeping dept. But those people on the tour desk are quite snob and they don't even smile when you approach them for assistance. Overall, My family and i were all satisfied with our stay and would definitely go back here on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - One of the best hotels to check in”
Reviews.Author: ahdoshi
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at holiday inn golden mile in hongkong from 14-9-10 till 19-9-10 and i must say its one of the best business hotels we have stayed in, the staff is friendly and the conceirge is very helpful though their accent of english is a bit different from us, they write it down to make us understand the breakfast buffet is huge and has variety of option for both Veg and non Veg all phone calls are routed and faxes and messages are intimated to the guest promptly the gymnasium, swimming pool and spa is great too the rooms are sophisticated and bathrooms are well maintained the location is excellent, all the free shuttles from kowloon station stops in here the ferry point is close by and the shopping near the hotel is excellent and its open till midnight. Its just bit overpriced but its deifnitely worth it

Reviews.Title: “BIg rooms and great location, but small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: dalandan_soda
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family, booked 3 rooms, 1 de luxe and 2 standard. Got an upgrade for 2 standard rooms to de luxe rooms, perks of being a priority club member. Also got an early check-in and late check out. The bathroom was quite small, but the room was very clean and looked newly renovated. Location is excellent, K11 mall and iSquare mall is just across the street. MTR exit is 1 minute away (stairs), 5 minutes away (Elevator) Paid in room internet connection was very slow. just go to K11 for free wifi. Watch out for annoying Indian males who will sell you tailored suits and fake watches along Nathan Road the moment you step out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: nicksibubs
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I love HK and I hope to get the opportunity to go back one day! We were lucky enough to spend 3 weeks here and I can honestly say that we found so many things to do and see that we never got bored! The hotel was lovely, the staff were really courteous, friendly and helpful even when faced with our teenage children running around like loonatics! For once, nobody complained about the food, which was like banquet dining! The choice is amazing! This is still the best hotel I have stayed in. No wonder I want to go back! It can be a bit seedy just to the side of the hotel off the main street where there are lots of prostitutes operating. They don't tend to approach the ladies at all, but will approach your men if they are alone. We went on a few organised tours, which the hotel organised for us. One was the heritage tour, which was absolutely excellent. We also visited Disney, of course! We went to temples and markets and went across to Maccau. Temple Street was nice and Avenue of Stars is worth a trip. It is a place where you just need to experience it all!

Reviews.Title: “Big room, good location”
Reviews.Author: bellaadventures0110
Reviews.Content: Location. The hotel is well-situated in the shopping district. Very close to the MTR and the shops are just outside the hotel. The area is well-lighted and booming with energy up to the wee hours. Rooms. The size of the Deluxe Room is big (at least 30 sq meters) compared to the other rooms we have stayed in Hongkong. The room includes a 2-seater couch and a table plus a desk. The bathroom is quite small though. The room in general was clean. The bedsheets and pillows are comfortable. Amenities. No free wifi. Had to pay $6 for a 1 page print-out. Service. The staff were very helpful in giving directions and attending to our request.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it really is!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leda_London_007
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel, as all the hotels that we had listed were fully booked- so at 7 o'clock in the evening we had to book somewhere and this was only of the only hotels which had free rooms - but at an believable high price!! We have paid less for 5* hotels in London, New York, Rome and Bangkok!! The room is nice, but you have to pay extra if you need wi-fi in the room- do not go for executive offer as the food they include is shocking! The location is good, as it is close to the shops and markets; but be careful late in the evenings as it is a bit of red-light district. It was scary walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - everywhere close and great value”
Reviews.Author: amandajolly
Reviews.Content: We arrived from London on way to Australia - we stayed for three nights - the location was fantastic - we walked outside the door and shops and harbour and everything close by. The reception was manned well and you didnt need to wait - nothing was too much trouble. The bar in the hotel was busy and good to go and sit in - some nights they had entertainment on. The restaurant choice was good and would recommend both. Smetimes its nice to eat in hotel as you get good quality food - it can be hit and miss outside !! The small pool was lovely and great at end of day when you wanted to chill - also you could get snacks up there which were very good and good price. The only comment I would say negative we ordered room service for breakfast and it was expensive - the rest is great and nothing really to complain about - I like 5 * quality and I think this was excellent and very good value. The money I saved not going to a five star meant I could go shopping..........................

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: CherryPuppy
Reviews.Content: This property is located such that it fronts on Mody Road with access from Nathan Street as well (though the Nathan access is not 24 hours - it closes late night and opens early morning). Check-in was quick (late night), check-out was way too long. Granted its a busy hotel, but the management should by now be able to work out the peak check-out times and provision appropriate staff. I was upgraded to their refreshed premium room, which was very nicely appointed (though I could still slightly smell the recent paintwork). Bed was comfortable, as were the amenities. I dined at the in-house restaurant which was just OK since I ordered off the menu. Their buffet spread is probably a better option, but it does close at 9:30 pm which was a bit annoying. There is a bar on the mezzanine level which is not too bad, but being Hong Kong there are numerous options for restaurants and bars all over. The security staff were a bit strange. A business colleague dropped me off late night (very early morning actually) and wanted to use the toilet before heading home. The security staff said there wasn't any available as they were closed - I find this very bizarre for a hotel of the IHG chain, and frankly cannot see why this is so. This was a first for me (and I travel extensively). I wonder what happens to a guest checking out early morning who would like to use the conveniences. The entrance to the hotel is off a busy small side street, and pretty much always congested. Getting a taxi can be a pain. The Airport Express shuttle bus does visit the hotel, so make use of that (you can always get off at another hotel where you see a taxi rank close by). I would be hard pressed to stay here again, as the InterContinental Grand Stanford is a much better option for just a few dollars more, and (there are no issues with using the conveniences!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent service - not a great view”
Reviews.Author: hrhs
Reviews.Content: One night stopover on way back from Europe - only hotel we could find with family room - paid for an upgrade NZ$30 at 8am as room not ready (worth it to get a shower) - check out was given until 4pm next day - wondeful. Service was great - breakfast was very good - lovely staff. We had dinner in an Italian restaurant in the brand new mall opposite - excellent food. Yes you do get suits and watches offered to you at the door - but you would anywhere here!!! The view from the room was not good - but!! this is HongKong! If you want to have a nice view pay the money and stay at the waterfrontage hotels - if you want a bit of reality - this is great for a night or 2

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn standard - nothing sensational but up to minimum standard”
Reviews.Author: dojies
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and had to wait in short line for reception. A short line that did not move for what seemed like an eternity. When finally advanced to reception we were told that our room was not yet ready and we should go and see the town. Should have been told to go to the back of the queue as that would probably have taken up all the time. We were upgraded????? to a room that had a beautiful view of the next door building that was last painted, possibly pre WW2. Lighting in the room was adequate if all you wanted to do was watch TV but to read a book whilst lying on a bed .......... a definate no go. Two double beds sharing one bedside table and table lamp. Position is good, but in HK with their excellent MTR and inexpensive taxi's, position is no longe as important as it was in years past. Internet service was at pirate rates as is expected in most hotels, but the K11 shopping centre across the road from the back entrance has free WiFi and for the cost of a coffee, there is comfortable seating, and yummy cakes

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rae1414
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, probably the nicest Holiday Inn's we have ever stayed at. It's located right off Nathan Street which has a ton of shopping, it's only a few minute walk to the Promenade and Star Ferry, and there's a metro stop right out front. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Zoglets
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention that took place in its conference rooms. I got a club room which gave me access to the club lounge and its happy hour of free drinks and appetizers. One can do all transactions at the club room desk, including check out, which is very convenient. I forgot at least two items at the club lounge during breakfast which the staff identified and returned to me. That was excellent service on their part. The hotel is located in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui which makes it of course very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mangalparekh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn Golden Mile for six nights. The location of the hotel is very nice just opposite to the metro station. The sight seeing places, the shopping malls, the branded shops, all are just a walking distance from the hotel. The view from the hotel rooms is not very great. We were upgraded both the times to the newly renovated rooms on the eleventh and fourteen th floor. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were small but clean with all the modern amminities like bath-tub hair dryer etc. The breakfast at the coffee shop was lavish. Apart from breakfast we did not dine at any other restaurant. We opted to eat at other eateries near the hotel.The roof top swimming pool was nice. Overall a nice hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, easy, no problems”
Reviews.Author: welingtonanna
Reviews.Content: The reception staff exceptionally welcoming and very helpful. Room small, but clean. Great location, good shopping very handy and close to ferries. Hideous view from the room. Would definately go back. Hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: adesmart
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly large property along the main commercial strip of Kowloon. The hotel itself is very impersonal with little character. However it has most of the facilities you might expect (including a surprisingly good gym, and a decent rooftop pool with sun terrace and bar). It is not cheap - but this is Hong Kong, and hotels here are not cheap!! Breakfast and wi-fi are shockingly expensive extras. Location is excellent and service gave me no problems. Room was large by HK standards, a big comfy bed and a nice bathroom with bathtub and lots of free toiletries. Bathrobe and slippers and free bottles of mineral water were most welcome.
