Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller3530
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at the golden mile, decent stay, efficient check in and check out, good resturants , excellent breakfast, the location, personally i dont like it, as its too crowded always outside the hotel, but its not such a big problem all in all hotel is good and service excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amsam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on Nathan Road, Kowloon. The rooms are on the smaller side but are clean and well appointed. The decor is nothing great but functional, newish and without any need of repair. There are no views from the hotel room. The complimentary bottled water is a bonus. Basically the hotel is on top of Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. Easy walk to Harbour centre and ocean terminal shopping malls. A short walk to the harbour and 10 minute walk to the ferry terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: shantichop
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates, comfortable and clean room, great location and a short walk to Harbour City!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I had three nights at this hotel and the location can't be faulted. However the hotel is expensive and if you can find a cheaper hotel in the same location or close by, go for it! The rooms are spacious (most hotel rooms in Hong Kong can barely fit your suitcase) modern decor and very clean but the bathroom amenities weren't anything special (home brand types of soap etc). After 8 nights on a Chinese bed, this bed was sooo soft! The breakfast buffet was excellent in very modern decor room. This area of Hong Kong is excellent because its a short walk to the river where the Arts Centre is, its opposite an MRT station, lots of excellent restaurants nearby (I got whisked up several floors to a restaurant frequented by locals and had a marvellous meal - a waitress was flapping a menu on the street corner and so I followed her!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: stokeswest
Reviews.Content: I travel to Hong Kong almost every month and have been staying at the Holiday Inn for a number of years. Service is terrific and the location is wonderful. Just step outside the Hotel and you are right there. Tip, instead of going down the golden mile, try going down Mody Road, you will be amazed at what you find-bars, restaurants and small shops.Also, do not miss the Temple on Shanghai street near Temple Street. The German restaurant on the lower floor is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience in HK”
Reviews.Author: AlexPOxford_UK
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was our luck but our experience was very poor. Our flight was cancelled the previous day, we had to wait in the airport for almost 24 hours and we arrived exhausted. Although I had alerted the hotel about our situation the receptionist informed us that the night that we missed would be charged anyway. OK, I understand that (even if I think that there was space for flexibility). We asked for an extra night and she gave us a rate 3 times more expensive. Of course, I did not accept. The room was clean but although we asked for a king size bed we were given a queen. There were towels only for one person (we had to ask for more). Amenities OK except for slippers (a standard item in hotels in HK and China). We had to ask for that too! Exhausted and crunky and then another blow, the internet surcharge: £7 for an hour or £14 for 24 hrs. Finally, next morning we were waken up by the noise of drills on the wall. Fair to say that in the room there was a letter saying that the hotel's water system needed renewal and that there would be works and noise but this dd not help much in bettering our Holiday Inn Golden Mile experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Anil001
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my travel agent i.e Destination Holidays New Delhi.And i stayed for second time in this hotel, my room was so good, as all the hotels in Hong Kong have small rooms. Staff was great & so cooperative, but the main reason for me to stay in this hotel was Location right in center of Tim sha shui which is the main shopping hub of Hong Kong and also lot of Indian restaurants near by. Another plus point for hotel is MRT is just a min walk. so if u r on good budget i would suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler6010
Reviews.Content: We stay for 4 nights with 2 Children aged 12 & 16. Rooms were a bit small but fine for our needs. Staff were very friendly & spoke english well. There were renovations going on on some floors so it could be quite noisy if you were in your room during the day. As we really only used our room as somewhere to sleep this was not a problem for us. Everything was very clean but don't expect a nice view if you look out the window. Located right next to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR it was very convienient. Also walking distance to a small laundry on Hart Ave where you can drop your washing off & have it washed dried & folded, you pay by weight & I can say it is very cheap compared to the sevice offered in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No self-service guest laundry”
Reviews.Author: osirisisis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because in its web site it says that it has "self-service guest laundry" but it's a lie. When I arrived there they told me that "self-service guest laundry" means that there is a bag in the room that guests can use to put their dirty clothes and handle them to the maid and paid for washing each piece of clothing according to the list price in the room. That was a problem, because there's no such thing as laundromats or launderettes in Hong Kong, so the only cheaper option was going to a "pound laundry" (where you put your dirty clothes on a scale and they charge you by weight".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: lhoverseas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with my 18 year old daughter in June 2010. We arrived early in the morning and were able to get into our room by 9.30am. The room we were given had plumbing repairs going on above it and was noisy and so we were immediately moved to a quiet room on another floor. The staff were very gracious and nothing seemed too much trouble. The buffet breakfast is fantastic. After 5 nights though the hassle of getting through the throng of people outside the entrance on Nathan Road offerring 'copy handbag, copy watch' and offers to make clothes for you does get tiring.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Shy33
Reviews.Content: i was booked by my travel agent at the holiday inn in hongkong i was scared as it was the first time i stayed in the hoilday inn hongong but every thing went on well they was a shuttel service to the MRT after every 15 mins so we did not take the taxis the location was among malls element was 15 mins from the hotel would suggest you to stay in holiday inn when ever in hongkong

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, centrally-located, good service”
Reviews.Author: tg_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, Golden Mile with our 6 year old and our parents. It is a very comfortable hotel for both business and families. Room: The room was spacious (enough per HK standards) and the bathroom was well stocked with all the amenities including a weighing scale! The beds were comfortable - you could get either 2 single beds or a double bed if you made the request in advance. I wouldn't say that you will get rooms with a view here but as long as you don't open the curtains, you are fine! The rooms also include umberalls just in case you get caught in the HK rain! Pool and Fitness: They have a small rooftop swimming pool and you can also workout in the Fitness Centre. Restaurants: We had buffet breakfast at their 24/7 cafe but did not try any other dining option here. The breakfast was very good with plenty of options and courteous staff made it comfortable. The Hari's bar seemed popular with both the locals and the hotel guests. Location: The hotel is just 2 minutes' walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and 5 minutes' from the iconic Star Ferry. This makes it an ideal location for both shopping and travelling to other parts of HK. The Space Museum and Museum of Art and Culture are 2-mins walking distance too. With plenty of restaurants - fast food - McD, Pizza Hut and fine dining, you will not be bored with the options!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the reservation / front desk officers of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SumeetKapoor
Reviews.Content: Guys, this hotel is only for shoppers and gets business only because of its excellent location. Don't be over-optimistic on seeing Lord Shiva's idol in the lobby - you're unlikely to get any preferential treatment (even if you're with infants). Our stay was marred by regular changing of rooms everyday as the hotel is under renovation and since I had young children, the noise was unbearable. Though it gives 5 star facilities but do double check the tariffs in other hotels as the reservation/front office executives tend to make a fool out of you in a minute. I ended up paying more than what an equally good 5 star would have charged for a full suite ; the hotel wanted to charge me a lot of 'extras' for every thing !! Extra for an infant, extra for a room above 6th floor, extra for using a microwave oven for 3 minutes for sterilizing baby bottles -( ridiculous). Guys, just refuse to pay extra! A front office executive by the name 'Joey' refused access to the swimming pool and told my daughter it'll be closed for summers (though it wasn't mentioned on the website when we made the reservation), whereas, we were shocked to find white skinned people enjoying the pool. Unfortunately, we gained wisdom only on the last day when we had checked out. Joey was untraceable. The Manager 'Nicole' finds special appreciation as she was extremely courteous and quickly grasped the situation and sensed our displeasure. She was quick to offer us free drop facility compliments of the hotel. She had earlier offered us complimentary breakfast as well. She made all efforts to retain our patronage. Now that I'm experienced, certainly would go back to this hotel armed with this wisdom. The shopping areas are within walking distance. The best part is that the MTR station 'Tsim Sha Sui' is right under the hotel. Ideal location. Rooms are comfortable and very well equipped. House keeping is excellent. Lots of vegetarian restaurants like, Branto, Aashirwad, Woodland are within walking distance. Overall, a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's very centeraly located”
Reviews.Author: escube_studio
Reviews.Content: It's an amazing hotel & also the rooms are very big !! Loved the location very central !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: surajitm
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be better than my expectation in all parameters. Proximity to Market, Good Indian restaurants next door, good breakfast and efficient service by fluently english speaking staff. The beautiful Tsim Sha Sui Harbour front is just a walking distance giving you a grand view of HongKog skyline. Lovely Experience!! Strongly recomended!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like convenience this is the hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: wombatwanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 9th Floor in the older part of the hotel. The room was large with 2 double beds and an adequate size bathroom. Refurbishment was happening above and it was noisy from 10am until 6pm but as we were not here for a room stay but to see Hong Kong this was not at all inconvenient. The room was very confortable with efficient air conditioning. The reception staff are very helpful, courteous and knowledgeable. The breakfast room had a huge selection. We chose the continental which gave us cereal, toast, fruit and juice and coffee. More than enough although a little pricey. You can walk most places but there is a MRT station 5 minutes walk away and the Ferry is about 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located and decent rooms with 2 double beds in rooms”
Reviews.Author: indianonthe_move
Reviews.Content: With 2 young kids, there weren't many hotels in kowloon area offering 2 double beds in a room, so we opted for this one and were pleasantly surprised with ample room space despite the beds. WE were on the 10th floor , the room decor was pleasing . The only bad thing was the view from the room, the shabby apartment block with filth thrown all around, but who had that much time to look out the window. The hotel is located right opposite the Tsim sha tsui MTR station which was very convenient . With 7/11 right opposite and 3-4 indian restaurants on the same lane and Branto's veg restarant (which is slightly overrated) on a parallel lane, our food problem was solved . The hotel also served indian dishes during the buffet breakfast which was another pleasant surprise. The staff was generally friendly. Most of the recommended tourist places this side of Hong kong , namely Star ferry, Avenue of stars, Museums for space, science, art , were at walking distance from the hotel. The mody road adjuscent to the hotel starts getting lined up with some unpleasant characters by evening which puts one off but they generally don't trouble you when you are with the family I guess.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: jsw702
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here many times before and it remains about the same. nothing very sepctacular but very expensive. the rooms do not have evry good views. mopstly the backs of sweat shops.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Blessing”
Reviews.Author: Temperate
Reviews.Content: We had planned to go to Bangkok and Hong Kong, but because of the unrest in Bangkok we added 3 days to our planned Hong Kong stay and booked rooms in this hotel with Holiday Inn points. The reviews for the Intercontinental are better, but we had only a few days to make our plans and rooms there were unavailable. Our connection from the airport was smooth and although we arrived mid-morning, we were able to get rooms right away to rest and clean up from the long trip. We would have preferred rooms with king beds but were told they wouldn't be available until later, so went ahead and got rooms with double/doubles. Our rooms were on the 15th floor, just below the club level and from reading other reviews, it looks like we were fortunate since the higher levels seem to be nicer floors. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and comfortable and the location on Nathan Road is in the middle of a busy shopping area and easy walking distance from a huge mall and the Star Ferry. Each morning of our stay we walked the block and a half towards the harbor to a very nice McDonalds for breakfast, and two members of our party ended up having very nice suits made by the tailor who has a shop right off the lobby, whose work was recommended by a friend who lives in Hong Kong. On the minus side - there is no avoiding that the views from this otherwise nice hotel are very sad because of the large, ugly building next door. It seems that they would do themselves a world of service if they frosted the windows on the side towards the ChungKing Mansions and managed to overcome their problems with must and mildew. I do have allergies and worried that I might have problems, because we could smell the mildew when we first arrived, but they didn't create any major problems. When we moved to the MarcoPolo however, where we planned to stay for the remainder of the trip, we weren't disappointed to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: TouristfromAust
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this hotel since 1999. Overall a good hotel although we will definitely not be staying there again. The hotel is located in what is best described as the Indian quarter of Kowloon. As soon as you step out of the hotel you notice numerous men positioned every 5-10 metres soliciting people to buy “Fake Rolex, fake watches, tailor” etc. This is very annoying especially after 5 days of saying – “No, thanks”. On several instances we were also offered “Hashish, marijuana” – we felt like turning around and saying “P.ss off mate!”, instead we just walked away. Also, along Mody Road (the hotel is on the corner of Nathan Rd and Mody Rd) after dark there are Indian prostitutes dressed in the traditional gowns soliciting sex from mainly Indian male tourists. While other posts have said that there is mould on every floor – this is not correct. Basically floors 3-6 have not been renovated and the floors have a strong odour of mould in the corridor as well as the rooms. We stayed on the sixth floor on the first night and couldn’t handle the scent. The next day we advised front reception. While Mario at reception initially responded like he didn’t know what we were talking (they probably are told to respond this way) they did allow us to move to a renovated floor with no questions asked. The renovated floors have new carpets, paint etc and are excellent overall. So if you get a room on floors 3-6, politely ask to be moved and the friendly staff should oblige. Another tip – ask for a room facing Mody Rd (even numbered rooms) and not the other side as these look directly into an old and filthy apartment block with rubbish thrown out of the windows and left in piles to rot. Overall, the Holiday Inn is a good hotel that is reasonably priced, with friendly staff and good facilities. It is one of the few hotels that allows four guests in a room which is handy as we were travelling with our two children both of whom are under 5. However, while the location is central, there are many other hotels nearby you can stay at that are very close to the MTR without being hounded each time you step out of the hotel. We walked extensively around Kowloon and Hong Kong during our trip and did not notice the fake watch brigade to the same degree that exists in this quarter. So next time we will pay a bit extra and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Love Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: LissyL0u
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here, love the location, the staff, and also a guy named Robert in a jewellery store underneath the Holiday Inn. Went there to spend with girlfriends and had a great time, unfortunately we were only there 3 nights, however we had a great time in that time. I liked the restaurant first time around rather than the new "improved" one. The new one is quite costly for what it was, the other more relaxed, but such is life. The rooms for Hong Kong standard are ok size wise. The location is the best part I think, right in the middle of Nathan Road, everything is just where you need it to be including a Seven Eleven store right outside the door for drinks and snacks if needed. Alot of tours drop by Holiday Inn Nathan Road as well which is handy. Everything good here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: Blueysmrs
Reviews.Content: We arrived on an early morning flight and arrived at the hotel at about 9am. We were lucky enough to be able to check in straight away. Offered a room upgrade which we took. Ended up on the 15th floor - said it was non-smoking and we couldn't smell any smoke at all. Great! Room had two Aussie double size beds (us in one and the two kids in another) and was extremely clean. Our rooms were very quiet. Had little extras like scales and an umbrella. Toiletries supplied were the usual soaps, shampoo, gel, shower cap etc. but also toothbrushes/paste & comb (if you used them they were replaced each day). Good hot shower. English speaking TV channels. Mini bar & in-room safe also. Charge for internet was HKD120 for 24 hours - worked well. Breakfast buffet was brilliant - if we had the buffet we didn't need to eat until tea time (and kids just had a light lunch). We were given a 20% off voucher to use at all the food places in the hotel. There are bucketloads of people who offer things (tailors, surveys etc.) when you walk out of the hotel but we just said no and it didn't bother us. Hotel is in a great spot - close to the harbour and shops and MTR. Here's a tip for sore feet - if you cross the road outside and go into the iSquare Mall there is an escalator to the TST MTR Station (I think it was Exit C) - the other exits we used were steps and just about did us in at the end of long days of walking. We found all the staff we dealt with to be friendly and helpful. We would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone travelling to Hong Kong (especially with kids).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and enjoyed the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AussieBella
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of our cruise package and we extended our stay to 3 nights. We arrived early morning and were told our standard rooms would not be available for 90 minutes but we could upgrade to the deluxe room for a small fee, which we did. Very happy with the condition and size of the room, the usual problem with a lousy hairdryer continued with this hotel however. Buffet breakfast was included which was very adequate. We didn't use the hotel restaurants or the bar. Location is excellent, close to everything we needed. As previously mentioned by others, the touts outside the hotel and in the streets are certainly a nuisance to say the least. We were pestered at all times of the day and night in the main shopping areas. Would be wonderful if these people were stopped from doing this, all those we spoke with at the hotel were complaining. Staff were very friendly and all requests were promptly attended to. Would stay there again certainly.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: adityaKolkata
Reviews.Content: highly priced,old needs uplift,very old hotel,not renovated,adjacent to chunkking mansion,very bad view

Reviews.Title: “average hotel with good location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ChazEd
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th stay here over 7 years and while it is not as good as nearby waterfront hotels such as the Shangri-la and Intercontinentals it is very convenient for the MTR being right underneath! Noise was not a problem and didn't notice any of the problems with damp or mildew others have complained about. Several of our party did change rooms due to size (the deluxe twins are well appointed and fairly spacious for Hong Kong) and the management obliged. If you are not happy with the room ask to be moved! Pool and gym are adequate and some rooms have better views than others. Only down side was the price - it was very expensive (over HK$2000 per night for some of the time we stayed to which is added 10% service and internet at $180/day - total rip off as many hotels such as Shangri-la now supply this for free!) We managed to avoid the overpriced breakfasts by using a tremendous little basement noodle house about 50 metres from the entrance which did bacon/egg/roll and coffee for about £2! Overall a pleasant enough and well located hotel if you can book a good rate and avoid the extras, otherwise go for the waterfront or even the Langham in Mongkok which is also above the MTR line.

Reviews.Title: “This was not a pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: shem108
Reviews.Content: We had to change rooms several times due to the mold and mildew smell. Carpets showed signs of water spills as well as mold. Unfortunately, we had no option recourse as our rooms were prepaid via a well-known on-line travel company. The hotel finally added an air purifier to help with the odor. Several in our group, including my wife and myself, got sick due to this problem. One of the managers told me that this is a 40 year old hotel in need of remodeling...and she is correct with that statement. Also note that this hotel is in the middle of a construction zone as well. We left to stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Experience Involving Mold, Mildew, and Public Masturbation”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDotson
Reviews.Content: This was, hands down, one of the WORST hotels I've stayed in, and I have stayed in some cheap, $29 per night motels... so this is saying something. I was traveling with 10 other people from my company, and we were all staying at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile for one week. The lobby was clean and heavily perfumed, and was unfortunately the nicest part of the hotel. We were all assigned different floors, and upon exiting the elevator we were all horrified at the condition of the hotel. The carpets from the elevator and all the way down each hall were stained with large black mildew and mold stains. A heavy musty smell hung in the air, to the point I found myself wanting to hold my breath. I got to my room, and it wasn't any better. The carpets were, I think, red at one point in my room. Now they were a dirty brown. I didn't want to take my shoes off or walk barefooted across the carpet. The vent in my room had black stuff (mold, dirt, or dust... disgusting regardless) coming out of it. This was the same story with everyone in my party. We complained to management, who offered to shift some rooms around. We looked at other rooms, but they too were all the same. There was just no escaping the mold and mildew. Unfortunately our rooms were pre-paid, and the hotel was not willing to refund our money, so we had to end up staying. The first night, I woke up with major sinus pressure and congestion. Other members of my party started to have similar issues the next day. Fortunately we weren't spending the day in the hotel, and my issues cleared up shortly after exiting the building. We had to get air purifiers and medication in order to stay there the whole week. If that weren't bad enough, the second night there I opened my curtains to the horrible view of a Hostel and sweat shop. While fuming at the conditions, I stared at the trash strewn dump next to me (for a picture, go here: http://www.flickr.com/photos/chrisdotson/4406880951/). Thinking to myself, "It can't get any worse," I was immediately proven wrong. Right there, in full view of ANYONE looking out of the hotel, was a grown man masturbating right in front of his window. His curtains were wide open and anyone looking out that side of the Holiday Inn could see. Suffice it to say I would NEVER recommend anyone stay here. Management tried to blame the mildew on the close proximity to the sea, but one of our party stayed at The W, closer to the water, and there was absolutely no problems like this at that hotel. Avoid this hotel at all costs. If this is the only hotel available and you're going to Hong Kong, I would suggest canceling your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..greater service”
Reviews.Author: ImaMohamed
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Hong Kong yesterday..and one of our best experience is our stay in HIGM..I don't have to say much about the location as all the reviews have said it all. But I can say their services was A+. Starting with the Guest Relation Officer..Ms Ada (Ada is you are reading it..thank you again from all of us)...She is great ..very informative about where to go ..how to go...and her advice to us is look for her in the morning before we go anywhere..and she will guide us. and that was what we did. And unfortunate incidence happen ..my second son had his asthma attack on his second day. So..again Ms Ada introduced us to another of HIGM's personnel Ms Vicky who not only introduced us to a good doctor which is a 5 min walk away..and repeatedly offer to get a staff to accompany us there. Since we already know our way..we declined..and nope the hospitality didn't stop there..she offered to call..and explain to the clinic what is our case and for the clinic to expect us..wow...we are so grateful. If you are a Muslim..besides the great location due to the MRT, Nathan Rd is also great as it is near several Halal Restaurants. To name a few Ziafat at Nathan Rd, Ebeneezer Kebab and Gaylord at Ashley Rd (which is 5 mins away) and a few others. If you are on a budget and have several requirements (like me.. I have to have rooms with connecting door)..I suggest that you contact the hotel via email before making the booking. There's a few choices of not only rooms but also rates. If you are very sure that you are going on these dates..get the advanced room rates..much cheaper but no changes are allowed at all. If you are with kids or good friends.. you may want to request for rooms with connecting doors and for each of the rooms to have 2 double beds instead of one king size room. To HIGM.. yes I would recommend this to all my friends..anytime

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: traveladviceIndia
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel. Very close to the main shopping area of Hong Kong and a few yards from the TSIM SHA SUI metro station. Very nice and clean

Reviews.Title: “Good location & food but unfriendly hotel personnels.”
Reviews.Author: mbshrma
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location & the buffet breakfast was very good. However, the rooms were quite small for the money we were paying & the house-keeping never cleaned the room & the bathroom properly. The receptionists & bell-boys were unfriendly, unsmiling & acted as if giving the room was a favor to us. The only saving grace for the hotel was that their buffet breakfast was very good and the staffs in the dining areas were friendly. We were traveling with a 2 yrs old son and it was very difficult for us to negotiate the stroller around in the hotels extremely small corridors & doors.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomend Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: Zodiac124
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Mile for 10 days - with two children (12 & 13) and found the hotel to be in a perfect position for all our day travels. Breakfast was outstanding - service excellent. Room was ok, a bit small for the four of us. Pool lovely at the end of a busy day to relax in - have a local beer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families”
Reviews.Author: Ravfamily
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location of this hotel. It's exactly where you should be on a trip to Hong Kong ...Kowloon, near the harbour. Yes it may be tired in places but it ticks all the boxes for location and great value for money. We had no problem getting the 2 interconnecting rooms that we'd reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday destination”
Reviews.Author: PJS1958
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is perfectly positioned in Nathan Road, Kowloon and provides a great base to enjoy the pleasures of Hong Kong. Easy access to the MTR and the Victoria Harbour and ferry system.

Reviews.Title: “Love Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: zyclonenuz
Reviews.Content: Well I stayed on this hotel twice already. Both of my stay were at the third floor (Smoking Rooms) Some say that they had trouble sleeping especially on the third floor because of the noise on the other side of the street cause by Nigerian Nationals that hangs around 7-11 convenient store. We never had any problem with the noise from the other side of the streets in fact it was really quiet we stayed at room 339 or 338 and the room is located at the end of the hall and it was also located directly across to the said convenient store. But me and my sister never had any problem. In fact we never heard any noise in our entire stay (December 19-24, 2009). Yeah some Nigerians do hang around the place but they are not noisy. As for the room well it was really clean and tidy. The only problem we had was with the safe. It broke down or something on the last day of our stay. What I like about the hotel is the room is VERY ROOMY and it is near the MTR station, Money Changers, Malls, Avenue of Stars and etc.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: Raspy888
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is located in the buzzing area of tsim sha tsui where the MTR is only a step outside the hotel. Great Hotel with a great location and good clean rooms. Again a popular choice amongst the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: martin0257
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from New Zealand for 3 nights. They were very busy as our stay included new years eve. We upgraded to a deluxe room at a very reasonable cost and had an excellent spacious room. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We unfortunately lost a piece of hand baggage between the airport and the hotel. They contacted the airport and Airport Express for us but unfortunately it was not found. They gave us a report form and sent it to the police for us and we found it stamped and dropped in our room. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: holidayPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 5 days stopover on our way back to Perth - we were very impressed by the size of the rooms and the cleanliness - the breakfast was fantastic - everything you could possibly imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at centre of HKG”
Reviews.Author: RKK13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the property for 3 days. The Hotel is right at the central shopping place. MTR station is 2 min walking from the Hotel. The Hotel ambience & hospitality is too good. You get very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: kellysmith1944
Reviews.Content: The rooms were excellent and the service was very good.The hotel was very clean and close to all amenities

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: IntlSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during a business trip. Booked a Deluxe King room and was placed in a corner Deluxe room on the 15th floor (supposed Platinum upgrade). Check-in was efficient and did not require any waiting. I was quickly given my room key and a brief summary of the hotel features. The hotel lobby area is constantly busy with people waiting or hanging out. Room - It was quite a walk down the hall to get to the room and the first thing I found out was that my key card was not working. Great. Walk back down and get it fixed. The room is good sized, especially for a hotel in central Tsim Sha Tsui. You can tell the bed is new and some of the furnishings are new. However, the overall impression of the room is that it is still a bit outdated. It's probably time to renovate the entire property and not just buy some new furniture. The bathroom is small and feels restricted. This is odd considering the overall size of the room. On the positive side, there are plenty of amenities such as razor, toothbrush, lotion, etc. My room had a connecting door, which was poorly designed because I could hear everything going on next door, such as the loud television and phone conversations. Food - I had their daily breakfast and lunch buffets at the Bistro on the Mile restaurant. It was very impressive, since it had a wide range of food choices, such as Western, Chinese, and other Asian specialties. There is truly something for everyone. Even more impressive was their dessert selection. I lost count of how many choices there were. Service was outstanding and it was definitely worth the money spent. I visited their bar a few times and it was ok. The prices are steep and the service was a bit slow. The bar/lounge does seem to attract the "working" crowd, especially later at night. Awkward to say the least. Location - The hotel is located right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon, on Nathan Road. This is a great spot to get around the area. Most places are only within 5-10 minutes walking distance. The Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station entrance is right across the street and from there you can get to anywhere in Hong Kong. Overall, the hotel is a good value. The price is generally less than other comparable properties in the area. However, you get what you pay for. The rooms are a bit outdated, although still clean and comfortable. Service is good and location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Want A Sleepless night?”
Reviews.Author: Lammy2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times on trips out of China to update visa etc. Whilst the staff service is excelent, just pray you do not get a room facing what I beleive is Mody Road! (838 being one) There is a hostel (Garden Hostel) opposite where Nigerian drug runners and thier "women" hang out. The trouble being, they hang outside ALL night, screaminng, shouting and getting into fights. I gave up trying to sleep at 04.00 and stood watching thier antics for some time and just cannot understand why the Hong Kong police do not clear out, what I can only describe as scum.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenyasay
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Holiday Inn Golden Mile. Very good structure. Courteous staff. Location accessible to a must-visit places.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: abcadvisor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over 10 times during business trips to Hong Kong. I have tried other hotels in the Tsim Sha Tsui area (Shangri La, Intercontinental, Nikko ...) but when it comes to getting the best price for an OK hotel this is generally where I end up. If you want a nice view or a large room this is not the place for you but if you just want to get a decent night's sleep with all the basics done well this is a good place. It's a popular destination for tourists from all over the world and the lobby can be like a noisy gathering at the United Nations but so far I have found the rooms to be quiet. The breakfast here is a bit pricey but a great buffet selection. Generally I fill up enough at breakfast to be able to skip lunch. The Italian restaurant on the 2nd floor is also good and I can recommend it if you want quiet night in with good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GlobeAdobe
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is very good in terms of its Location, which is on Nathan Street. it is very near to MTR station. It has a little costly but good in house restaurant, where you can get few indian meals too. but there are also a lot of cheap options nearby. as it is situated in CBD the environment around it always bustling with activities. but just beware! the street turns into a red light area in the night. so always try to comeback by 9 o'clock at the latest. i went with my wife & 3yr old daughter. we had a pleasant stay. But I must say that the staff is not very friendly, especially the reception people. we arrived earlier than the check in time. and they kept us waiting for three hours. you can imagine the trouble in staying in waiting lounge with a three year old. and staff repeatedly came to tell us to control our baby. We saw them providing rooms to many European guests. The love to white skin can be clearly felt there, even when this hotel is owned by an Indian. they offer a lot of travel packages of the attractions and you can at least get a bargain of upto 15% if you try little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good hotel but poor staff.”
Reviews.Author: traveller365
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights end of September. We were a group of 12 ppl in 6 rooms. Check in time was 2 pm but the room was give to us only at 5 pm, the reception staff at this hotel are extremely uncooperative and had bad experiences with them on arrival and departure. Room was pretty big ( by Hong Kong standards) and clean with a fairly big bathroom. All usual amenities present. Breakfast was good with a large selection of things. Location is the best part of the hotel though, right on the golden mile and walking distance to loads of shopping and Victoria harbour. Lots a places to eat nearby so convenient.Would have been good if the staff had been better. If the hotel management is reading this, change your reception staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: maxiebon
Reviews.Content: we were pleasantly suprised with the holiday inn. our room was fantastic (huge in fact), modern and so clean, although dont expect a view if your planning on staying anywhere on nathan rd. The outside certianly didnt look like the old daggy pics that some people have posted on here and the lobby is all gliz with crystal candeliers. Staff are so attentive and we received champagne and strawberries on arrival (i think as a treat because our bags didnt arrive). The only thing they didnt tell us is that the front enterance on Nathan rd closes at 12am and the rif raf comes out to play so it can be a little scary if your on your own. Afterhours you need to enter via the side main enterance of the hotel. We didnt eat at the hotel as it is pricey, heaps of other cheap places to eat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KEVLOVESJULES
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights at this hotel part of a package , after 4 nights we were told to move to another room.Found this not very convient as we had 3 adults and 1 child and a lot of shopping.They tried to move us to a smoking room and when that failed moved us to a delux. Same type of room with very little differences only newer fittings. The pool staff were excellent, foyer staff not good, reception could learn to smile but the tour desk were great. It was a shame that everytime you walked out the back door of this place you were mobbed, a bit annoying after a while. The 7 11 across the road had a very large drinking crowd everynight which was also the entrance to the rail. The bars at night were overflowing with ladies not a good sign for a family hotel. I would say that they would be better places to stay although this place was convient.

Reviews.Title: “Great food”
Reviews.Author: 4lil4
Reviews.Content: I just had to write a review about the Italian restaurant at the hotel. I ate the best gnocchi I have ever tasted. It just melted in my mouth. You have got to try it.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the Nathan Road madness!”
Reviews.Author: CactusRose
Reviews.Content: Following a good experience here several years ago, we decided to return with our two teenagers. When booking we asked for interconnecting rooms and were told this would be offered if available. On arrival we were told that none were available and we should have asked when we booked! We said we were happy to wait until something became available, and went off on a brief outing, to return and find we had got interconnecting rooms. The counter staff are not in the slightest friendly or welcoming. Also, while waiting in the foyer after arriving on an all night flight, one of my daughters was approached by a roving staff member and told that sleeping in the foyer was not allowed! She had been sitting on a couch with her head resting on her father's shoulder! Also, the only foyer toilets available required access using a hotel swipe card - whch we didn't have as we hadn't checked in. These were really the only blots on the landscape in an otherwise excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, close to Shopping - You need to stay on the higher floors though"”
Reviews.Author: kiwiflyer10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, we had a family room with two comfortable double beds. Our first night was on the 6th floor and there was a lot of street noise but when we mentioned it to the staff they moved us to the 12th floor which was really quiet. Our rooms were serviced everyday and the staff were incredibly friendly. The restaurants at the hotel were really nice. We would recommend when booking paying for the Full Buffett Breakfast at the Bistro on the Mile restaurant within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but.......”
Reviews.Author: orlichf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for 10 days with the family. Nice hotel but.... the beds are SMALL. Since there was 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children) we booked a room with 2 beds. Turns out they gave us 2 double beds. Now I am not exactly short (6'3" /1.9M) and with my wife in bed with me it made for a very uncomfortable stay. Tried to complain but it was no use. The other bad thing was the hawkers outside the hotel. For 10 days straight they hassled us - "Want copy watches... do you want a tailored suit?" every time we stepped outside the hotel doors. So annoying. Even tried to sell my 10 year old a suit. But the best thing about the hotel is its proximity to the MTR. Its so close and convenient. Made getting around Hong Kong so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Refurbished Room - Terribly Expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: MickeyM43
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times and have found the refurbished rooms and service to be very nice. However, both of us carried our notebook computers this time and were charged twice for daily internet access at 180$HK EACH, $360HK per day, even though we connected one at a time via the cable in the room. Ridiculous! Will look for one of the many hotels with free internet next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Location ! Bar None at this price range ;-)”
Reviews.Author: TCritic
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable ! It's close to shops, restaurants and all the amenities and attractions of the Kowloon end of HK. The Hong kong island is just one ferry ride away and the star ferry terminal is a close walk. The shopping streets are unbeatable and all close by and the restaurant options are all close by with many variety...so skip the hotel restaurant options including breakfast Stay here...there is no where else you want to consider !

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat old, but still great!”
Reviews.Author: yogimo
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Goldenmile now for at least 15 years, always great. Yes, bathrooms are somewhat old the design not the latest, but good enough. Skype works well, iChat also, as for the internet speed, it is quite slow and at EUR 18 / day, way too expensive. The Deli Corner at B1 is extremely good, the food tasty and the service really nice. I also like that it is close to the MTR. Unfortunately the Airport Express Shuttle often cannot pull into the hotel area, due to limited space. Hence when you wait for the pick up, you may have to stand outside in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCaper
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is a clean, modern hotel in a fantastic location. We arrived a little early (from Hong Kong Disneyland Resort so we had high expectations) and the staff were very helpful. We had to wait about an hour until the room was ready but as a bonus we got upgraded to a higher floor. The only minor issue was that our room was next to the lift shaft so the noise of the lifts going up and down at night was a bit annoying at night. The room was big enough for three adults and had a great view out onto Mody Rd. I recommend pre-paying and having the buffet breakfast every morning. They have a huge selection and we all ate something different every day. Included in our four-day stay was a dinner at Delicatessen Corner. The German theme was a bit random but the three-course meal was very tasty. The MTR entrance is right across the road which was great. There are hawkers right outside but they leave you alone and if not, are easy to ignore. And be sure to visit Ming's Gifts on level B1 - always a bargain!! Can't wait to return to Hong Kong and will certainly stay at Holiday Inn Golden Mile again.

Reviews.Title: “still a cracker”
Reviews.Author: crestaone
Reviews.Content: Ive had two visits as tourist, this time it was work and it was my suggestion to the company to use the hotel, so a risk - not really as aways charming and helpfull staff, clean rooms, good security what more could u ask for. My only grip is the smoky bar (as a non smoker) but thats hong kong, oh I did sneak a look at disneyland, its ok if your in the area, but not up to LA or Orlando david

Reviews.Title: “No better alternative in Tsim Tsa Tsui (apart from the Peninsula)”
Reviews.Author: Miran_Ali
Reviews.Content: If, and this is a big if, you must stay in Tsim Tsa Tsui, as I prefer to do so, then this is the hotel for you. I have stayed there dozens of times over the past ten years and have no plans to change hotels. My visits have been both business and leisure trips with the family. The refurbished rooms are nice although they don't seem to have changed the carpets in the corridors for twenty years. Their german deli in the basement is only good for a quick bite. The cantonese restaurant is very elegant but there are far better options in HK for dining. The breakfast buffet is satisfactory but service is slow. The older concierge staff are excellent but the advice you get varies with who you happen to ask. Location is unbeatable. The MTR, Star Ferry, Ocean Terminal and a whole slew of seedy electronics shops are all within walking distance. The pool on the roof is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Town”
Reviews.Author: gandayeen
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with a great location. situated along nathan road, the busiest road in hongkong. all the luxury and branded shops are right next door to the hotel. the buffet breakfast is a must try. the staff are very helpful. thank you for hosting our familiarization tour

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RodriguezLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is an oustanding property. The room was immaculate and larger than other Hong Kong hotel properties. My room type and non-smoking request were both met. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of Asian and western specialties. The second floor lounge was staffed by professionals and provided a nice end to a day of business meetings. The top floor fitness center was more than adequate for someone who needs to work out while on the road. The location was also excellent with nearby access to the Metro or a short walk to the Star Ferry. The only drawback was that Nathan Road, a tourist shopping district, was over-run with "touts," guys that try to hussle you into a nearby store for suits or watches.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VPDesu
Reviews.Content: This is a very centrally located hotel but obviously has seen better days. The corridors are a bit dingy, carpets fading, needs an overall refurbishing. The rooms are comfortable, though a bit small, but, I guess space comes at a premium in HK. The room service is decent, but nothing to rave about. It is got good connectivity with the MTR(the local train service), though, from the airport is a good 45 min drive.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: puru24
Reviews.Content: one thing i like in hong kong is everyone just walk walk and walk. its having good hotels like holidayinn. cool place for youngsters and hang out with friends. Tsim Sha Tsui east of Kowloon is Hong Kong's equivalent to Hollywood's Walk of Fame.. There are food stalls and benches so you can take time enjoying the sights in Victoria Harbour, overlooking Hong Kong Island. Tsim Sha Tsui is accessible via MTR from any point in Kowloon or Hong Kong island. the MTR or KCR trains to Tsim Sha Tsui is the best mode of transport if u dont know local language, as against taking a cab. non-English speaking drivers out there. this hotel is what i stayed for a day. its facilitates all things u desire and everything not available is there down the street. but its expensive to sty here, everything is here atleast.

Reviews.Title: “The Location is fantastic, but the view is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: mwiddows
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 days with our 2 year old. The room was spacious and easily fit a (very small) cot, as well as having two double beds, desk & chair. The furnishings were tired though. We didn't really bother to open the curtains as our view was of the Chungking Mansions.... lots of washing hanging out of windows and rubbish which looked as though it has been thrown from them & I've never seen so many old box airconditioners. The location of this hotel is fantastic. There is an MTR station right out the front door, it is an easy walk to the Star Ferry Terminal, you can walk to Kowloon Park (which contains a great playground), Temple Street Night Markets and the Ocean Centre Shopping Centre. The service was excellent, reception and concierge staff were all very polite; and because we stayed for 8 nights we had two free meals in the Deli Corner restaurant where they treated our 2 year old like a princess. However, I should mention there are heaps of other cheap good restaurants nearby. The pool deck is nice and very clean, although the pool was a bit chilly! Overall a really good visit to a very busy city!

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in Hong Kong for the last 8 years”
Reviews.Author: LANTERN2009
Reviews.Content: I will continue to stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile. I stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile in February 2009 after a 5-year absence due to a work relocation. Between 2001 - 2004, this was the only hotel in Hong Kong that I stayed because of the excellent location and service. In February 2009, that excellent location and service was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: walzholz
Reviews.Content: In the last four years I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile 5 times. The rooms are clean and in good condition. The service is good. Hari’s bar has a good band, but the drinks are expensive and the food okay at best. Being on Nathan road the hotel is in a good location for sight seeing. I would rate a solid 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for a few days for sightseeing & shopping”
Reviews.Author: lscot
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Can walk to harbour and shops all around. MTR station is very close by and ideal for getting around. Hotel was clean, well furnished and spotless. We upgraded when a good offer was made. Buffet breakfast is just delicious and so extensive. Different restuarants to choose from. Staff couldn't be more helpful and polite. Busy hotel in busy area. Happy hour from 6 to 9 pm! Live music nightly in another bar. Ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel in a key location”
Reviews.Author: Tsiresy
Reviews.Content: If you are to stay in Hong Kong and especially in Kowloon, or near Tsim Sha Tsui, remember this hotel. Okay, it is a bit old, and the size of the rooms are definitely small. In addition, when you look out of the window, you see nothing but flats and their inhabitants. But it's holiday inn standard, nothing more. And you are spotted exactly on nathan road, you walk less than 20 meters to dive in TST metro station, ocean road is 5 minutes walk, hong kong island is one station away, you are in a commercial center.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Vins_13
Reviews.Content: Went to Hongkong with my wife, son, sister and Mom. Being Indian vegeterians, wanted to select a Hotel where Good Indian Food would be easily available. So, picked out this hotel on the recommendation of my Travel agent, though I booked directly to get a better rate. It was a BIG Mistake. I felt cheated for the amount it costed me. I could have got much better accomodation at 1/4th price. And the location, phew, could not hope to get out after evening with my family, as it semingly became a Red Light area. Never ever going t go to that place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Exellent Location”
Reviews.Author: arunjain22
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn located right at centre of Hong Kong shopping at nathan road where all the stores near by and MTR metro station is also very close. Had Buffet Breakfast on 18 floor which was just ok. Lobby of hotel is great. although have to stand approx 10 mins to get attended by check in recieption as there was lot of check ins at that time. Hotel also provide shuttle bus to airport which was quite helpful. Swimming pool at terrace is just great. so net net if u want to stay in this area this hotel is best but u can get cheaper option if u r budget.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: Tenmilk
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Golden Mile is really in the center of Kowloon action. MTR Tsimshartsui Access G is just 2 minute walk. BUT WARNING! Access G to the train platform itself is another 10 minute walk underground! Internet is free for those executive rooms only. 180HKD++ for 24 hours internet. Not cheap for me. Go to Habour City/ Gateway Mall. Free inside. Yes. The whole mall is Free Wifi! Holiday Inn has a "promotional" free breakfast and internet. But why will you pay hotel rate breakfast when you can get authentic and CHEAPER food outside? RIght? Makes sense to me. If you're in Hong Kong EAT Hong Kong! I paid EXTRA for a deluxe room since it's the "renovated" room. But it doesn't look like updated. Maybe new paint here and there, that's it. Its has that old hotel room smell. Good think my asthma didn't attack. I think it's about time they do some MAJOR renovation. Small bathroom. Shower and Tub only. Quick check-in. Good staff. HK Plugs are the same as those in Singapore so if you can bring some adaptors. But they provide anyway. Watch out for those people outside offering private rooms. They can be a nuisance. Small swimming pool in roof top. Nice gym facilites/ machines. 5HKD per local call made.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Dated....”
Reviews.Author: Mox_Fulder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Kowloon and close to all the shops and MTR. Its a very handy location for the tourist. The entry and lobby looked welcoming after a long flight in but its the little things one notice when settled in. The standard room I got looked tired and old. The furniture could do with an upgrade and gave the overall impression it was dark. The bathroom was small for a room of this size. However, the bed was comfortable and everything worked. Had a look outside the window and I realised why the curtains were permanently drawn. It was not a pretty sight. But the complimentary bottles of water were always a bonus. The bathroom while tidy and clean, felt cramp. And they still have this old contraption that is a dryer hanging on the wall. Its been a real while since I had seen anything like it. Since, I was only in for a night, there was nothing to get too critical about. The hotel could do with an upgrade. There is nothing too much to expect from the hotel. Its good location is a big plus but if I had a choice, I probably would not return to this hotel. There are better and more economical hotels around that offer better value.

Reviews.Title: “Can do much better”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Stayed after several years with my family in Holiday Inn Golden Mile. Location is excellent if you want to be in heart of Kowloon but dont expect much from rooms. Still outdated and for the price felt not worth it. The rooms are stuck in the 70s....kettles on the curtains. They told me the rooms were recently refurbished. I doubt that. There has to be better hotels for the price ($280per night) in Central Kowloon

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hotel with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: OutdoorFreak
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the most disgustingly dirty places I've stayed. I stayed in a large room with 2 colleagues and all of us starting sneezing as soon as we entered the room. It didn't take long to work out why. The room was COVERED in dust and looked as if it had not been cleaned properly for months. The bath had soap scum marks all around and dark black marks on bottom. We were staying for 7 nights on business and every morning someone would knock on our door and try and enter to "clean" the room before 9am. Considering nothing really happens in HK before 11am, this was ridiculous and very frustrating. In addition to this, one of our party got sick for one day and we put out a do not disturb sign when we left them there in the morning. This meant nothing. The phone apparently rang continuously with housekeeping staff asking if they could come and clean the room. Random people also kept knocking on the door and ringing the bell to try and come in. Not sure what these housekeepers actually did as they don't change the sheets every day unless they are told to (in contrast to every other hotel that asks you to put the card on the bed if you DONT want linen changed, this one won't change the sheets unless you put the card on the bed), they definitely don't vaccum or dust and certainly don't clean the bath during your stay. Downstairs, the lobby bar is literally filled with smoke from the moment it opens to the time it closes, so don't even bother unless you're a smoker. The reception staff were excedingly rude - and no, it isn't because of cultural differences; I travel very frequently in Asia and have come to know what is the norm...the frontline staff here are for some reason just rude and very unhelpful (example: on checkout, our billing was interrupted for over 15 mins while the person serving us decided to serve a different customer who wanted access to his safe deposit box...there were other counter staff available to help, but they preferred to stand around chatting while one staff member did all the work). Also be warned that directly outside this hotel is a notorious drug dealing and prostitute pickup point on Mody Road. You'll also be harrassed by the "copy watches, copy handbags, suit, ladies suit" crew every single time you step outside the hotel door on Nathan Road. This hotel also charges an absolute fortune to use the internet. It was so pricey we were forced to buy a card from 711 and head to Starbucks across the road to do what we needed to do. Given how much they charge for the room it is absolutely outrageous to expect guests to fork out another small fortune to access the internet. It's a real disadvantage when you're on business as you need to work in the evenings and early mornings in more than 5 min email blocks like leisure travellars. The only thing good about this hotel is the fitness centre which has a better shower than what you have in your room. Hardly anyone ever uses the steam/sauna/bathroom area so if you want a bit more space to move, head to Floor 19 to shower etc...even if you don't use the gym room (which is very good with a good selection of cardio and weight options). Location is good but there are plenty of other FAR better hotels in the area. Don't stay at this place unless your boss forces you to...

Reviews.Title: “so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spongebob10
Reviews.Content: There was nothing about this hotel that makes it stand out from all the rest. For what we paid I was expecting a little more. The rooms were just an average hotel room just like any other hotel room in Asia. The bathroom was tiny. The only good point is the location, it was fairly central to most things. We were located at the back side of the hotel, which meant that it was very quiet, but the views out the window were nothing spectacular. Probably wouldnt stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HunterBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for the school half term holidays. Upon arrival we upgraded into the Executive rooms which were well worth the money, The lounge was very good with drinks and nibbles in the early evening. The hotel room was large enough - 2 double beds which was fine for us and our 2 children. Very central to all local amenities and the hotel staff were very helpful. We noticed prior to our trip that lots of people complained about the view - but hey the old flats are what it was like around 10 years ago on all of the streets, so much has now disappeared so it was good to see a little bit of the history left. The kids loved Disney which is definately worth a visit and then each day was finished with a dip in the hotel pool (with resident life guard) and a drink at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, super location!”
Reviews.Author: groovywilma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days as part of a tour group. Great location for shopping all around and easy access to the MTR. The hotel staff were nice and friendly overall. It is quite expensive to use the internet in the lobby downstairs! The breakfast buffet was included in our stay and was delicious! Especially the waffles! The service there was also outstanding. The rooms were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated partially”
Reviews.Author: Crlsgrc
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms have been renovated and are fine however those that have not been updated just look dirty and old. Location is good if you like the most touristic part of HKG but if you want to stay away of the fake watches and tailors you have to go north.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mueslee
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay at this hotel. It is very clean and the rooms are quite big too. The location is excellent, in the heart of Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location and , of course, nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeypeung
Reviews.Content: After checking the feedback from tripadvisor, I decided to book the rooms at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile as a place to stay during our Christmas trip in HK. The Hotel location is nice, easy to find coz it is located on the main shopping streets and quite near MRT (Tsim Sha Tsui Station). I book for the standard room with 1 queen size bed.The room is well-furnished and clean and the bathroom is nice as well. Hotel Service is good.All staff was very nice and gave me a good help during my stay. So, I would like to recommend anyone who wants to find a place to relax, and take a rest in HK.The Holiday Inn Golen Mile is the good choice!I will choose it again as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet for Mid-Range Hotel in Tsim Tsa Tsui”
Reviews.Author: acurrie
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Golden Mile previously in 2003. The hotel has changed quite a bit... For the better! The biggest difference is that the restaurant has had a complete makeover. The buffet breakfast is as good (actually better) than it used to be, but the decor is much brighter now. The staff there is very friendly, and there's lots of western and local food to start your day off right. Another big change from five years ago is the availability of in-room high speed Internet. At $160 HKD per day it's not cheap, but is at least on par with what other chains around the world charge for similar services. If you'd prefer your internet for free The Kowloon Hotel across the street includes it in their daily rate (at least they used to), but be prepared for a much smaller room -- I stayed there back in 2003 as well... I had assumed that all rooms at The Golden Mile faced either the Mirador Mansions to the north, or the Chungking Mansions to the south; I was pleasantly surprised that mine, at the back end of the hotel, actually had a bit of a view (see accompanying photo). The room itself was very spacious, but a locked door to the adjoining suite meant that I could often hear my neighbours. I stayed over New Year's Eve and got a souvenir velvet bag filled with cookies -- a nice touch. The hotel is easily accessible via a complimentary shuttle van from Kowloon Station, and it's back entrance spills out onto the famous Nathan Road. If you can stand the touts trying to sell you a suit or fake Rolex (or avoid them) I highly recommend the Golden Mile as a mid-tier hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_On_The_Move
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in Hong Kong we were meet with our shuttle to take us to the Holiday Inn Golden Mile, it was 7.30am when we arrived in the Hotel it was humid but lovely I recommend Shorts and a T-Shirt when travelling to Hong Kong. First impression of the Hotel was positive it looked nice and was tucked away in the busy streets of Tsim Sha Shui surrounded by high building, clothes hanging out windows and huge fluro signs, the concierge was also lovely, a bad room up sell was disappointing but we soon forgot this as the rest of the service was delightful the whole time, a little difficulty with language but the staff always smiled and looked as though they were enjoying themselves. Great location right across the road from the MTR Station and 7-11 the MTR is easy to travel around the whole of Hong Kong, we enjoyed exploring the area and found a great noodle restaurant and even a bar that had a happy hour AWESOME. We stayed for 4 days wish we stayed longer. Lots to do and see in Hong Kong this hotel is well known and there are plenty of cheap taxis around to take you exploring, Temple Street Night Market is a must in the area there really is just too much to name.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn never fails....”
Reviews.Author: Elenalsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn Golden Mile in mid December 2008 for 2 nights on our way back from Taipei. It's my 2nd time at the hotel. Was satisfied after my 1st stay 3 years ago but this time it was even better. The rooms were refurbished and everything is so new, nice & clean. Location is superb, next to TST MTR station. Shops are all around the hotel. Tried their buffet breakfast this time as our room package included it. Good & delicious spread. However, if you like to look out of your room, this is not a hotel for you. The view from our room was a real drag but since we were in Hong Kong for shopping, we just kept our curtain down and we didn't spend much time in the room. Definitely a place to stay if you are in Hong Kong for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: cheeran666
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of the Hotel the most. In Tsim Shah Tsui area very clse to the Metro Rail.. This Hotel is a gift to new comers to Hong Kong. There are a lot of plcaes you can walk around excellent hotels around & ofcourse all transport pick up points to any locations in Hong Kong & China. The bonus being the station for a train to SHenzen - China is just a few steps by walk. The Hotel service is excellent with direct opening from a shopping area into the Hotel makes it a lot more easier & private enering the Hotel. Its good hotel for caling friends for a stay or discussions without having troubles with the receptions... The rooms are very good with excellent interiors & good toilets that are above 5 Star ratings. The service people & reception talk excellent english making it much easier to communicate.... Overall - I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Hong Kong on a medium budget trip....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: wendysanti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in May for a weekend away. We were upgraded when we checked in as the hotel was undergoing some renovations. Interior of hotel was slightly dated, but the rooms were spacious and clean, albeit dark. Staff at check in were friendly and helpful. Hotel is easy walking distance to pier for ferry across to Central (5-10 minutes). Also within close walking distance is Temple Street market. Mong Kok (electronics, ladies' market) is also reacheable on foot from here, but better off catching the underground. MTR station <50m from front of hotel. Really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotless rooms! *travel agent review*”
Reviews.Author: Jooolz1976
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is one of the nicest Holiday Inn's I have ever stayed at. I expected worst and was pleasantly surprised! The rooms were small but well organized and clean. The beds were so comfortable and the washroom was spotless! The one negative is the view we had but we weren't in the room too often so who cares. The location is fantastic-right in the heart of the popular "TST" district -close to shopping and a lot of restaurant choices nearby! There is a money exchange place right across the street which came in handy. The breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious!! It is expensive however but what isn't in Hong Kong? I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good valued hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ob1c
Reviews.Content: M&POB Oct 4 Nights. Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on two occassions, both times got an upgrade, staff very pleasant and helpfull, room absolutely supherb breakfast was also very good hotel atmosphere just right got transfers included only down side we got a ticking off at the airport by PC tours the transfer group for being late, I suppose when 2 Jumbo's arrive at the same time and there are only 3 on at immigration that would make anybody late.

Reviews.Title: “great family stopover”
Reviews.Author: jls4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2008 with our two kids (9 and 7). Fantastic value for money. Definitely worth paying the upgrade for the executive floor. Excellent breakfasts which set us up for the day. Check in and room facilities really good value for the price. Staff so helpful and polite. Lovely roof top pool for the children. Great location on Nathan Road for the Star Ferry and sightseeing. MTR a doddle with children. Felt very safe all the time. Hawkers left us alone with a polite refusal and night market at Mong Kok a must-see. Would definitley go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: EiLiYa
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed in this hotel last December. Being a Holiday Inn, we didn't expect too much and our main purpose was to go sightseeing and shopping so we weren't too concern about the accommodation. The room was pretty neat and definitely spacious by Hong Kong standard. The location was needless to say, fantastic! Only downside is that it is beside this sleazy building with lotsa questionable characters hanging around it. However, they didn't really bother us. Perhaps the reason was that my hubby is a 220lb rubgy player. From our room, we have a very clear view of the back of this old and dirty building. Other than that, we are quite pleased with the hotel. The staff are friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: artic54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile for 3 nights during our short stay in Hong Kong. We were looking for a low price yet well situated hotel with roof top wimming pool. The Holiday Inn Golden Mile answers all these requirements. The king size bedrooms are very comfortable and quiet, and accomodations (like swiming pool) seemed to have been recently restored. Although, global interior design is not really adapted to European taste (colorfull carpet, huge marble reception, black "look like" marble bathroom, ...), it is yet really clean and tidy. Moreover, the hotel is really close to the embankment where you can see all the lightings on Honk Kong island. It is also close to all shops and it is only a 5 minutes walk to get to the Star Ferry. We paid 110 Euros per night (breakfast not included) which is really a good price if think. There is only one thing I didn' t like, it's the view on poor dilapidated buildings which seems almost inescapable in a city like Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to Star Ferry, space museum, many attractions and many malls and shops and is in the heart of Hong Kong on the Kowloon side. When I arrived, the bellman had our bags in two seconds, doors were opened and the attentive staff was able to easily communicate. I originally book one night pre-paid on the priorityclub website, but decided to arrive a day early, having made an additional reservation (not pre-paid) at lunchtime the day before my scheduled arrival. The clerk put the two reservations together, crediting me for the pre-paid day, and assigned me to an 8th floor delux rooom. Bellman brought my luggage quickly, room service was fast. Internet worked perfectly at the desk with a wired connection, with wi-fi available. Room was not large, but was well appointed with very nice bed, bedside light controls (that is always so nice!). Mini-bar well stocked with wide variety including many non-alcoholic choices and many beers and hard liquor - and snacks. The little loveseat was comfortable and the TV had many cable choices and pay per view. The nighborhood is interesting, small shops with trinckets (fake rolex and knock-off bags) in the allys, and real Rolex and high end jewelry and department stores on the main drag. I stay at holiday in alot in the USA, and this is a cut above the usual Texas/Oklahoma Holiday Inn, and I am usually happy there too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ShortbreadAustralia
Reviews.Content: I loved Hong kong, hotel very busy, room clean & spacious , the view WELL, not there for the view. Great location to the trains, harbour & markets. Reception very busy, hallways very musty & smely, carpet well worn, enjoyed the pool every day on the roof after my morning walk down by the harbour. We only ate breakfast there once, as we were room charged $60 aus not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: australia87
Reviews.Content: Holiday inn is well situated on Nathan Road and Hoarbour city. Only complaint was there was alot of construction noise during hours of 9 - 6pm which was clearly heard from 6th floor. We complained and were upgraded to a higher level floor room. Rooms were clean and of reasonable size. Breakfast buffet was terrific and would recommend this with your booking although is on the pricey side. Great for families as the pool is of good size, clean and has sun bed chairs for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and Not Outrageous”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I went to Hong Kong for work. The Holiday Inn Golden Mile was chosen by the client. It has a great location on Nathan Street next to the rather seedy but still interesting Chunking Mansions. It is close to the subway station, the harbor (ferries), and the Temple Street Night Market. So, for getting around, the location can't be beat. The rooms are musty / moldy smelling and the carpet has seen better days. However, everything seemed very clean and I had no problems with much of anything. The beds were comfortable and firm, the water pressure excellent if a little on the strong side. The front desk seems to speak pretty decent English but we did find that the concierge service was uneven. Some clearly knew way more about the city and how to get around than others. Why this doesn't have a lobby bar is beyond me. All I know is that I would have bought many a drink if they had a bar in the lobby. Instead it is upstairs on the second floor and absolutely FRIGID. The good news is that they have a happy hour which we stumbled across accidently. I ordered a glass of wine and got two. The breakfast was fabulous. We never ate the buffet but the cooked to order breakfasts were great. I had both the Chinese selections and the western ones while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “overall impression”
Reviews.Author: meme_melody
Reviews.Content: after some survey, we decided to stay at holiday inn golden mile because of it's good location and airport shuttle bus to it doorstep. everything was fine, the first impression at the reception was excellence as it was fast and smooth. the room size was just right with 2 double bed. however, in the morning, while, we were still in our dreams, we heard loud singings from opposite our rooms, they were pakistans gathering for their praying, opening the room door. and the whole floor were almost pakistan. it was really disturbing. this hotel are really full of tourists from pakistan, even their ground floor, you can see a lot of them standing around in the night time, it is quite dangerous. overall, this facilities and location are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: princess3016
