Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room on the seventh floor (in what I understand is a smaller room than a standard double offered due to the fact that I was travelling alone). Whilst the room was on the small side, it was perfectly adequate for me on my two night stay. The room had everything I needed and was very clean. I saw other reviewers complain about the view from the windows from this side of the hotel, yes the view of the air conditioning units on the other building is not great but you are in central hong kong so what would you expect in this price bracket, plus I was too busy seeing the sights outside to worry about the view from my room. The breakfast at the hotel was a good size buffet with a great range of western and asian food both hot and cold, however, if you are like me and just want a croissant/toast for breakfast it is better value to pop to a cafe but big eaters will get their moneysworth. The location of the hotel was great, a short walk to the star ferry and right by the MTR station. Yes there are some Hawkers on Nathan Road but again, to be expected on this road (my guidebook detailed this) and also at the markets and other main tourist areas. A couple of streets near the hotel have a number of young and trendy bars and there is a row of restaurants a ten minute walk away by the shangri la hotel. Again, I saw some comments on the nature of the area, as a young woman travelling alone I felt perfectly safe walking back to the hotel from dinner and the night markets. The staff at the hotel were very attentive and provided fantastic service, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: bridgegap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from JUNE 13 to June 16 ,2008. The booking on the website was quick & the way to the hotel via the airport express/shuttle was fine too. We booked on the club floor as we normally do in holiday inn & we can say we were not a bit disappointed.The breakfast & evening cocktails were great & we felt pretty much spoilt for choice.Availability of drinks throughout the day is a great facility for the tired limbs once you come back from an outing The club room was nice & fairly spacious considering how expensive real estate is in HK.The king bed was good as was the bathroom facilities & toiletries.All in all a good experience. While one side of the hotel faces a decaying building,I think visitors to HK have not come to look at that building.A disgusting sight but then just cover the window with the blinds & forget about it. The location of the hotel is great as it is near the promanade,the ferry stops,the MRT & therefore going anywhere was so easy & comfortable.Last time I had stayed in Central but I think staying in Kowloon is a better bet ,because this side of town there is at least normal people moving around whereas in Central you got this feeling on just floating in the clouds with the holipoli. All in all a very good experience & I would recommend this hotel to all.Go for the club floor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view of the run down building next door.”
Reviews.Author: waggies
Reviews.Content: We could deal with the indians out the front hassling us all the time and the reception area looks beautiful, but when the lift opened, we had a sinking feeling. Stained carpets, a stale smell of smoke (on a non-smoking floor) and then our room was just spectacular...not. The lights were faulty and numerous attempts at staff to fix them, didn't stop the electricity cutting out continuously, then the toilet started ovrflowing, and the view!! Oh I loved looking at that run grotty filthy, rubbish strewn monstrosity next door. It was more enjoyable watching the pidgeons breeding just on the window ledge. the bar, reaked of cigars, although they do know how to mix a good drink and the 2for1 dealwas great. BUT the chinese restaurant downstairs... YUMMMOOOO!!!! I cannot encourage anyone enough to go there. We had the full on banquet it was about $100AUD each but my gosh teh food was brilliant. The staff chatted to us all night, they cook it in front of you,a dn they even let me have a go of the wok! They explain exactly what we were eating and were a commendation to the hotel. I was just dissaponted that we went to the restaurant on our last night, cos otherwise I would ahve been there the whole five days.

Reviews.Title: “So so only”
Reviews.Author: LYY011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a deluxe room during June 5 for 3 nights. I was told it was recently renovated, but I wasnt feeling the 'new' comfort of it when I arrive. In fact the room look just ok, not bright enough. We got a room which come with 2 queen sized bed and it was very good for family of 4 to stay all in 1 room. The bed was quite comfortable though and have clean bedsheet on it. The bathroom was small, with a bathtub that wasnt really clean and white. The toiletries came in full set, so you dont need to prepare any if you are a easy traveller. The worst part of my stay was, there was no security in and out of the hotel. The lift do not have access key card function, so anyone can simply go up to the guest room. There was no security guard at the side door which was full of indians and africans walking around. The environment was totally upset and turn off. When you enter from the side door, there was a terrible smell coming from dont know where. The hotel should seriously do something about the security. The location was great, easy access to harbour city where all the branded boutique are located, 2mins walk to the star ferry pier where you can access to avenue of stars for some photo shooting. For local shops, staying at Kimberley, Miramar hotel was better as it had all the fashionable shops around it. I still prefer Langham Place after all which is easy access to everywhere by MTR and a perfect room/price for everyone. Please double consider when you are shortlisting Holiday Inn Goldenmile for your next stay and do not put too much expectation on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: catherinalove
Reviews.Content: I'm a repeat guest of this hotel. Primarily stayed because of fantastic location. Has airport express shuttle pickup, adjacent to subways, near money changers and restaurants, both shopping centers and chinese atmosphere right at your doorstep, short walk to Victorial Harbour and China Ferry Terminal, & it's even near Kowloon Park! Staff is polite and efficient. They let us leave our baggage even after we checked out at noon, since our flight wasn't until the evening. So we didn't have to lug our bags while we did some last-minute shopping. Room was newly refurbished. Had complete toiletries which were fastidiously replaced. Didn't have to request for razors, combs, make-up remover and skunchie, since they were already there. Nice weighing scale in the bathroom. Love that they have 3 sets of towels & bathrobes, because I like to use new ones for each bath instead of having to hang them out for the evening. Cons: Lots of Indian hawkers outside the hotel and along Nathan Road. Just ignore them though. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Morgan_max
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because I had stayed there years earlier and knew it is a great location. It was so simple taking the Airport Express train with the shuttle connection to the hotel, even arriving at nearly midnight with a 6 year old in tow. Check-in was a breeze, very friendly staff. We chose to eat in the hotel restaurant each morning as it was just easier. The staff were so friendly and really looked after us. The pool was a real hit with my daughter too. Travelling all over HKG is so easy from here with the train on the doorstep, the Star Ferry just down the road, sites like the Planetarium within walking distance and buses nearby also. An unexpected bonus, with the shops so close, we managed to fit in a little extra shopping after checking out, before our shuttle bus was due.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location”
Reviews.Author: mjcBeijing
Reviews.Content: Found the 2 double beds perfect for 2 kids and 2 adults--so many places in China (including HK) want to charge for the 4th person despite the fact that there's plenty of room. Clean rooms, superb showers, very easy to navigate both the hotel and the neighborhood, though we were frequently barraged with offers for tailoring and "copy watches." One complaint about service: staff was not helpful with regard to use of subway/trains, nor were they able to get us either connecting rooms or decent views.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and great service”
Reviews.Author: nyc137
Reviews.Content: It's a four star hotel but it's more like a three star in the US since the hotel room is quite old. However the service is outstanding. The gym is clean and modern and open from 5:30A to 11P. The pool is open from 7A to 7P as well. It's very safe around that area and we went out for noodles at 3AM without any problems. We went on a couple of Gray Line tours which you can buy from the concierge in the lobby. They were all decent priced but be careful of their visits to jewelry factories / museums which are actually hidden sales demonstrations. Buy an Octopus card so you can take their MTR (subway/metro) to bring you almost anywhere you want to go for very cheap. If you're going to China make sure you get a visa or go with a tour so that they can use their group tour visa to get you in. The Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR train station is right across the street. We also took the A21 bus from/to the airport for $33HK.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at the Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: After countless hours finding a hotel that would accommodate 2 adults and 2 children, we settled with this hotel. We booked a standard room with 2 double bed on their on-line website which I found had a better rate than anywhere. We purchased Octopus cards at the airport, took the Airport Bus (A21) and basically dropped us in front of the hotel. The location was very convenient. It was nice to have the entrance to the TST in front of the hotel. Although, I think most hotels would also be convenient because the MTR stations are everywhere. They tried to talk us into upgrading to a deluxe room for more $$$ but we declined and they still upgraded us anyway and I'm glad they did. The room was spacious and newly renovated. The bed was nice and firm but not hard as I thought it would be. The kids were happy that there were English cartoons on TV. They offer two complimentary water bottles in the bathroom (no need to buy one at the mini-bar) and complimentary shoe shine (look for the shoe bag in the closet). There was also a bathrobe and disposable slippers in the closet. The bathroom was very nice. They have a weighing scale, toothbrushes with mini toothpaste and the usual shampoo, lotion, shower gel, comb, razor and shaving cream. The only flaw that I can think of is that the hair dryer was a little dated and didn't have much power. Extra info: The people outside the hotel trying to sell 'copy watch', 'tailor-suit', 'copy purse' didn't bother us. They might be annoying but they're also trying to make a living. We went to Chungking Mansion a couple of doors down a few times and they have good rates on currency exchange. If you need to get your laundry done. Purity Laundry at the back of Chungking Mansion was really good. Wash and fold in less than 3 hours and was very clean and cheap. There's a 24-hour McDonalds right around the corner which was good when my son had the jet lag and was wide awake @ 3am. BTW, most stores doesn't open until 10am. We also checked out the pool on the roof, it was too cold to swim but was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Irdina
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We stayed in a 2-double bed, non-smoking room. The room was clean & spacious for 3 of us (my husband & daughter). Customer service officer was prompt & answer our questions clearly. Buffet breakfast was quite variety & more than enough to cover until lunch time :). Last but not least, I would recommend this hotel for its location, convenience for public transport & cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: garfield1948
Reviews.Content: We took this trip through JTB the enormous Japanese Travel Agent because we live there. They handle everything, including check-in. On the bus from the airport the local agent assured everyone that we would get non-smoking rooms unless we requested smoking. Lo and behold when we got to the room it was smoking. Front desk offered to send some spray to the room. As any non-smoker will tell you, that has a minimal impact on the stink which pervades the room. After a tussle with the local agent and the hotel, we were finally given a non-smoking room. The room was clean and comfortable. All you would really want for a short stay. The hotel is well located. 10 minute walk from Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island and right on Nathan Road, a main shopping street in Kowloon. Our room was quiet and we were happy with it. I would recommend it although it is not a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gary2007
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of advance online purchase! Won't honor low price guarantee.”
Reviews.Author: MM1901
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile through their online booking engine and secured a "special savings" 14 day advance purchase rate that required a full prepay and no cancellation. I then came back to the website two weeks later to book a room for a friend to find that the rate had dropped by more than 30%. When I called ICH Guest Relations they refused to honor the lower rate. Call me crazy, but one would think that a full upfront, no cancellation 14 day advance notice booking would be lower than one booked with no strings attached. Despite their book with confidence, low price guarantee, customer service refused to honor the lower rate. I don't think I will ever stay there again. WHAT A TERRIBLY CUSTOMER UNFRIENDLY HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation, a wonderful delight”
Reviews.Author: goblondie
Reviews.Content: At first we were staying at the Sheraton in Kowloon, Hong Kong but found it wasn't right in the city centre, and was a terrible hotel for the huge amount of money that we paid per night. We inspected the Holiday Inn and the staff were lovely and extremly helpful. They happily showed us their rooms and arranged to have our bags moved. They also advised us on all the right subway routes to go to all the shopping hotspots. The rooms were far larger than the Sheraton and far more comfortable. The beds were great! It's location was probably the best in Kowloon, right in the middle of Nathan Street with many subways located around it. (although subways are dotted everywhere) It was very quiet which meant alot to us. It was a fair price as well. We were very happy with the hotel and would highly reccommend it, we are very picky markers and could not find any fault with this hotel. At the end of the trip we had accumulated so much luggage we were afraid we would be charged lots of money on the flight back home. The staff happily weighed all of our luggage and gave us advice on what to do. It is also very secure with a "bouncer" outside the hotel at all times. On our second day we discovered the wonderful steam room, whoch is a great escape after a full day of walking. Remember expensive is not always the best!

Reviews.Title: “OK if you like Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: chuckieboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges 4 HK$ (US $.0.50) per minute for internet usage which is a deal-killer for me since I use the internet so much while traveling. This gives me a bad impression of the hotel since it's about on the level of charging for TV usage or putting a coin operated lock on the bathroom in this day and age. I don't mind if they charge a flat rate of say $US5 per day for an internet connection but if they are going to advertise a wireless internet connection in the room then they need to tell you they charge for it by the minute because that makes it basically unusable. If I had known that I wouldn't have stayed there but fortunately it was for only one night. Our room rate did not include breakfast and they charged about $US 25 for the breakfast buffet and with a family of 5 that's just ridiculous so we weren't too happy with that either. The hotel is very close to the ferries and metro and several museums but unfortunately to get there you have to walk through dozens of hawkers shoving fake watches in your face, tailor services, massages, and other products and services. Nathan Road and the other streets of Kowloon are very unpleasant to walk through at night and not much better during the day. On the side streets like Moby Road there's an unpleasant smell of sewage. The staff at this hotel was nice and helpful, the health club was nice, the rooftop pool was a little cold and closes early (7 pm) at least in the winter, and the rooms were pleasant although not nearly as nice as those in the Shanghai Radisson, which we had just left. The view from the room was of some hideous collapsing building that looked like it had been condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Kryjon
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit with our two children.Top notch accomadation with a premium location and we at all times felt secure.The restaraunt breakfast was a daily highlight. .Our return trip is already being planned for 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: aimantakkisah
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nites. the room was clean and comfortable however the room that i stayed in was facing an old building. Maybe for future stays I would opt for rooms facing the other side of the hotel. Superb location for shopping and travel. It was personally easy for me to get halal food as the bulding next to the hotel has many halal outlets and even across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicky-ps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 young children, and found the staff to be extremely helpful, the room was tastefully decorated and comfortable and the location is just superb if your only in Hong Kong for a few days and want to do alot of exploring. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Happy times at The Holiday Inn Golden Mile !”
Reviews.Author: Loving_Holidays
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be faulted, a five minute stroll to Star ferry terminal, and a 60 second walk to the MTR station. The rooms were of an average size, although the bathroom was a little on the small side, but the room in general was very clean, with a really comfy kingsize bed and pillows ! Reception staff were helpful and friendly. There is alot of noise from the building site opposite and was a bit of an annoyance, as the construction work noise lasts most of the day, (although to be fair you are out for most of the day, but if you pop back to the hotel for an afternoon nap, because of the jetlag you will not get any peace!!) The hotel buffet meal in the evening is quite nice and good value for money which includes the dessert buffett - fab (scoop as much Haagan Dazs ice cream as you want!) As you read in alot of these reviews, the hawkers selling you 'copy watches' and custom tailoring' gets really annoying as they do not take No for an answer. I would definatley return to this hotel in the future, good value for money

Reviews.Title: “No Faults”
Reviews.Author: mandmwa
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 6 day holiday (not stopover) to Hong Kong. We picked this hotel from its location on Nathan Road and price. There were three women on our holiday sharing a standard room. We were offered an upgrade at a price but decided we weren't actually going to be in our room much to warrant paying extra. Yes, there wasn't much of a view out of our window on the 6th floor, but we didn't pick this hotel for its view. The room was tidy, had everything we needed for our stay and was roomy enough for the three of us. The location of this hotel is a major drawcard. It is on the southern end of Nathan Road within easy walking distance to major shopping areas. MTR (underground rail) station is right outside and very user friendly. This line takes you right to the Mong Kok area, a shoppers paradise. By MTR, Hong Kong Disney is roughly 40 - 50 mins away, Hong Kong Island 10 - 15 mins. Yes, Hong Kong Disney is small but not to be missed. You can easily see all the sights in one day. If travelling with smaller children, this park's size would be an ideal alternative to the hustle and bustle of Californias Disneyland. Early in the day the queues for rides and photo opportunities with Disney stars were non existant. Restaurants at our hotel were superb. I cannot fault the service or food in any way. Apart from a special birthday dinner to R66 and dinner at Jumbo Floating Restaurant, we ate in the hotel's restaurants. Hawkers do seem to like Nathan Road but are not large in number and will leave you alone if you indicate "no thank you". I would not hesitate to book again with Holiday Inn, Golden Mile.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: amber28
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Golden Mile was booked through our travel agent as an overnight stopover after a holiday in Europe and I'm pleased to say it was excellent. Our flight arrived into Hong Kong at 7.30am and after the crowds, disorganisation and dirtiness of most European airports coming into the Hong Kong airport was a revelation! No queues, helpful and plentiful staff and so clean. We caught the airport express train (so easy) and then a shuttle bus to the hotel. We were there by 8.30am and we could check into our room straight away. We were offerred an upgrade to a newly renovated room, which cost 250 hk dollars and we are glad we did. The room was beautiful compared to everything we had stayed in in Europe. It was large, with 2 double beds, fluffy fresh towels, an iron and ironing board(a real treat as no hotels we stayed in, in Europe had this), a free safe and cable tv. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The view was of the building next door which was awful, but I'd read on line this was the case. The hotel gym was well equipped and the pool on the top floor was clean and refreshing. When we could drag ourselves out of the room the location was great, an easy walk to the ferry terminal, shops and underground. The day we were there was Chinese National day and an extra treat was a fireworks display over the harbour. We also found the staff very accommodating, friendly and efficient. We also loved that you can check in for flights from the airport express train station rather than drag bags on the train and off again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Irishtripster
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week trip to China. Our stay in Hong Kong was the final leg of the journey. We had been very happy with all accommodation during our stay and the Holiday Inn did not let us down. From the very minute of our arrival we were treated with great respect and courtesy. Our flight from Beijing to Hong Kong had been delayed by 5hours and on hearing this the reception staff checked us in with great speed and ensured that our luggage was taken to our rooms immediately. The reception staff (especially Cindy) were all extremely friendly and helpful and all had very good english. We had 2 connecting rooms which were very spacious, spotlessly clean and had lovely fresh good quality fluffy white towels in the bathroom. Breakfast next morning was buffet style and every food you could wish for was there. Fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, all types of hot western food, chinese food and continental food. The breads, rolls, croissants etc were all very fresh and all food was continuously replenished right up to 10am. We used the restaurant 1 afternoon and the lunch memu was very extensive and again buffet style and food was great - especially the desserts. We stayed 3 nights. We would highly recommend this hotel. It is very well located. The hotel is has a 3* rating but I would say it is nearer to 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Great LOCATION and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mommyofbuzz
Reviews.Content: You can be anywhere in a matter of minutes when you stay in this hotel. Everything is accessible. It is near the subway, convenience stores, restaurants,near the ferry, bus and taxi stop, the post office, near the shopping malls, near the Museums and near the bay! . Room service was quick. The hotel staff very helpfu! They even found a way to open my son's toy in the middle of the night! ;) I highly recommend this hotel for families and business travelers. :) :) We had a wonderful 3 nights stay in this hotel To quote my son, ' I love this house mommy!' :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Judenz
Reviews.Content: When looking for a good stopover on way home, our travel agent suggested the Golden Mile, in Hong Kong. We got an excellent package deal which included a wonderful sightseeing tour, one free dinner and airport transfers. Fingers crossed we booked, and were not in any ways disappointed. My first impression of the hotel was ..wow...the staff were polite and friendly, and our room was much bigger than expected. I was prepared for the view of neighbouring apartments, and the rubbish that falls on to lower rooves, so saw it as a piece of culture in how other countries live. The room was a delight, large and clean with all amenities...and a comfortable bed! Location was excellent for the harbour and ferry, and shopping on Nathan Rd. I even had my hair cut and styled downstairs at the salon which was superb. Our included dinner was delicious. While food was reasonably priced, we did learn to drink only water at meal time and buy our drinks from convenience store and take back to our room to avoid exorbitant prices. Hotel staff were approachable , friendly and always smiling and willing to help. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, we could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience Trumps ALL”
Reviews.Author: roberee
Reviews.Content: You're paying for the location...plain and simple. The hotel is moderately dated. You can immediately tell that there hasn't been a good renovation in years. The lobby is dim, the hallways are used, and the room we stayed in was clean but old. Nothing is falling apart but everything is used. The redeeming factor is that it's not dirty! The gym is pretty large and houses all types of equipment. I used it on a couple occasions, and it was sufficient. The lobby is always busy. The bar/restaurant seems to be a pretty hip place for people to hangout, although we didn't try it. The check-in was semi-chaotic but we were given our rooms momentarily. Also, cabs will know of the hotel but they won't be able to drive you the entrance since cars are parked there left-n-right. You'll have to wheel your own luggage in and the porters will not notice you until you're already in the check-in line and don't really need their assistance anymore - but they'll insist on taking your bags. The hotel is located a block away from the train station - super convenient. It's close to the harbour, it's surrounded by shops and restaurants (but where in HK are you not!). It's also the stomping grounds of many black market specialists - they hand out in front of the hotel day-n-night. Again, nothing about the hotel to brag home about. Its best feature is its location. We didn't spend any time in the hotel aside from the several sleeping hours at night, so it fitted our agenda well. If you're expecting some posh hotel just because its the neighbor of The Peninsula...think again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: amsam
Reviews.Content: A very busy hotel with good size rooms. We are a family of four with two children aged 9 & 11. We chose one room with two double beds as this was a two night stopover to break our London - Sydney flight with a shopping blitz. Upon check in we were offered a plethora of added fee upgrades of which we choose one at $200 HK per night that offered the children dine free and a 30% discount in all hotel restaurants. This payed for itself and some since we had dinner at the hotel buffet both nights. Best way to describe the hote is - We were comfortable. Our room appeared to be recently renovated and was immaculately clean. Bathroom very small. The hotel pool on the roof provided a nice setting. The staff were very friendly and all spoke english. The room maid was over zelous and couldn't wait to clean our room each day, it was a bit annoying knowing he was waiting. The complimentary water bottles in our room was a nice touch and when housekeeping relised there was four of us they replenished the water and cosmetics very promptly. our room rate included a late 6pm checkout at no charge which was very handy. Our son had an incident in the hotel buffet were he accidently broke a glass coke bottle with a glass fragment cutting his cheek slightly. The restaurant manager was extremely attentative calling first aid and a duty manager immediately whom promptly attended. They escorted him with my wife to our room were they attended to him very attentively. Upon checkout the next evenning the same duty manager in a very busy lobby left what she was doing to see if all was ok, which it was and paid particular attention to our son. I thought this was very impressive and personal of her for such a minor incident. Ideal location and hotel for a Hong Kong shopping spree. Exceptional value for money. Was recommended to me by both a friend and travel agent whom both stayed there. I have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: astrochichi
Reviews.Content: Booked online for executive club room. 2 double beds. 2 adults 2 kids - 10 and 12 years old 18th floor - views really of neighbouring buildings. one side very close to neighbouring building so we got other side facing moody road. good value exec rooms as breakfast included and cocktails and nibblies 6-8pm also included in executive lounge. we liked the executive lounge and it had two PCs with broadband to check things etc. Staff were very nice and helpfull. Very courteous. Kids 12 and under stay and eat for free. good value because of this. position on nathan road is in the thick of it really and chungking house has good currency exchange places make sure you look at them all not just the first few as rates get better further back you go. yes there are hawkers infront of the building but they are all along this section of nathan road. Just ignore them keep walking etc - look up at the signs etc and they will leave you alone. we had to catch taxis to mongkok markets as we found the MTR good but a but hectic for the kids. Taxi to mongkok was only 30 HK dollars ie 4 to 5 dollars AU/NZ/US etc - a bottle of water is between 6 and 15 hk dollars so taxis are reasonable. Hotel had very nice roof top pool and BIG TIP here is to get up to pool before 8pm each nite for the fireworks as the building next door has one of the rooftop firework stations andswim or not at the same time its really lovely and beats going down to the star ferry area every nite to see the bigger show on hong kong island. try it at least once!. Also the hotel has like a huge state of the art exercise area ( air conditioned of course) with all the machines plus shower area, sauna etc. Nicely laid out too. Hotel has a small arcade downstairs where you can get a haircut etc. Taxis can be caught from the lobby and the handler there will instruct the taxi drive where to take you. Taxi from there to the airport was 300 HK dollars including tip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kookie
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel and it was definitely as described, it is central, 5 star and great service. We decided to upgrade to Executive level as it was the same price when we booked direct with the hotel compared with the normal room via the travel agent. You got so many extra's eg. drinks and nibblies at night, I was drinking Chivas Regal every night, also coffee and bikkies anytime during the day, also a great breakfast all inclusive. So we definitely got our moneys worth, oh also you were always on the 17th or 18th level and checked in there too. The hotel is really central and you can walk to the Star Ferry, walk to Temple St Markets, also Ladies Markets and also an easy 35mins on a train to Shenszen, China (the only place to go shopping, it was the best and cheapest anywhere). Loved the place and would definitely go back there. Just beware of all the touting as soon as you walk out the hotel door but it is everywhere. Also if you can avoid June please do as it was so hot in June but there was always so many shops with air conditioning to go into, so you just put up with it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, not so nice location”
Reviews.Author: Drumnaconagher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our return journey from Taiwan. There is a free shuttle bus service (K3) to/from Kowloon Aiport Express station which will save you the taxi fare, however the taxi fare from Kowllon Airport Express station will only be about 60 HK dollars max which is about four quid (@ May 2007 prices). Check in was flawless and the staff very friendly and attentative. Our bags were delivered to our room (on the 15th floor) within two minutes. The room view was poor overllooking a high rise building opposite. The actual room itself was excellent, with everything you would expect from a Holiday Inn hotel. There were several restaurants, a pool, a good equiped fitness room etc. We did not eat in the hotel as there are an abundance of places to eat on the door step. The only down side to our stay was the amount of hawkers outside of the hotel. This is no reflection on the hotel or the staff itself, but at the time of our visit we wished that the Hong Kong authorities would do something about the hawkers on this area of Nathan Road who constantly badger you to buy shirts, suits, real fake rolex watches etc. The best way to deal with hawkers we found was by totally ignoring them (i.e. do not acknowledge their existence). The hotel is located on Nathan Road where there is an abundance of pubs and places to eat from 24 hour opening McDonalds to 24 hour opening Noodle bars. The Irish bars within minutes walk; Murphys & Delaneys both serve excellent food. Overall our experience ot hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Fong
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms at the Exeuctive Club floor for four nights. We found the rooms extremely spacious for HK standard - imagine a King bed, a two-seater couch, coffee table and still ample space for my toddler to run around! This was a welcome change from our last visit where we stayed at the highly rated hotel at Mongkok area. Also, rooms were well-lit. For the Executive Floor, we paid extra HKD360 per room/night to enjoy its priviledges - complimentary b/f and evening cockktail at its Lounge; use of internet at the lounge; late check-out at 4pm; DVD rental, etc. Every evening, we would head to the Lounge and relaxed for a cup of brewed coffee and cookies - a good way to chill-out after a day of sightseeing. In terms of accessibility, one could not ask for more. Complimentary Airport Express shuttle plies between Kowloon station every 12 minutes; Exit G of TST MTR station is right in front of the hotel; Star Ferry terminal and Harbour City shopping centre are within walking distance. In terms of F&B options, we only tried the chinese restaurant - food was so-so but prices are steep. I would recommend the one at the Cultural centre which is not far away. Good cantonese food at reasonable prices - plus good harbour view. As for the flip side, indeed the hotel is situated among many rundown buildings so the view from the windows are not exciting. But having said that, I reckon that most would find such from other hotels as well, unless one stays at the pricy ones along Salisbury Road. Afterall this is part of the everchanging HK cityscape - newer developments surrounded by older buildings. For those who are affected, one could request for a room facing Mody Road and nearer to the Nathan Road end. As for the touts, yes there were many promoting restaurants and massage services. Again, you would find others elsewhere along Nathan Road. Fortunately those we met were not very persistent - perhaps they were less inclined towards Asians. All in all, it was an excellent stay and i am sure we would head back to Golden Mile when we ever visit HK again for its rooms and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: wartling
Reviews.Content: Having seen previous reviews we opted to upgrade - the extra was only HK$200=£13 a night - and we couldn't find fault with the room, hotel or service. The Austrian restaurant was great value, especially the buffet - and again excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Must have Improved”
Reviews.Author: Applaudio
Reviews.Content: While you could never claim that the Holiday Inn Golden Mile is one of the world's great hotels, our 2 night stay was perfectly satisfactory. Upon arrival at 9am - and not really expecting to be able to check in - a room was quickly prepared for us. We were also given late check out till 5pm. The location is excellent with a train station literally outside the front of the hotel. The harbour and many major shopping centres are within a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “very good and freindly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golduy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Hong Kong. Location is beatiful for day and night time. Is very near MTR station, HuHom station, etc. The room size is exelent. Very cean and big beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: TaniaAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile. I read several reviews here before making my booking, and I must say that I was feeling concerned upon arrival as most people had said that they did not receive the rooms they had booked, and were upsold to more expensive rooms etc. On arrival, the staff were friendly, our rooms were ready, and were very nicely decorated. We travelled with 5 children, and requested interconnecting rooms which we received. Both rooms had 2 doubles, and were quite large by comparison of some that I have stayed in. The views out the window that people complain about are very typical Hong Kong, and honestly if this offends you, maybe you should not go to Hong Kong. The breakfast buffet was great, food for all cultures, eggs cooked for you. We ate there every morning, and didn't feel the need for lunch. We took a piece of fruit from the buffet, and they encouraged our children to take something from the bakery. We ordered room service one night about 10.15pm. Took approx 10 mins. Pricing was good, and food was great. Arrived in the hot trolley , and left to eat when you were ready. Location was my main reason for booking, with my youngest 6 years, the mtr and the ktr right over the road. At the end of a long day 8 days in a row this was great, straight off the train into hotel. The hawkers seemed to be outside all major hotels, and yes they are annoying. Once again if you stay in the Tsim Sha Tsui area this is to be expected. The firm no works, but they do this every time you come and go. We were given 2pm check out without charge, and our whole experience was great. I would return and recommend this hotel. Staff in Cafe Vienna were very helpful, offering where to shop and where not to. We found this valuable. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ell33
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop for us on a four week tour of Australia, before our return to the UK. A great hotel which is perfectly situated at the tip of Kowloon. Within a five minute walk you can reach the Avenue of the Stars and the Star Ferry Terminal. A ten minute walk the opposite way up Nathan Road takes you to the Temple Street market areas. The lobby is quite small in comparison to other Holiday Inn's I've stayed at. However, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 7th floor and looked out onto a decaying block of flats. The room itself was great. Two large (king size) beds but a small bathroom. Tv and coffee/tea making facilities were available. Plenty of wardrobe space too. The hotel also had a fitness centre and pool, although the pool was outside and was too cold to use! Breakfast was the usual mix of continental and cooked and was fairly average. The hotel also has a bar which was always busy. The thing that struck me the most about the bar (other than the expensive drinks) was the amount of 'working girls' there. We used the bar two out of three nights we were there and each night there must have been two or three different groups of 'working girls' there each time. The good thing was they didn't bother you and waited to be approached, so you could have a quiet (but expensive!) beer. A great hotel that I'd probably use again. Just be aware of the amount of hawkers on Nathan Road trying to sell you suits, fake watches and hand bags!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but no view or good restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Evan A
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn was clean, the staff was helpful, and the workout room was well equipped. I would give it 3.5 out of 5 stars. The restaurant was only passable, but served the purpose for breakfast. If you have the money, stay somewhere with a decent view of the Victoria Harbour and with better restaurants. We walked to the InterContinental hotel in Kowloon on the harbour one night for drinks and dinner. It was much nicer and seemed like a true 4 to 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for a mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgcherrygal
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile hotel over new year eve 2006. Chose this hotel because we wanted to stay in the city centre and that unfortunately most of the surrounding cheaper hotels were fully booked during the holiday season. We confirmed our booking for a double bed Executive Club room via the HolidayCity website. Upon check-in, we requested for a Twin sharing Executive Club room, but were told that we could upgrade to a bigger executive room with twin beds at HKD 200 per night. Considering that we already booked the room at a pricey rate of more than HKD 5000 for 4 nights, we decided not to upgrade. After checking the system for a couple of minutes, the lady behind the check-in counter offered us a free upgrade to twin executive club room for us, which we greatly appreciated. Room was clean. Size and decor of the room were above average. However, view from the window overlooked rundown residential blocks, and the bathroom was rather cramp. Breakfasts at the Executive lounge were above average, with a wide selection: pastries, cheese, juices, dim sum, salmon etc. However, the novelty of the selection soon wore off as we had our breakfast on four consecutive mornings at the executive lounge. Evening cocktail that ran between 6-8pm were pleasant with warm dim sum, crispy fish fingers, chips, mixed nuts and other cold appertisers. Freeflow of Beer and alcoholic drinks were also available. A great place to unwind after a day of sightseeing. There is also free usage of internet at the 2 computer terminals in the executive lounge throughout the day. Excellent location. Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station is accessible just across the street from the hotel. The nearby streets and shops are bustling with activities.Hotel is also within walking distance (about 10 mins walk) to key attractions in Kowloon, like Avenue of the Stars, Clock Tower, Star Ferry Pier, etc. Complimentary express shuttle bus service to and from Kowloon MTR station is also available from the hotel at about 15-20 mins interval. Very convenient for those who intend to commute by the airport express MTR service via Kowloon station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: lgbudapest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile last week, on our way back to Europe from Australia. We have stayed here before and like the location of the hotel. We are Priority Club members. Our flight arrived at 4.30 am and we arrived at the hotel very early in the morning and asked the front desk if they could store our bags until the room was ready. The very friendly and efficient man at the front desk informed us that our room was not ready this early, but he would give us another room to use in the meantime. This was completely unexpected but very welcome! We were shown to a renovated room - it was clean and spacious. We freshened up and left for the day. When we returned in the late afternoon our bags had been moved to our Executive Club Room. Another clean, spacious room; 2 queen size beds, bathrobes, slippers, complimentary water and lots of other nice touches. Executive Club level includes access to the lounge, with cocktails from 6 - 8 pm and breakfast. My only complaint about the Lounge would be that there were no drinks save for coffee in the lounge outside of cocktail and breakfast times. Free intenet in the lounge as well, which was great. My husband and I used the gym - it was clean and well-equipped. Breakfast in the morning was great - included eggs to order, plenty of western and Asian choices. We were given a 4 pm checkout with no extra charge. Hotel arranged airport pick-up and drop-off for us. We ate lunch one day in the Vienna Cafe. Burgers looked great; sandwich looked great. However - my salad was the smallest salad I have ever seen - 2 tiny lettuce leaves and two tiny strips of grilled meat. It was also the most expensive salad I have ever eaten!!!!!!!! All in all we had a great stay and will return. The renovations are great; service is good, and the little touches (like the complimentary room at 6 am...) are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Not really my cup of tea.”
Reviews.Author: Rogapol
Reviews.Content: I probably could write a really bad review about this hotel but wanted to be fair to the company. Reception is a big long desk that extends just past concierge to the other side. When I walked in I was wondering who was really reception as they all had their heads down peering into a computer monitor. I walked up to one who was looked up and was friendly enough. We did the usual at check-in then was asked if I wanted to be upgraded to the new refurbished floor at $200HKD per night per room (I had 2 rooms booked for 2 nights) to which I declined since I was only passing through on my way home. I asked for a late check out at around 4pm but was informed it would cost $600HKD for that. Anyway when I eventually got to my room I was somewhat shocked to see the condition of our room. The room was so smelly like you would smell at a gym with body massage oil and the carpet was absolutely filthy with long term stains. The view was a shocker but that didn't really concern me. I called down to reception to speak to the girl who checked me in but she was busy so I was told she would call me back. 20 minutes later no call so I called again & was put straight on to her as the girl who picked up the phone obviously didn't want to deal with me. I complained about the condition of the room also stating the website did not state that the room was going to be filthy and smelly. I was upgraded to the refurbished floor free of charge although my other room stayed because it was acceptable. This room that was initally offered to me at $200HKD extra per night is the same size only higher up, newer & clean - what you would normally expect from a 4 star hotel. I again asked for a late check out to which I was told no even if I paid, as they were getting in a group & they are full house. Fair enough. Not the greatest time I've had in a Hong Kong hotel but in retrospect the hotel is quite OK and in a reasonably good area for some.

Reviews.Title: “Executive club room a must ”
Reviews.Author: CASTLEFOX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday inn Golden Mile for four nights on our way to Oz. As a treat we decided to book an Executive Club room. it was well worth it. On arrival we had personalised check in which was very efficient. Unfortunately we were given a smoking room. We complained and were moved straight away. The service was very efficient, if sometimes a little impersonal and included transfers to & from the airport organised by e-mail (at an extra cost). The lady at the travel desk was most helpful with advice and organising trips for us. The price included breakfast and evening snacks and cocktails from 6 till 8. We certainly made the most of that! The hotel is in a good location close to shops and markets and a short walk from the Avenue of Stars and the Star Ferry (10p downstairs and 15p upstairs). It was very crowded in Kowloon and is all go none stop day and night. The hustle and bustle takes a while to get used to and the peace and quiet of the hotel especially in the relaxing club room was a pleasant contrast. There is a good bar in the hotel that has live entertainment, which was suprisingly good. The drinks did work out rather expensive though and we found mingling in the street bars with the locals to be much cheaper. Overall a very enjoyable experience that we would not hesitate to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but be aware!”
Reviews.Author: DoktorCB
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at Holiday Inn Golden Mile. It was my first trip to Hong Kong, but I've been to Asia many times. Lets first talk about the good sides of this hotel: I had a standard room an 15th floor, just new renovated. The rooms are resonable sized, clean and friendly looking. The bed was excellent and the bathroom clean as I expected. Absolutly nothing to complain. For internet access you need to pay. The disadvantage: looking out of the window simply shows ugly backsides of the economy boom in HK. So don't do it and keep the curtains closed. The hotel is nicely located, many restaurants are nearby and of course in the middle of many shopping malls. The hotel as it has a lot to offer in terms of bars and restaurants. Breakfast is expensive and not included. To central its just a star boat ride over the lagoon and very convinient. Now to the bad side: they will try to sell you an upgrade which is none - that's what happend to me. But at 10 pm after a 20 hour trip, you are glad to be in a hotel. I encountered this later the week. A hotel that I can not trust, I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mc4141
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 10 days spent at the Holiday Inn Golden Mile. We booked a King Executive Suite and although it cost more than the basic room, it was well worth the extra $. We were looked after superbly by the staff on the 18th floor. This is where the executive lounge area and checkin is located. Our room was on the 17th floor. We were advised that there was construction going on in the building but we were hardly aware of this. The executive room was very spacious and had all the comforts we needed. Room service was prompt, food delicious and not too outragiously priced. We were provided with compliemtary bottled water every day which saved us buying water all the time like we did last year at another hotel. The executive lounge provided us with complimentary breakfast which included a small range of hot food, freshly cooked eggs, pastries and an array of juices. Complimentary snacks are provided throughout the day - muffins, coffee and soft drinks. You can go to the lounge any time of the day between 7am and 11pm and have snacks or drinks - complimentary. Cocktail hour (also complimentary) is in the evening with an array of hot and cold canapes, wine, hard liquior, soft drinks and coffee/tea. There was always plenty of food provided and topped up by the chef. The staff at the executive lounge were very obliging and always there to assist. Videos are complimentary as is the high speed internet access on 2 computers which I found very useful. The gym on the 18th floor was also available for use at no charge. It was a very well equipped gym with the most modern equipment and flat screen TV monitors. All in all the hotel stay was very enjoyable and the extra we paid for the executive suite was preferable than going to breakfast at the expensive buffet downstairs. Some nights we skipped dinner as we had sufficient canapes at the cocktail bar to last us until later at night and then we were too tired to bother about dinner anyway after more hours of walking around HK. The deli which is one of the restaurants / stores part of the hotel was really good for food. We purchased some cold meat, cheese and bread rolls there for dinner one night and took them back to our room. We had just eaten lunch at the restaurant so we received a substantial discount for our purchase. The food was really good. We found the buffet breakfast (taken on a day when we had an early start for a tour) quite expensive and not as good as other buffet breakfasts we have had at other hotels. The same for dinner - the buffet was expensive but the huge range of food was not as appealing to me as other buffets I've been to. The hotel is in a great location - close to everything. Yes, there are hawkers at the Nathan Road entrance to the hotel but that is all part of the experience of being in HK. If this bothers you, then you can use the main entrance which comes out at the side street. No hawkers there. This hotel was wonderful and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJPete
Reviews.Content: I stayed in HK during a weekend in the middle of a business trip between Seoul and Inland China. The Holiday Inn Golden Mile is in a nice location in the middle of Kowloon. My first night there I went to Hari's Bar (in the hotel) and had a few beers. The bar is decent and moderately priced. Looks like a lot of the crowd are regulars. The room was OK. The king sized bed was good for my 6'4" frame. However, the first morning I woke up to a drip, drip, drip from the condensation in the ceiling airconditioning system. I put the trashcan there to catch the water. When room service cleaned the room while I was out, they fixed the drip and dried the rug. For some reason, the TV stopped working after the first night... I ordered a "Pizza Supreme" for room service and it was very bland. I would not recommend this. The food did come quickly, however. Laundry service was very good. I was warned at checkin that there was construction on the 8th floor and it may be a little noisy on Saturday. I stayed on the 15th floor and did not have any problems with noises. The view from my room looked at other buildings and down a street. I walked through the Golden Mile and it is loaded with hawkers trying to pull you into their stores (mostly watches and tailors.) I was also warned to watch out for pick-pocketers. A short walk away is some nice shopping at the Harbour-City Ocean Terminal. I had a good lunch at Dan Ryan's Chicago bar. Overall the Holiday Inn is priced well and located in a good central place. Little 'issues" in my room were taken care of promptly. This is the only place in HK that I stayed at so I can not compare to others...

Reviews.Title: “a holiday break in a building site”
Reviews.Author: cosmicelk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, Golden Mile, for 3 days, two nights, early June, 2006. On our arrival at the reception the girls gabbled that we could not stay in our rooms between 9 am and 6 pm as there was renovation work going on. We pointed out that we should have been informed about this at the time we booked. The girls made rude comments in Cantonese - fortunately one of us knew Cantonese. We were on the 10th floor which had a corridor carpet in better condition that on the other floors. The decor was 1970s and the only feature apparently added since the 1980s was the modem connection. The outside walls entirely of glass window with scary drop to streets below did nothing to keep out traffic noise and the noise of building work. But the noise inside was far worse. It started even before we got up in the morning and continued to the evening. Mostly drilling. We were told the work on was the 7th floor (which was not accessible) but in fact workman were everywhere including rooms on the 10th floor - when they saw guests coming they hid. While service staff were helpful and friendly the office and restaurent staff were surly and unhelpful. Other guests also complained about the noise and some had changed their rooms a number of times looking for something quieter. The bar certainly did not live up to the website description "guests are invited to relax in Hari's Bar where long happy hours and live entertainment are featured nightly." My husband tried it - with us escorting him but it was dingy and gloomy and the prices even higher than in the room. We soon left. My son put in a formal complaint since he had not been told about the building work when booking the hotel - he could then have chosen somewhere more appropriate to take his elderly parents - and on our last day the restaurant staff were attentive even obsequious and the office staff allowed us the use of both rooms to the evening - until we had to leave for the airport and and waived my husband's room bar bill. We did notice while waiting for the tour bus in another hotel that that also had 1970s decor and the noise of drilling. We were told that the hotels are suddenly faced with competion from new hotels being built.

Reviews.Title: “great Service, location”
Reviews.Author: Marin1
Reviews.Content: had special needs for my handicap mother, the hotel went out of their way to help and make it a wonder experience, everyone was so helpful. The added attention and the upgrade made it a wonderful experience. The location on Nathan Rd is perfect for getting around, taking the Star Ferry to Hong Kong, also I recommend the tour of Hong Kong. Roger the guide was funny and informative. It's a great way of seeing all of Hong Kong and getting info you would not normally know. The Chinese Restaurant at the hotel was not great, what was worse was the slow service for our hungry group. Make sure you get a room that's on the higher floor or your view is a ugly old building. The club floor service staff excellent. thanks to Maggie and staff, from housekeeping, to bellman, job well done. Carol Carlson-Ives

Reviews.Title: “convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diggadave
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night on a brief stop over on my way to Shanghai. The free shuttle bus from Kowloon Station is convenient, as others report and including the airport express ride from the airport to Kowloon it takes about 30-40 minutes from the airport. My first trip to HK so I can't compare this hotel with anywhere else, but I thought the staff were very helpful and the hotel's location is excellent for the metro (just across the road). I booked an executive room with a king bed (Chinese size) and it was small, but I was offered a larger room with two twin beds, which I am sure would have been larger. The club facilities on the 18th floor are ok, although the breakfast served up there was a limited. I did eat in the 1st floor restaurant overlooking Nathan Rd, and I can't say I would recommend it. Bland food.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain about anything”
Reviews.Author: dbrown007
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Rooms provide everything you could need, and anyway - who goes to Hong Kong to spend all the time in their room! The location can not be beaten - walk out the door and you are in the middle of Nathan Road. The harbour is only 10-15 minutes walk away and so are the Temple St night markets. The free hotel shuttle bus from Kowloon station is great - very frequent and never had to wait more than a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sized room”
Reviews.Author: r_ling
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and 5 nights at the Sheraton, after seeing a few bad reviews of this hotel here. Booked a king bed room and upon arrival, was upgraded to their newer renovated executive king bed room. Room was definitely a lot bigger than the Sheraton's, as was the bed. Location ideal, being right next to the MTR (metro/train) station. With the 3 day MTR tickets for HK$70 as part of the Airport Express train package, used the train for just about every thing, including to Disneyland. View - overlooking a rather delapidated building that doubles as a sweat shop. Breakfast buffet had a good selection. Pool - not heated and outdoors. Way too cold for this time of year to use. Room service - housekeeping slow to answer calls, but once request made, service is very efficient. Recommend it ahead of the Sheraton for price. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LikeDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 different occasions, with 2 kids (ages 9 & 11). This hotel gets 5 stars from me for location, accessibility, service, and rooms. Situated in an ideal place - right next to the MRT (which is the backbone to get anywhere in Hong Kong), around 3 blocks from the waterfront (where you can catch a ferry), surrounded by tons of shopping. There is a free shuttle bus service which runs continuously from Kowloon stattion (MRT) to the hotel & back. We never waited more than 10 mins. for the bus. Staff at the front desk are very courteous, helpful, and friendly. The same goes for housekeeping. Rooms are small, but comfortable. Beds are excellent, bathrooms very clean. Unfortunately, the hotel is surrounded by other buildings, so not much of a view. Overall good experience - we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: shoemaker
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Hong Kong many times, Holiday inn a couple of times, both times the rooms were small, about the size the of the bed, for the price stay at the sheraton!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Almaden
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Its right across the street from the MTR subway station which gets you anywhere in Hong Kong. Is also a short walk to the ferries which get you to Hong Kong Island (Star Ferry) , Macau, Lantau, etc.. There is unlimited shopping along Nathan Road just steps away from the hotel. Lots of good food options too. The hotel room itself was just fine, nothing special or fancy. The room size was actually quite large compared to the other hotel we stayed at which had almost no floor space at all. The hotel is surrounded by other large buildings so it doesn’t appear to have rooms with views. Our view was straight into an old dirty apartment building so our curtains remained closed. The Gym is very nice with lots of modern equipment and the rooftop pool also looked OK. The staff of the hotel was friendly and professional. If you look like a tourist, you will be hounded by people outside the hotel to buy fake Rolex watches and custom tailored suits. This location seems to be ground zero for that stuff where as we didn’t see any of it on the HK Island side. If you plan to be on the Kowloon side and don’t want to spend the dollars on the fancier places near the water, this is probably your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Vacationers_08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, but we had booked a room with double beds because of traveling with 2 children. Was told that it would be no problem getting the two beds, but on arrival we were told that they didn't have any but they would upgrade us to a suite with one King bed and a roll away bed ( at no charge) for an extra 1000.00 HKD a night. At this point we had no choice or we were going to have to try and stay somewhere else. Of course, we took it and the room was very clean, and it was extremely nice. Service was good, I thought the room service food was a bit expensive. I would recommend this hotel for single travelers but not families. As far as location it was very good, MTR right accross the street, stores in hotel and all along the road. Only one MTR stop from the night markets.
